description: Paine, Webber, Jackson & Curtis, Inc., one of the nation's most prominent brokerage houses, disclosed here yesterday that it was backing out of negotiations to take over 10 of a total of 19 branch offices planned to acquire from nancially troubled duPont Walston, Inc.

title: Bidge: New Zealand Team to Make Debut in World Title Play
description: Making its debut in the world team championship for the Bermuda Bowl in Venice next May will be the New Zealand team, which upset Australia in a recent playoff match.

title: Pompidou III: Protection
description: PARISOne may assume France's President Pompidou is not disposed to minimize problems posed for the military defense of the North Atlantic Treaty Area as a consequence of the new energy crisis and financial developments including a float of the French franc plus fading prospects for international monetary reform.

title: MINDSZENTY, 81, RELIEVED OF POST
description: ROME, Feb. 5Pope Paul VI today removed Jozsef Cardinal Mindszenty, the exiled foe of communism in Hungary from the jurisdiction he still nominally retained there, and from his honorary function as his nation's Roman Catholic primate.

title: Arms Talks to Resume Feb. 19; U.S. Officials Split on Posture
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 5The United States and the Soviet Union agreed today to resume the talks on limitations of strategic arms on Feb. 19 in Geneva. But the Nixon Administration reportedly remained far from resolving its differences on a new American negotiating position.

title: MBFR Deadlock
description: The resumption of EastWest negotiations on mutual force reductions in Central Europe finds both sides holding firmly to their initial positions.

title: State Democrats Press CampaignSpending Reform
description: ALBANY, Feb. 5  With repeated references to their string of failures in attempting to compete against the Rockefeller millions, the Democratic leaders of the Legislature today proposed stricter campaignspending limitations, including a ceiling of $100,000 in contributions from candidate's family assets.

title: U.S. Aide, Former P.O.W., Named Envoy to Mauritius
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 5 (UPI) Philip W. Manhard, a prisoner of the Vietcong for five years, was appointed by President Nixon today to be United States Ambassador to Mauritius.

title: Jersey Preparing Car Insurance Cut
description: TRENTON, Feb. 5  React ing to New Jersey's worsening gasoline crisis, Commissione, James J. Sheeran of the State Department of Insurance an nounced today that he was preparing a major rollback of automobile insurance costs tha most likely would exceed $100, million.

title: Dow Chemical Lists Record Profits; Other Companies Report on Earnings
Shipping/Mails
description: All Hours Given in Daylight Saving Time

title: Getty Donates Prize for Saving Wildlife
description: LONDON, Feb. 5A prize of $50,000 for services to the conservation of wildlife, donated by J. Paul Getty, was announced here today.

title: New District Attorney
description: Aggressiveness, both as prosecutor and as defense counsel, has been a conspicuous characteristic of Manhattan's newly designated District Attorney, Richard H. Kuh. The lawyer chosen by Governor Wilson to fill the gaping void left by the retirement of Frank S. Hogan is intelligent, articulate and energetic. He is also assertive in ways that many find abrasive.

title: Wife of Alioto, Back Home, Says She Disappeared to Punish Him
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Feb. 5 (UPI)The wife of Mayor Joseph Alioto returned home today and said, as her husband stood beside her with a strained smile, that she had disappeared for 15 days because she felt he was ignoring her and needed a little punishment.

title: Sports Today
description: Sports Today

title: Strike of Truck Drivers Makes 75,000 Jobless
description: The strike by independent truck drivers has forced the layoff of 75,000 workers across the country, bringing further damage to a national economy already buffeted by the effects of the energy crisis.

title: Astrid Varnay Returns In a Sparkling Elektra
description: CLEVELAND ORCHESTRA. Conducted by Lorin Maazel in concert version of Strauss's Elektra. At Carnegie Hall.

title: Leaders of Conservative Party Greet Wilson Enthusiastically
description: ALBANY, Feb. 5State Conservative party leaders beamed tonight at the rare sight of the Governor of New York calling on them solicitously and praising a multivoiced form of politics based on grays.

title: Schlesinger Links '75 Defense Budget To U.S. World Role
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 5 James R. Schlesinger, the Secretary of Defense, led off his defense of a record military budget today by observing that the psalmist tells us that where there is no vision, the people perish.

title: DeficitRidden Met Opera To Cut 197576 Season
description: The Metropolitan Opera, worried about its ability to keep its deficit down to manageable proportions, is planning a reduction of from four to six weeks in the length of the season beginning in the fall of 1975.

title: Mariner 10 Photos Show Hazy Venus
description: PASADENA, Calif., Feb. 5Mariner 10, carrying out its elaborate sequence of preprogramed orders in what seemed a flawless manner, swept around Venus today, sending back to the earth pictures showing Venus to be enveloped in what appeared a welldefined shell of haze.

title: SAUDI AIDE SEES NO PLEDGE TO U.S.
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Feb. 5Sheik Ahmed Zaki alYamani, Saudi Arabia's oil minister who is on a tour to explain Arab oil policies, declared here today that he had no knowledge of promises said to have been made by Arab oil producers to lift their embargo against the United States.

title: MRS. HAROLD PROSKEY
description: Mrs. Julie M. Proskey, widow of Harold Van Houten Proskey, a chemical industrialist, died lat her home here yesterday. She was 84 years old.

title: LESLIE M. STEELE
description: SHORT HILLS, N. J., Feb, 5 Leslie M. Steele, who retired in 1970 as executive vice presi dent of the Underwood Mortgage and Title Company, Irvington, died yesterday in Overlook Hospital, Summit. He was 75 years old and lived at 25 Burnside Drive.

title: Events Today
description: Films

title: Nixon Rebuffed in Attempt To Settle Trucker Strike
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 5 President Nixon ordered a monthlong freeze on prices of diesel fuel today in an effort to end the strike of independent truck operators, but their leaders rejected the settlement offer and called on drivers to continue to stand down.

title: PRIME RATE IS CUT BY CHEMICAL BANK
description: The Chemical Bank, the nation's sixth largest bank, announced yesterday afternnon that it was lowering its prime interest rate to 9 per cents, from 9 per cent, effective today.

title: COMPANY IS ORDERED TO SHIFT WASTE PLAN
description: MINNEAPOLIS, Feb. 5United States District Judge Miles W. Lord warned today that the Reserve Mining Company's discharge of asbestostype fibers from its Silver Bay, Minn., plant created a very substantial public health menace and ordered the company to produce an onland disposal system for its taconite waste.

title: L.I.R.R. Electrical Workers Stage FourHour Walkout
description: About 200 members of the International Brotherhood of Electrical Workers walked off the job for nearly four hours at two Long Island Rail Road shops yesterday in a dispute about contract provisions for medical examinations.

title: Goldin Delays Further Contracts For Work on Convention Center
description: The city's new Controller, Harrison J. Goldin, has directed that contracts for further work on the city's proposed $200million West Side convention center be held up pending resolution of legal issues, a spokesman for Mr. Goldin said last night.

title: LAW CENTER AIMS TO AID EDUCATION
description: NEWARK, Feb. 5What its sponsors call the first publicinterest law center in the nation specializing in educational problems opened for business here today.

title: All and Quarry Likely to Meet
description: A third heavyweight fight between Muhammad Ali and Jerry Quarry will probably be staged at Madison Square Garden next May, a reliable boxing source confirmed last night.

title: Canadeo, George, Lane, Groza Gain Hall of Fame
description: CANTON, Ohio, Feb. 5 (AP) Tony Canadeo, Bill George, Dick (Night Train) Lane and Lou (The Toe) Groza were named today to pro football's Hall of Fame.

title: New Books GENERAL
description: A Concise History of Canadian Painting by Dennis Reid (Oxford University, $9.50).

title: 41 Challenge Spasskyand One Wins
description: Like a storied gunman riding into town, Boris Spassky, the Soviet chess grandmaster, ended a brief visit here last night by facing down 41 of the city's brashest pawn slingers in a simultaneous tournament at Chess City.

title: Panama Meeting Raises U.S. Hopes for '74 Treaty
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 5  A high State Department official said today that the United States hoped to negotiate a new Panama Canal treaty with the Panamanian Government before the end of the year.

title: Advertising: Homelife Blighted
description: When InStore Publications launched Homelife magazine in New York last summer it seemed to be one of the best planned and researched magazine introductions in memory.

title: Notes on People
description: In less than 12 minutes, William J. Porter, Ambassadordesignate to Canada, breezed through his confirmation hearing before the Senate Foreign Relations Committee yesterday. The 59yearold career diplomat was praised for his record as a diplomat.

title: Manes Sues to Rectify DocumentFiling Laws
description: Borough President Donald H. Manes and 13 other Queens residents brought suit in Federal District Court in Brooklyn yesterday, challenging as discriminatory, excessive and burdensome the court fees collected from city residents by New York State for the filing of legal documents.

title: Peking Setting Up Criticism Groups To Spearhead Its New People's War
description: HONG KONG, Feb. 5 Reports from China describe the formation of small groups of activists to mobilize mass support for the campaign to criticize Lin Piao and Confucius, which is being presented as a people's war and a revolution in the spirit of the Cultural Revolution.

title: EXXON AND GULF RAISE FUEL PRIC
description: The domestic affiliates of ?? Exxon Corporation and ?? Gulf Oil Corporation, the large and fourth largest in the ?? dustry, raised wholesale pric of gasoline and heating oil ye?? terdayone day after Amo?? became the first major company to reduce prices since ?? imposition of the oil embarg against the United States la?? fall.

title: Yugoslavs Bolstering Authority of Party
description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia, Feb. 5A growing torrent of doctrinal verbiage is washing over the people of Yugoslavia as Communist leaders here seek to revitalize and strengthen the somewhat eroded authority of the party apparatus.

title: Cambodian Rebels Kill 12 in Shelling Of Refugee Camp
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia, Feb. 5 (Reuters)Communistled insurgents, slipping through the defense ring around Phnom Penh, shelled a refugee camp and a cigarette factory on the city's southeastern edge today.

title: 24HOUR SCHEDULE
description: The regional Federal Energy Office yesterday ordered major oil companies to make roundtheclock deliveries to gasoline stations in New York and New Jersey until shortages from truck picketing interruptions were overcome.

title: German Gang Again Raided
description: BERLIN, Feb. 5 (UPI)Policemen armed with submachine guns today raided suspected hideouts in West Berlin of the BaaderMeinhof gang, a leftwing anarchist group that has threatened a rocket attack on the World Cup soccer match in June between East and West Germany. Several persons were detained for identity checks. Fifteen suspects were arrested in raids on Monday.

title: BEAME AND NIXON TO MEET ON FARE
description: Mayor Beame will meet today with President Nixon and press for Federal funds to help save the 35cent transit fare and for added gasoline and fueloil allocations for the city.

title: Idealistic Prosecutor Richard Henry Kuh
description: In his penthouse apartment just off Washington Square, Richard H. KuhManhattan's new 52yearold District Attorneydesignate, was surrounded yesterday by his 36  year  old wife, his 80yearold mother, his 2  year  old son and infant daughter, his secretary and a young woman helping to cope with what Mr. Kuh called the madhouse in here today.

title: Ellmers Defense Seeks to Show Insecticide Fumes Affected Him
description: MORRISTOWN, Feb. 5The defense sought today to show that John Ellmers may have been affected by insecticide fumes the day his car hit three girls, killing two of them. Mr. Ellmers worked for ABCO, Inc., an exterminating concern.

title: BAR GROUP BACKS AID TO HIGH COURT
description: HOUSTON, Feb. 5The American Bar Association voted today to support the broad concept of a new national court of appeals to aid the Supreme Court, without committing its members to the details of any plan.

title: Nastase Suffers Painin His Arm And Heart, but Rakes in Prizes
description: The pain in Ilie Nastase's right arm has become almost as intense for him on serves and smashes these days as the personal heartache surrounding his fines and flareups with tennis linesmen and officials.

title: Arms Talks to Resume Feb. 19; U.S. Officials Split on Posture
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 5The United States and the Soviet Union agreed today to resume the talks on limitations of strategic arms on Feb. 19 in Geneva. But the Nixon Administration reportedly remained far from resolving its differences on a new American negotiating position.

title: Chocolate Candy Taken Off Market by Drug Unit
description: WASHINGTON, Fed. 5 (UPI) The Food and Drug Adminisaation said today that thouands of candy chocolate balls ere being recalled from the tarket because eating them buld cause fever, nausea, voming and diarrhen.

title: Mansfield Backed in Mail
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 5 (AP)The Senate Democratic leader, Mike Mansfield, said today that his mail was running 4 to 1 in favor of his Friday night reply to President Nixon's State of the Union Address. From his home state of Montana, he told reporters, the count is 30 to 1.

title: Purchase by Reserve Lifts Bill Market
description: Shortterm rates continued to back down yesterday as the Treasury Department moved into the first phase of this week's $4.05billion refinancing. Treasury bills were again strong. During the day, the Federal Reserve bought $225million of bills for a customer's account, a move that helped to strengthen the bill market. Trading on a whenissued basis, the Treasury's 7 per cent sevenyear notes were being quoted yesterday at a slight premium over issue price. Dealers also reported that outstanding issues in this range of Government maturities were up about 4.32ds of a point.

title: Credit Lifts Airline's Net
description: Continental Airlines, Inc, announced yesterday a 1973 net income of $5.34million, or 41 cents a share. This included a $5.23million special credit resulting in a change made by management in the company's accounting procedures to take advantage of investment tax credits.

title: EgyptianKuwaiti Unit Set
description: CAIRO, Feb. 5 (UPI)  The Cabinet decided today to set up a joint EgyptianKuwaiti investment company with capital of $25million, Government sources said. A threehour meeting also agreed in principle to establish another EgyptianLibyan company for investments in the fields of industry and transport, the sources said.

title: PETROSIAN DEFEATS PORTISCH IN GAME 9
description: PALMA DE MAJORCA, Spain, Feb. 5 (AP)Tigran Petrosian of the Soviet Union today defeated Lajos Portisch of Hungary for the second time in the quarterfinals of the world chess championship.

title: DEMOCRATS FIGHT FALL PRIMARY BID
description: ALBANY, Feb. 5An or dinary bit of Senate procedure, the preliminary reading of a bill on the calendar, sparked a long and bitter debate this afternoon when Democratic Senators realized that Calendar No. 183 was the bill establishing a September primary and that the Republican majority had moved it to the floor without advance word or public hearings.

title: Stocks Decline Slightly; Gold Issues Rise Again
description: The stock market settled for a slight loss yesterday as gold issues again were the strongest group, reflecting higher bullion prices in European markets.

title: Problems He Inherited Beset Chapin of Met
description: In the New York musical community there is general sympathy for the plight of Schyyler Chapin, the general manager of the Metropolitan Opera, who faces both economic and artistic problems. It is realized that he has inherited a series of problems that were not of his making. This season and the following were largely prepared by the late Goeran Gentele, Mr. Chapin's predecessor, and Rafael Kubelik, the company's music director, and many things have not worked out as intended. Mr. Chapin is the first to admit that he is learning on the job; he has had little experience with international opera and is still feeling his way.

title: MINDSZENTY, 81, RELIEVED OF POST
description: ROME, Feb. 5Pope Paul VI today removed Jozsef Cardinal Mindszenty, the exiled foe of communism in Hungary from the jurisdiction he still nominally retained there, and from his honorary function as his nation's Roman Catholic primate.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: One hundred and twenty former convicts, exaddicts and patients in methadonetreatment programs, normally considered unemployable, have been trained and sent out to remove rat infestation from 225 blocks in five rundown areas of the city.

title: G.I. Benefit Rise Gains
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 5 (AP) A 13.6 per cent increase in G.I. bill education benefits for Vietnamera veterans was ap?? today by the House Veterans Affairs Committee.

title: Memphis W.F.L. Club Likely to Move
description: NEWPORT BEACH, Calif., Feb. 5 (AP)A switch in a World Football League franchise from Memphis to Portland, Ore., appeared likely today as the new organization held the second phase of its collegiate draft.

title: Abigail Adams Homans of Presidents' Family Dies
ROCKEFELLER TO GO ON STUMP FOR ERR
description: Former Gov. Nelson A. Rockefeller said yesterday he would campaign for Republicans in New York and other states, but reiterated he would not use the Commission on Critical Choices for Americans as a political vehicle.

title: Soviet Hotels for Eaton?
description: Cyrus S. Eaton Jr., the Cleveland financier, has held talks in Moscow that are believed to be aimed at the construction of a series of luxury hotels in the Soviet Union. Page 49.

title: SILVER FUTURES JUMP NEW LIMIT
description: Heavy speculative buying forced silver futures up the new limit of 15 cents an ounce yesterday, continuing the strong upsurge in prices.

title: Ryder and Toro Reach Accord On a $10Million Acquisition
description: Ryder System, Inc., one of the nation's largest truck renting and leasing concerns, announced yesterday that it had reached an agreement to acquire the Toro Petroleum Corportation of Houston.

title: Soling Class Title to Elvstrom
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Feb. 5 (UPI)Paul Elvstrom, the Danish yachtsman, clinched victory today in the World Soling Class championships when he finished second the seventh and final heat sailed off Palm Beach.

title: Books of The Times
description: THE WRITER'S CRAFT. Edited by John Hersey. 425 pages. Knopf. $10

title: Persian Gulf Oil Shipments Off 7.4% During December Cuts, I. L. A. Says
description: Oil shipments from, the Perman Gulf in December were about 7.4 per cent below the September level, the last month before the Arabs announced production cutbacks and embargoes against the United States and the Netherlands, according to a study commissioned by the International Longshoremen's Association.

title: Class's Project Turns Up A Skull and Mystery, Too
description: TRENTON, Feb. 5A show and tell science projecta routine part of modern educationproduced a bundle of bones and a skull, possibly human, with a bullet in it at St. Joachiam's School today.

title: DeficitRidden Met Opera To Cut 197576 Season
description: The Metropolitan Opera, worried about its ability to keep its deficit down to manageable proportions, is planning a reduction of from four to six weeks in the length of the season beginning in the fall of 1975.

title: CITY'S TRANSIT UNION STARTS WAGE TALKS
description: The Transport Workers Union and the Transit Authority began contract negotiations yesterday that could have a significant impact on the 35cent fare as well as on the wages and working conditions of 37,000 bus and subway workers.

title: RUSSEL WOODWARD
description: Russel Woodward, former executive vice president of Peters Griffin Woodward, Inc., television station representatives, died yesterday in Sarasota, Fla., where he had been living. He was 71 years old and a former resident of New York and East Hampton, L. I.

title: ews Summary and Index WEDNESDAY, FEBRUARY 6, 1974
description: The United States and the Soviet Union agreed yesterday to resume strategicarms talks on Feb. 19 in Geneva. But officials indicated in interviews that the Nixon Administration had yet to resolve its differences over the American/negotiating position. [Page 1, Columns 45.]

title: Decontrol Fiasco
description: Nearly three years and 400,000 runaway rents later, a commission named by former Governor Rockefeller has studied the effects of the Rockefellersponsored vacancydecontrol law and pronounced it a fiasco.

title: Democrat a Narrow Victor for House
description: JOHNSTOWN, Pa., Wednesday, Feb. 6  John P. Murtha, a Democrat and Vietnam war veteran, has apparently won the year's first Congressional election with a narrow, 220vote victory here yesterday over his Republican opponent, Harry M. Fox.

title: Socialism in Vancouver: Creeping, Not Galloping
description: VANCOUVER, British ColumbiaRobert A. Williams, the resources minister in British Columbia's yearold provincial government, recently told his party's annual convention:

title: Raise for Sugar Workers
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 5 (UPI) The Agriculture Department announced today approval of a raise for sugarbeet field workers, including a 7 per cent increase in minimum hourly rates.

title: NEWS INDEX
description: News Summary and Index, Page 39

title: People in Sports: An Aging Hero Says Farewell to the Pirates
description: Bill Mazeroski, who last season was thirdbase coach for the Pittsburgh Pirates after having spent 17 years as their second baseman, is retiring. The 38yearold former star said he wanted to spend more time with his family.

title: CITY WILL WIDEN SCHOOL PHYSICALS
description: Dr. Lowell E. Bellin, the city's new Health Commissioner, has disclosed that the Health Department plans to undertake early comprehensive medical screening of schoolchildren, including urinalysis and tests for anemia, sicklecell anemia and lead poisoning.

title: Man, 34, Is Charged With Armed Holdup Of Doctor's Office
description: The midafternoon holdup of a doctor's office on the East Side, involving $3,525 in cash and jewelry yesterday, led to the arrest of a 34yearold man believed by the police to be linked with many similar robberies.

title: Crow on Charger Staff
description: SAN DIEGO, Feb. 5 (AP)John David Crow, who set running records at Texas A. and M. and as a professional football player, was named today as offensive coordinator of the San Diego Chargers. The 39yearold offensive backfield coach of the Cleveland Browns is the fourth aide named by Tommy Prothro, the Chargers' new head coach.

title: Strike Has Varied Impact in Ohio
description: YOUNGSTOWN, Ohio, Feb. 5Mrs. Jack Lipari looked in vain today for Great Northern beans and bananas at one of the Fazio stores, the city's largest supermarket chain.

title: Rockets Triumph Over Spurs, 8279
description: DENVER, Feb. 5 (AP)Ralph Simpson scored 29 points tonight as he paced the Denver Rockets to an 8279 American Basketball Association victory over the San Antonio Spurs.

title: Nan, 34, Is Charged With Armed Holdup Of Doctor's Office
description: The midafternoon holdup of a doctor's office on the East Side, involving $3,525 in cash and jewelry, led to the arrest of a 34yearold man believed by the police to be linked with many similar robberies.

title: Administration Fuel Dilemma: How to Raise Supply Without Letting Prices Go Too High
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 5The truckers' protest against rising fuel prices and scarce supplies reveals the dilemma in the Nixon Administration's energyprices policy.

title: Credit Investigators Say They Had to Falsify Data
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 5Four former investigators for the nation's largest credit investigative company told a Sentae hearing today of being forced to falsify credit reports and I meet unrealistic reporting goals to keep their jobs.

title: Moderate Quake Jars Alaska
description: PALMER, Alaska, Feb. 5 (UPI)A moderate earthquake was felt in Palmer, Anchorage and Fairbanks yesterday, but no damage was reported. The Palmer Observatory said the quake was recorded at 7:25 Pacific daylight time, with an epicenter 70 miles north of here. It registered 4.8 on the Richter Scale.

title: Showdown in Britain
description: It would be hard to exaggerate the economic and political debacle that confronts Britain with the union decision to call the nation's 260,000 coal miners out on strike at midnight Saturday. The miners' refusal since November to work overtime at existing wages has already cost Britain nine million tons of coalthe source for 70 per cent of its electric powerand has prompted the Government to invoke a threeday work week.

title: Pro Transactions
description: BASEBALL

title: DOLLAR UP IN EUROPE BUT DOWN IN JAPAN
description: LONDON, Feb. 5 (UPI)The British pound weakened against the United States dollar in late trading today on the news of Britain's impending nationwide coal strike. The dollar gained against several other major European currencies, and gold surged ahead.

title: Charter Flights Carry Beef to the East Coast
description: CHICAGO, Feb. 5 (UPI)United Air Lines began today to charter foodlift flights to carry meat to the East Coast for supermarkets caught short by the truckers' strike.

title: PPG Sets PRO Supplies
description: PITTSBURGH, Feb. 5 (UPI)PPG Industries, Inc., said today it had reached a longterm interim agreement with the Commonwealth Oil Refining Company concerning feed stock supplies for their jointly owned Puerto Rico Olefins Company.

title: 72 New York State Paintings Exhibited As Executive Mansion's New Collection
description: ALBANY, Feb. 5They hung seven paintings of the Ashcan School in Malcolm Wilson's Executive Mansion here today, in the place where, during the Rockefeller years, one work had hung  Picasso's Guernica tapestry.

title: Kuh Appointed Manhattan Prosecutor; Scotti, Chagrined, Planning to Retire
description: Governor Wilson appointed Richard H. Kuh yesterday as Manhattan's first new District Attorney since World War II.

title: NIXON REPORTED REFUSING TO GIVE DATA TO JAWORSKI
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 5 President Nixon has reportedly refused to turn over requested White House tape recordings and other evidence to the Watergate special prosecutor, and thus is apparently headed for another major confrontation.

title: YOUTH SAYS HE SAW 2 POLICEMEN SHOT
description: A 17yearold high school student testified yesterday that he had seen Police Officers Gregory Foster and Rocco Laurie slain on a Lower East Side street two years ago.

title: A Rich Isolated Old Man Views His Life and Oil
description: WOKING, England  The old man advanced into the room slowly, his head bent forward, his right hand held out to be shaken. He seated himself carefully in a yellow armchair beside the fireplace, where a log fire burned.

title: Hawks' Maravich Suspended Indefinitely by His Coach
description: Pete Maravich, who was a showboat in college and now is one of the National Basketball Association's major attractions, was suspended yesterday by Cotton Fitzsimmons, his Atlanta Hawk coach. Although the suspension has been listed as indefinitely, the coach of the struggling Hawks said he expected everything would be straightened out between Pete and myself in time for Friday night's game against the 76ers in Philadelphia.

title: Excerpts From Moorer Letter on Military Snooping and Kissinger Statement
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 5Following are excerpts from a letter sent Jan. 30 by Adm. Thomas H. Moorer, Chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff, to Senator John C. Stennis, chairman of the Senate Armed Services Committee, dealing with the allegations of military snooping inside the White House, and excerpts from a statement made Jan. 29 by Secretary of State Kissinger before the Senate Foreign Relations Committee in closed session:

title: People and Business
description: There were reports in railroad industry circles yesterday that Albert V. Casey, president of The Times Mirror Company, was being sounded out by the Department of Transportation about taking the job of chairman of the new United States Railway Association.

title: BID TO END DEBATE ON GENOCIDE FAILS
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 5The Senate failed today to break a sporadic filibuster that has blocked ratification of a 25yearold United Nations agreement to outlaw genocide.

title: Briefs on Energy
description: City Panel on Residual Oil Set Up

title: OIL CRISIS CALLED AN INDUSTRY PLOT
description: TRENTON, Feb. 5  Angry housewives, students and independent gasolinestation operators charged at a public hearing today that the big American oil companies had contrived the oil shortage to raise prices and profits.

title: Sales of New Cars Declined by 21.5% For Late January
description: DETROIT, Feb. 5Domestic newcar sales were off 21.5 per cent in late January but auto executives and dealers said they detected signs of a slight improvement compared with the performance of previous weeks.

title: DAIRYMEN REPORT BIG LOBBYING FUND
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 5Two dairy industry lobbying groups, whose pledges to President Nixon's reelection campaign stirred lawsuits and investigations, have reported that they have more than $1.5million available for further political activity.

title: The European Statement
description: BRUSSELS, Feb. 5Following, in unofficial translation from the French, is the text of the negotiating position adopted by the Council of Ministers of the European Economic Community today for the Washington conference of major oilconsuming countries next Monday and Tuesday:

title: CLASSIFIED ADVERTISING INDEX
description: Classified pages distributed in metropolRan New York and adiacent territory.

title: $1.5Billion Accepted At Sale by Treasury
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 5The Treasury has accepted $1.5billion of $3billion of tenders received from the public for the sevenyear 7 per cent notes auctioned today.

title: State to Accuse 4 Oil Concerns Of a ShortageforProfit Scheme
description: Attorney General Louis J. Lefkowitz is expected to charge four major oil companies today with a scheme to contrive a shortage of home heating oil and to raise prices in the New York area.

title: CITY WILL WIDEN SCHOOL PHYSICALS
description: Dr. Lowell E. Bellin, the city's new Health Commissioner, has disclosed that the Health Department plans to undertake early comprehensive medical screening of schoolchildren, including urinalysis and tests for, anemia, sicklecell anemia and lead poisoning.

title: S.E.C. FILES A SUIT AGAINST ABATRONIX
description: The Securities and Exchange Commission filed a complaint yesterday in the United States District Court here against Abatronix, Inc., of Stamford, Conn., a manufacturer of elec. tronic calculators; the company's New York underwriter, and a union welfare fund for violation of the Securities and Exchange Act of 1933.

title: WESTCHESTER BANK APPROVES A MERGER
description: Stockholders of the First Westchester National Bank, New Rochelle, N.Y., at a special meeting yesterday overwhelmingly approved the proposed merger of the bank with Barclays Bank of New York, a subsidiary of Barclays Bank International, Ltd., London.

title: Japan's Dependence on Oil Is Raising Concern Over Her Economy
description: TOKYO, Feb. 5Despite the rise in the cost of petroleum, Japan is still likely to remain overwhelmingly dependent on imported oil for her energy needs at least through the next decade and perhaps until the end of the century, experts here believe.

title: A NEW PRISONER PACT ANNOUNCED IN SAIGON
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, the South Vietnamese GovernFeb. 5 (AP)  Negotiators for ment and the Vietcong agreed today to exchange more than 4,000 civilian and military prisoners over a threeweek period beginning Friday, the Vietcong announced.

title: Dance: Nikolais Season
description: Two dance companiesthe Nikolais Dance Theater and the Murray Louis Dance Companyare sharing a Broadway season at the beautiful and cosy Lyceum Theater. The season started out last night with the Nikolais troupe giving the world premiere of CrossFade and two standa?? from the Nikolais repertory, the Suite From Sanctum and Tower, both nearly 10 years old now.

title: Granddaughter of Hearst Abducted by 3
description: BERKELEY, Calif., Feb. 5A granddaughter of the late William Randolph Hearst was abducted from her apartment last night by a white woman and two black men who covered their escape with rifle fire, the police said today.

title: COSTA RICAN VICTOR NAMING HIS CABINET
description: SAN JOSE, Costa Rica, Feb. 5 (UPI)With enough votes in the presidential elections to put him safely above the 40 per cent minimum required for election on the first ballot, Daniel Oduber Quirs named his first cabinet member today. He cautiously refused to make a victory statement, however, until the vote count removed all doubts about his election.

title: Licata Tops Griffith for U.S. Crown
description: BOSTON, Feb. 5 (AP)Tony Licata of New Orleans, employing an accurate left hand, won the United States middleweight title by outpointing the fivetime world champion, Emile Griffith in a fastmoving 12rounder tonight at Boston Garden.

title: Contract Awards
description: The Foster Wheeler Corporation reported yesterday receipt of a contract for $18.5million for design, engineering and fabrication of a 650,000kilowatt coalfired steam generator for the Allegheny Power System at its New Pleasants station at Willow Island, W. Va.

title: ALOI GETS 9 YEARS FOR STOCK FRAUD
description: Vincent Alol received a prison sentence of nine years in a stockfraud case yesterday after the prosecution described him as the acting head of an organized crime family in New York.

title: COAST PROSECUTORS CONFER WITH KROGH
description: LOS ANGELES, Feb. 5Lawyers from the office of District Attorney Joseph L. Busch talked for six hours in Washington yesterday with Egil Krogh Jr. as he began serving a sixmonth prison sentence for his role in the 1971 burglary of the office of Dr. Daniel Ellsberg's former psychiatrist.

title: RENTLAW REPEAL URGED IN ALBANY
description: ALBANY, Feb. 5The Temporary State Commission on Living Costs and the Economy recommended today the repeal of vacancy decontrol, which allows rents to rise when a tenant moves out, and a rollback in rental bases to Jan. 1, 1973 levels.

title: Physician Acquittedin Patient's Death
description: MINEOLA, L. I., Feb. 5Dr. Vincent A. Montemarano was found not guilty today in the death of Eugene Bauer, a terminally ill cancer patient at the Nassau County Medical Center.

title: Buckley Bars Times Bid for Tax Data
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 5Senator James L. Buckley of New York today strongly turned down as an invasion of privacy a New York Times request for information on his personal finances.

title: Solzhenitsyn's ExWife Says Gulag Is Folklore
description: PARIS, Feb. 5 (Reuters)Aleksandr I. Solzhenitsyn's controversial new book on Soviet prisoncamps was described as folklore by his former wife in an interview published here today.

title: PEAT, MARWICK ASKS ADDED CLIENT DATA
description: Peat, Marwick, Mitchell & Co., the prestigious national accounting firm, took the unusual step yesterday of asking a major client to provide financial information the company did not make available in dayearlier announcement.

title: Amex and OTC Prices Drop; Exchange Index Down by 0.39
description: Prices dropped again yesterday on the American Stock Exchange and in the overtheminter market in quiet trading.

title: David Eisenhower Says Nixon Will Never Quit
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 5 (UPI) President Nixon will not resign even if impeached by the House of Representatives, his soninlaw, David Eisenhower, said today.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: Del Insko, president of the Harness Drivers Association of America, yesterday requested a postponement of attending the private hearings being conducted by the New York State Racing and Wagering Board. The hearings are being held in connection with the indictments of harness drivers for allegedly conspiring with a betting ring that allegedly fixed races at Yonkers and Roosevelt last year. Insko requested the postponement, from his home in South Beliot, Ill., because private business prevented him from appearing.

title: RentStrikePlagued Stella Wright To Be Shut by Newark Housing Unit
description: NEWARK, Feb. 5The Newark Housing Authority announced today that it would close down the Stella Wright Housing Project April 7 and leave 700 families to fend for themselves.

title: Mariner 10 Photos Show Hazy Venus
description: PASADENA, Calif., Feb. 5Mariner 10, carrying out its elaborate sequence of preprogramed orders in what seemed a flawless manner, swept around Venus today, sending back to the earth pictures showing Venus to be enveloped in what appeared a welldefined shell of haze.

title: Knicks Down Suns, 10690, Halting Rally
description: For the second game in a row, the Knicks could not stand prosperity but wound up victors on the strength of their fabled defensive play, defeating the Phoenix Suns, 10690, last night before a crowd of 18,884 at Madison Square Garden.

title: Bank Trust Divisions Face Proposed Rules
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 5 (Reuters)  The Controller of the Currency, James E. Smith, said his office was considering requiring bank trust departments to disclose their asset holdings and transactions in securities.

title: Market Place More Weakness In Realty Trusts
description: When the housing industry experiences the twin burdens of slow sales and slow rentals, builders sometimes strain to meet their construction loan payments.

title: TRENTON DISTRICTS ARE RULED INVALID
description: TRENTON, Feb. 5  Judge George Y. Schoch of Superio Court ruled today that Trenton's school districts were in valid and enjoined schoo boards from holding election until a new districting plan was instituted.

title: Music: Philadelphians' Odds and Ends
description: Claudio Abbado's Program Monday night, when he conducted the Philadelphia Orchestra at Avery Fisher Hall, had a weird and scrappy look on papa. But Mr. Abbado pieced the five oddly assorted works together into an interestingly offbeat concert.

title: 24HOUR SCHEDULE
description: The regional Federal Energy Office yesterday ordered major oil companies to make roundtheclock deliveries to gasoline stations in New York and New Jersey until shortages from truck picketing interruptions were overcome.

title: Jersey Preparing Car Insurance Cut
description: TRENTON, Feb. 5  Reacting to New Jersey's worsening gasoline crisis, Commissioner James J. Sheeran of the State Department of Insurance announced today that he was preparing a major rollback of automobile insurance costs that most likely would exceed $100million.

title: Eliot Feld Is Forming New Ballet
description: A new ballet company headed by the choreographer Eliot Feld is being formed with financial support from the Rockefeller Foundation and an offer of performing and rehearsal space from Joseph Papp of the New York Shakespeare Festival.

title: Plan of Conferees To Cut Oil Prices Opposed by Simon
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 5 (AP) William E. Simon, the Federal energy administrator, indicated to SenateHouse conferees today that he opposed their plan for a rollback in oil prices, but declined to say whether he would recommend a Presidential veto of the emergency energy bill to which the rollback amendment was added.

title: Horses & Equipment
description: REG. BAY Thorobred Gelding, 7 yrs old, 16.3, eligible for 1st year green & amateur owner. 516 CU 54876; 516 CU 54643, 516 9310803 (Barn).

title: Article 1  No Title
description: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yesterday was:

title: How Nixon Endures
description: WASHINGTONRichard Nixon has endured all these years because he bends but never breaks. He likes to sound rigid and consistent in his rigidity, but in practice he makes a virtue of flexibility and inconsistency, and his new budget is just the latest evidence of the point.

title: Magazine Is Said to Pay $100,000 for Agnew Novel
description: The Ladies Home Journal has greed to serialize Spiro T. Agnew's first novel with the initial excerpt appearing in the May issue, publishing industry informants reported yesterday.

title: NIXON REPORTED REFUSING TO GIVE DATA TO JAWORSKI
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 5 President Nixon has reportedly refused to turn over requested White House tape recordings and other evidence, and thus is apparently headed for another major confrontation with the Watergate special prosecutor.

title: KISSINGER TO VISIT MOSCOW IN MARCH
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 5The White House announced today that Secretary of State Kissinger would visit Moscow late next month to prepare for President Nixon's return trip to the Soviet Union, expected in June.

title: U.N. ESTABLISHING SUEZ BUFFER AREA Begins to Move Into the Zone and Inspect Thinning Out of Forces on Each Side
description: CAIRO, Feb. 5The United Nations command announced today that its troops moved yesterday into an area on the eastern bank of the Suez Canal that will eventually be part of a buffer zone between the Egyptian and Israeli armies.

title: Eaton Talks Said to Involve Building Soviet Hotels
description: Cyrus S. Eaton Jr., the Cleveland financier, has held talks in Moscow believed to be aimed at the construction of a series of luxury hotels in the Soviet Union.

title: Saigon Rejects Peking's Claim to the Spratly Islands
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Feb. 5 (Reuters)  The South Vietnamese Government today rejected a Chinese claim to the Spratly Islands and reasserted its sovereignty over them.

title: Smith Ousts Aussie Rival In Two Sets
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla., Feb. 5 (UPI)Stan Smith defeated Barry PhillipsMoore of Australia in straight sets tonight in the first round of the $50,000 World Championship Tennis tour event. Smith, playing in borrowed shoes, won by 63, 62.

title: Business Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 5Legislation that would establish a class of Federally chartered stock savings and loan associations and allow their conversion from the traditional mutual, or depositorowned, form to common stock ownership was sent to Congress today by the Federal Home Loan Bank Board.

title: Lombardi Service Area Dedicated on Turnpike
description: RIDGEFIELD, Feb. 5  The New Jersey Turnpike dedicated the new Vince Lombardi service area here today with a turnout of sports figures and a brave show of band music against a backdrop of six gasoline pump islands that will probably not ring up anything like the revenue originally projected for them, at least in the immediate future.

title: AbdulJabbar
description: CLEVELAND, Feb. 5 (AP)  Kareem AbdulJabbar scored 33 points and led a secondperiod comeback as the Milwaukee Bucks defeated the Cleveland Cavaliers, 10287, in a National Basketball Association game tonight.

title: Namath Takes On A New Promotion
description: Perhaps it was inevitable. Joe Namath, the nation's No. 1 bachelor quarterback, who has endorsed hot chocolate, shaving cream, a popcorn popper and a reclining chair, has now lent his name to sheets and pillowcases.

title: PensionFund Curb Is Opposed
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 5The heads of the trust and investment departments of two of New York's largest banks told a Senate securities panel today that legislative limitation on stock holdings of pension fund managers would defeat their purpose and further confuse the unsettled equity market.

title: Pirates Hire Lipon
description: PITTSBURGH, Feb. 5 (UPI)  The Pittsburgh Pirates named Johnny Lipon, former Detroit shortstop and former Cleveland manager, as manager of their Salem, Va., team in the Carolina League today.

title: Massachusetts to Start Rationing Plan Monday
description: Massachusetts moved yesterday to begin a voluntary gasoline rationing program next week, joining the list of gasolinestarved states in the Northeast contemplating such a move.

title: York College Opening Its Science Building
description: York College, for nearly a decade the controversial gypsy and panhandler of the city's senior colleges, will send down roots today and end its wanderings when students troop into gleaming laboratories and lecture rooms to open the college's science building in Jamaica, Queens.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: GOOD BREEDING The Japanese upper classes; that the nobility, the scholars, the Imperial family and the Buddhist order members, were raised in a courtly tradition that, in addition to other things, stressed calligraphy, literature and esthetics. One hundred handsome items representing this tradition are now on show (through March 17) at Japan House, 333 West 47th Street (8321155).

title: Thoeni Captures Ski Title
description: ST. MORITZ, Switzerland, Feb. 5The Italian Army, led by Sgt. Gustavo Thoeni, attacked on skis today and won the battle of the men's giant slalom in the world Alpine championships.

title: Scoring Leaders
description: NATIONAL HOCKEY LEAGUE

title: On ChiefExecutiveship
description: WASHINGTONTo appreciate the depth of President Nixon's personal predicament, it is essential to understand the Presidential staff system and the vantage point of Presidents.

title: And the Female of the Species
description: Just about a year ago, accredited patriots like the Daughters of the American Revolution, the Brotherhood of Sleeping Car Porters and the AquaVelva Aftershave Corporation were denouncing Jesse P. Abramson as a rascally yeaforsooth knave; a inugwumpian, lilylivered subversive. The failure of some foot racers to stand at attention for the national anthem at a track meet in Nassau Coliseums had caused a flap, and Mr. Abramson had the audacity to suggest omitting the old drinking song from the program as insurance against such unpleasantness at the United States Olympic invitation meet, which he runs.

title: W.F.L. Club Signs George Saner Jr.
description: BOSTON, Feb. 5 (UPI)The Boston Bulls of the World Football League have announced the signing of a former New York Jet wide receiver, George Sauer Jr., to a multi year contract.

title: About New York The West Side Intellectuals
description: A woman who applied for a job at Dun & Bradstreet last week told a vice president that she lived at 89th Street and West End Avenue. He pondered this for a while, and then, being a Westchester man, he asked her what it was like that far uptown. She said that Columbia University and Harlem were to the north and Lincoln Center to the south, and that all about her were people with big dogs. She did not mention the intellectuals and artists who were there, too.

title: Europeans, Setting Stance for Oil Talks, Rebuff U.S,
description: BRUSSELS, Feb. 5The nine member countries of the European Common Market agreed today on the position they will take at the oil consumers' conference in Washington next week, but they identified their objective in terms that amounted to a rebuff to the United States.

title: Stella Wright Housing Project Will Be Shut Down by Newark
description: NEWARK, Feb. 5The Newark Housing Authority announced today that it would close down the Stella Wright Housing Project April 7 and leave 700 families to fend for themselves.

title: York College Opening Its Science Building
description: York College, for nearly a decade the controversial gypsy and panhandler of the city's senior colleges, will send down roots today and end its wanderings when students troop into gleaming laboratories and lecture rooms to open the college's science building in Jamaica, Queens.

title: A U.S. Base in Indian Ocean To Be Set Up on British Isle
description: LONDON, Feb. 5A United States base is to be set up on Diego Garcia, a British island in the Indian Ocean 1,000 miles off the southern tip of India.

title: Met. College Hockey
description: STANDING OF THE TEAMS

title: CITY COUNCIL ENDS ITS VOTE BY PROXY
description: The City Council, in a lastminute switch, voted yesterday to eliminate all proxy voting a course long advocated by good government groups.

title: The Prosecutor's Reply
description: Once again, an apparently definitive Presidential statement has been rendered inoperative by the facts. In his State of the Union Address, President Nixon proclaimed: As you know, I have provided to the special prosecutor voluntarily a great deal of material. I believe that I have provided all the material that he needs to conclude his investigations ... This week, replying to a contradictory estimate by the special prosecutor, the White House conceded that it still has not given him more tapes and documents he considers relevant to his inquiry. Last night a reported Presidential decision to withhold the requested data presaged a new crisis in efforts to get at the truth in the Watergate scandals.

title: Parking Rule Suspended
description: The threehour, alternatesideof thestreet parking regulation will be suspended today, as they were yesterday, the Traffic Department announced. Officials said, however, that all other parking regulations remain in effect.

title: A Rich Isolated Old Man Views His Lifeand Oil
description: WOKING, England  The old man advanced into the room slowly, his head bent forward, his right hand held out to be shaken. He seated himself carefully in a yellow armchair beside the fireplace, where a log fire burned.

title: Swindle Victim T ells Jury Of Fear to Go to Mackell
description: A victim of Joseph Ferdinando's getrichquick scheme, fearful of reporting it to the Queens District Attorney's office told a jury yesterday that she had gone instead to the Bronx District Attorney's office because she believed that former Queens Distrct Attorney Thomas J. Mackell and others had invested in the scheme and would take no action.

title: House Panel Backs Shift On Federal Aid to Schools
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 5After a year of struggle internally and with the Administration, the House Education and Labor Committee approved today a bill to replace the Federal Government's major education law.

title: I'll Meetcha at Toots'
description: It would be easy to rag Mr. Beame for those highly publicized miscues that nearly tripped him up before he had an official leg to stand on. That would be the popular way, to make merry of Dinkins, Galiber and Terry, but like the head coach I eschew it. I will not savage the new Mayor for what reasonable men recognize as a contretemps. I come to praise him for already redeeming substantially his ultimate pledge to the citizenryto restore New York City to its past.

title: F.P.C. SEEKS DATA ON GAS RESERVES
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 5A sharply divided Federal Power Commission has moved for the first time to force individual natural gas producers to make public the extent of their natural gas reserves.

title: Sports Under FullCourt Press As Lawsuits Keep Increasing
description: What might be termed a fullcourt zone press has increasingly embroiled major professional sports, with legal actions in progress in hockey, basketball, football and baseball.

title: Billie Jean Scolded for Outburst
description: Mrs. Billie Jean King's latest outburst against umpires and linesmen drew a strong response yesterday from Jack Stater, chairman of the umpires' committee for the United States Lawn Tennis Association.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: Bargaining Limited for State Employes

title: Norris to Coach Trinity
description: SAN ANTONIO, Tex., Feb. 5 (AP)Gene Norris, an assistant coach at Trinity University since 1961, was named today as head football coach.

title: Satyendranath Bose, 80, Dies; Physicist Influenced Einstein
description: CALCUTTA, India, Feb. 5 (AP)  Satyendranath Bose, theoretical physicist who influenced the work of Albert Einstein, died yesterday at the age of 80.

title: Police Search for 3 Men In Mosque Slayings Here
description: The police continued their search for three men late yesterday in connection with the shooting deaths of four persore at the Ya Sin Mosque in Brooklyn.

title: Palmer Set To Play in Hope Golf
description: PALM SPRINGS, Calif., Feb. 5 (AP)Arnold Palmer, 44 years old, bespectacled and obviously in the twilight of a legendary career, seeks to defend the only current title he holds against the assault of pro golf's victoryhungry young lions this week in the Bob Hope Desert Classic.

title: Gunman Kills Fire Chief
description: GLADEWATER, Tex., Feb. 5 (UPI)Fire Chief Harlod Potts was killed and two of his firemen were wounded today by shots fired from inside a lounge after they had extinguished a fire at the stablishment, Neither of the two wounded firemen was seriously hurt. The shooting occurred at Betty's Lounge on U.S. Route 271 about, 2:45 A.M. Despite efforts to track down the gunman, no arrests had been made several hours after the fire.

title: LYDIA SOKOLOVAR, BALLERINA, DEAD
description: LONDON, Feb. 5  Lydia Sokolova, one of the leading dancers of the Diaghilev Ballet, died Saturday at her home in Sevenoaks, Kent. She was 77 years old.

title: HEYKAL ACCUSED OF POWERSEEKING
description: CAIRO, Feb. 5Mohammed Hassanein Heykal, who lost his job as editor of Al Ahram last Friday, was accused today of having tried to turn his newspaper into a power center that was tantamount to a state within the state.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Realty Tax: The People Are Hurting

title: NEWS INDEX
description: News Summary and Index, Page 39

title: PANS OF MAE GET INTO THE ACT
description: Audience behavior somewhat marred the precedentsetting appearance of the singer Melanie at the Metropolitan Opera House on Sunday. Melanie enthusiasts, fiercely loyal, have a collective habit of invading the stage during her performance. They do it every quietly, content to sit at her feet, raptly attentive and lighting candles (Candles in the Rain is one of Melanie's biggest succeses). Meanwhile Melanie, sitting like a camp counselor at a marshmallow cookout, will sing on.

title: Connors Replies To Ralston Attack
description: NORTH LITTLE ROCK, Ark., Feb. 5 (UPI)Jimmy Connors said today he had refused to play on the United States Davis Cup team against Colombia because persons who had advised him throughout his career had urged him not to play.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yesterday was:

title: An EmotionCharged Country Girl
description: Last night's televised production of Clifford Odets's The Country Girl was the Hallmark Hall of Fame at its best, which is saying plenty.

title: URIS BUILDINGS SHOWS NET LOSS
description: The Uris Buildings Corporation, which is controlled by the National Kinney Corporation, suffered a net loss of $17.4million in the fiscal year ended Sept. 30, it was reported yesterday. In the previous fiscal year Uris had a net income of $2.5million, or 30 cents a share, including a gain of $887,711 from the sale of property. Revenue improved to $82.7million from $64.4million in fiscal 1972.

title: British Coal Strike Is Called for Sunday
description: LONDON, Feb. 5The leaders of the nation's coal miners today ordered all pits to close early Sunday morning in a strike expected to lead to widespread disruption and unemployment for millions.

title: G.I. Benefit Rise Gains
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 5 (AP) A 13.6 per cent increase in G.I. bill education benefits for Vietnamera veterans was approved today by the House Veterans Affairs Committee.

title: PANEL PROMISES A FAIR DECISION House Officials Pledge to Search for All Available Data on Impeachment
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 5Senlor officials of the House Judiciary Committee pledged toclay to seek all available evidence to reach a fair and impartial judgment of President Nixon's conduct in office.

title: That Miserable Closet Could Be Transformed With a Little Creativity
description: One's home is one's castle but alas, and even slack, most castles these days are short on closets. And just to add to one's misery, the closets that do exist are, on the whole, meanly proportioned, awkwardly placed and inadequately and unimaginatively planned.

title: Islanders Turn Back North Stars, 62
description: UNIONDALE, L. I., Feb. 5 When the New York Islanders enter the lions' den tomorrow night to play the Rangers in Madison Square Garden, they will step with heads high and whips cracking confidently after taming the Minnesota North Stars tonight with a 62 lashing before a crowd of 11,063.

title: Dance: Undertow Loner
description: Daniel Levins and Fernando Bujones are very ??oung dancers, and yet both have developed a distinctive handling of the difficult role of the Transgressor in the American Ballet Theater's Undertow. Daniel Levins, who has previously danced it this season, approaches his varied repertory with an intelligence that has earned him praise in roles such as this. He is a strong actor whose intensity and sensitivity blend strikingly with his eager, sharp dance attack.

title: FIVE LITERARY MEN ARRESTED BY SEOUL
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Feb. The Seoul district prosecutor's office announced the arrest of two South Korean novelists and three literary critics today on charges of espionage for North Korea and oviolation of the antiCommunist law.

title: Nixon Rebuffed in Attempt To Settle Trucker Strike
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 5 President Nixon ordered a monthlong freeze on prices of diesel fuel today in an effort to end the strike of independent truck operators, but their leaders rejected the settlement offer and called on drivers to continue to stand down.

title: Judgmental Factors of a Recession
description: The chief issue facing economic policymakers this year is Whether to deploy their, forces against recession or inflationboth of which are being exacerbated by the energy shortage. The issue has been somewhat confused by President Nixon's State of Union declaration that there will be no recession in the United States of America. Was this a prediction or a policy vow?

title: 4thQuarter and '73 Profit Off at Reynolds Securities
description: Reynolds Securities, Inc., reported yesterday a decline in both fourthquarter and fullyear profits for 1973, However, officials of the large brokerage concern noted that it operated profitably in every month of a difficult year.

title: FUELCRISIS EFFECT ON PAPER SEEN LIGHT
description: The domestic paper industry has been relatively unaffected to date by the energy crisis, the American Paper Institute reported yesterday.

title: 4 Armed Guerrillas In Singapore Urge North Korean Help
description: SINGAPORE, Feb. 5 (Renters) Four armed guerrillas, who have been holding three people hostage aboard a ferryboat in Singapore harbor for the last six days, asked North Korea today to help arrange their safe conduct out of the country.

title: Open Interest
description: Tuesday, Feb. 5, 1971 (In bushels, 000 omitted) Mon. Tues

title: Grenadian Rebel Sees Arrests Soon
description: ST. GEORGE'S, Grenada, Feb. 5It is surrealistic and in a way comical, said Bernard Coard, a 28yearold leader of Grenada's dissident movement, but in a few days I suspect we'll all be rounded up and jailed.

title: NIGERIA SHUTS DOWN 4 OF 6 UNIVERSITIES
description: LAGOS, Nigeria, Feb. 5Two more Nigerian universities were closed today after widespread disorders that began when the police broke up a student demonstration Friday in memory of a student killed during a protest three years ago.

title: Papal Letter to Cardinal
description: ROME, Feb. 5Following in unofficial translation from the Latin is the text of a letter dated Jan. 30 from Pope Paul VI to Jozsef Cardinal Mindszenty:

title: Motorola Plans Expansion
description: Motorola, Inc., unveiled yesterday at Chicago, plans for spending $125million this year for expansion. This woull he a record for the company and would compare with the $85million spent last year.

title: Nixon Sees Passage in 74 Of a Health Insurance Plan
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 5 President Nixon predicted to day that some form of comprehensive health insurance plan covering the entire nation would be enacted this year.

title: TV: Cowboys Blunders Along Credibility Trail
description: There were several good reasons why the old Hollywood Westerns faded as a television staple a few years ago. The Cowboys, which premieres at 8 tonight as the new Wednesday night entry on the American Broadcasting Company's schedule, helps you remember most of them.

title: Physician Acquittedin Patient's Death
description: MINEOLA, L. I., Feb. 5Dr. Vincent A. Montemarano was found not guilty today in the death of Eugene Bauer, a terminally ill cancer patient at the Nassau County Medical Center.

title: MOORER CONCEDES HE GOT DOCUMENTS
description: Washington, Feb. 5 Adm. Thomas H. Moorer, Chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff, has acknowledged to the Senate Armed Services Committee that twice in 1971 he knowingly received documents that a Navy clerk had retained while traveling to Asia and Southeast Asia with President Nixon's top national security advisers.

title: Joint Congressional Panel Questions Stockpile Sales
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 5 (AP)  The SenateHouse Joint Committee on Defense Production said today the administration had reduced a $4.8billion stockpile objective on strategic raw materials to $702million, and questioned whether, on the basis of the duration of past and potential future wars and conflicts, this assured adequate materials to meet future emergencies.

title: Delay on Delivery Is Set Of U.S. Wheat to Soviet
description: PITTSBURGH, Feb. 5 (Reuters)The Soviet Union and the United States agreed today to postpone delivery of 30 million more bushels of wheat to the Soviet Union until after July 1, Vladimir S. Alkhimov( a Soviet Deputy Minister of Foreign Trade, said at a news conference here.

title: New Jersey Sports
description: To compete in the national figureskating championships is a difficult process. First, the skater must pass series of tests to prove proficiency in the sport, such as the tracing of variations of the figure 8 on the ice or the exact pattern of steps in an ice dance. Then one must qualify by performing in various sectional and regional championships. Only the three top skaters in each division advance to the next level.

title: Basketball Ratings COACHES' POLL
description: The top 20, with points figured on a 10987654321 basis for first through 15th places (firstplace votes in parentheses) and wonlost records.

title: Marquette Wins at the Buzzer, 59 to 58
description: MILWAUKEE, Feb. 5 (AP)Maurice Lucas sank a 20foot jump shot at the buzzer tonight to give sixthranked Marquette a 5958 basketball victory over Wisconsin.

title: Massachusetts to Start Rationing Plan Monday
description: Massachusetts moved yesterday to begin a voluntary gasoline rationing program next week, joining the list of gasolinestarved states in the Northeast contemplating such a move.

title: Miss Hearst's Kidnappers Also Abducted Man and Used His Car in Their Escape
description: BERKELEY, Calif., Feb. 6Two kidnappings, not one, were committed here Monday night mid two white women, not one, helped the two black men who abducted 19yearold Patricia Hearst in the second kipnapping, investigative sources said today.

title: Tuesday's Fights
description: BostonTony Licata 160 pounds, New Orleans outpointed Emile Griffith, New York 158, 12 rounds

title: Estimate Board Weighs Procedural Streamlining
description: The Board of Estimate day began considering reforms to simplify and speed the oftenponderous procedure by which its eight members arrive at decisions on virtually all of the important questions facing the city's government.

title: CRIME STUDY SEEKS PORNOGRAPHY LINK
description: TRENTON, Feb. 6 (AP)The State Commission of Investigation has begun a major investigation into possible organizedcrime infiltration of the pornography industry in New Jersey.

title: Erving Scores 40 Points as Nets Triumph Over Pacers, 121 to 100
description: INDIANAPOLIS, Feb. 6Julius Erving did not act like the middle aisle to walk in three days as he led the New York Nets to a 121100 victory over the Indiana Pacers tonight at the Fairgrounds Coliseum.

title: Newcombe Sets Back Jovanovic
description: ST. PETERSBURGH, Fla., Feb. 6 (UPI)  Topseeded John Newcombe of Australia easily defeated Boro Jovanovic of Yugoslavia, 64, 62, tonight and gained the quarterfinal round of the $50,000 Raymond James World Championship Tennis Classic.

title: Councilmen Protest Plight Of Soviet Jews at Breakfast
description: Twentytwo City Councilmen, expressing deep concern over the plight of Jews in the Soviet Union, ate what they said was a typical breakfast in the labor camps: an ounce of sardines and a slice of black bread served on tin plates and washed down with a cup of cold water.

title: Ice Halts Cleanup of Oil Spill Near Bear Mountain
description: Subfreezing temperatures forced a delay in the cleanup of almost 15,000 gallons of heating oil that spilled across the waters and ice floes on the Hudson River just south of the Bear Mountain Bridge.

title: CODE ON EVIDENCE PASSED BY ROUSE
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 6The House of Representatives approved today a new set of rules of evidence overning criminal and civil trials in the Federal court system. The vote was 377 to 13.

title: Dean Disbarred in Virginia for Unethical Acts
description: ALEXANDRIA, Va., Feb. 6 (AP)  A threejudge state court today disbarred John W. Dean 3d, former counsel to President Nixon, for what it called unethical, unprofessional and unwarranted conduct in the Watergate affair.

title: SONG RECITAL GIVEN BY JANICE CAVALIER
description: Janice Cavalier, a soprano who gave her second New York recital Monday night in Alice Tully Hall, had mapped out for herself a symmetrical program. Four Handel arias and four songs each by Donaudy and Bizet preceded the intermission; thereafter came four songs each by Mozart, Joseph Marx and Peter Warlock.

title: Recital
description: Timothy Eddy is a cellist who has played here frequently in chambermusic performances and has been singled out for critical praise on occasion, but until Tuesday night he had not given a solo recital in New York. That gap in his career was closed when he was presented by the Metropolitan Museum in the young artist series there that is made possible by a grant from the Martha Baird Rockefeller Fugd for Music.

title: Grenada's Destined Leader
description: ST. GEORGE'S, Grenada, Feb. 6In the midst of a general strike and a power blackout Eric M. Gairy talked freely about what he saw as the commingled destiny of himself and the tiny emerging independent nation of Grenada. He said that 23 years ago, when he was starting out in politics, a woman with the gift of prophecy predicted that a man born in the east would lead this Caribbean island to greatness.

title: NET UP TENFOLD AT AMERADA HESS
description: The Amerada Hess Corporation announced yesterday an almost tenfold increase in net earnings in 1973 on a 42.2 per cent rise in revenues.

title: State Sues Shell, Alleging Oil Hiding to Raise Price
description: Four oil companies, all members of the Royal Dutch Shell groupincluding the Shell Oil Company, one of the largest petroleum concerns in the United States  were charged yesterday in State Supreme Court with diverting and holding secretly in storage homeheating oil meant for New York area, homeowners.

title: Nixon's Letter
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 6 Following is the text of a letter from President Nixon to Federal Judge Gerhard A. Gesell on the subject of Presidential tapes:

title: Killanin For Paying Olympians
description: ST. MORITZ, Switzerland, Feb. 6  Lord Killanin came to see his first skiiing championship today but the weather wouldn't let him.

title: Fugitive Arrested in Back Row At Henry Brown Murder Trial
description: A fugitive who evidently could not stay away from court was arrested yesterday as he sat in the last row awaiting the latestarting morning session of the trial of Henry Brown in the murder of police officers Gregory P. Foster and Rocco W. Laurie on the Lower East Side two years ago.

title: China Hints New Campaign May Take a Violent Turn
description: HONG KONG, Feb. 6Strongly hinting at possible turbulence in the mass movement getting under way in China, Peking today revived an early battle cry of the Cultural Revolution that stressed the need for destruction.

title: People in Sports: Jerry West, Hurt Again, Faces Retirement
description: Jerry West of the Los Angeles Lakers may have to retire because of a persistent abdominal and groin muscle strain. The 35yearold West, a veteran of 14 National Basketball Association seasons, aggravated the injury last Tuesday night in Houston.

title: REBELLIONS FLARE IN MEXICAN STATES
description: MEXICO CITY, Feb. 6 (Reuters)Rebellions have flared in recent weeks in several Mexican states, causing growing concern among the Mexican authorities.

title: Laos Accord on Police Spurs Optimism on Coalition
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, Feb. 6The royal Government and the Communistled Pathet Lao signed an agreement today that apparently resolved the last major dispute delaying the formation of a coalition government and the full effectiveness of the January, 1973, ceasefire agreement in Laos.

title: Leads in Hope Golf
description: PALM SPRINGS, Calif., Feb. 6Only the thermometer and three golfers got into the 60's today as the 90hole Bob Hope Desert Classic got under way in bright sunshine but uncharacteristically gusty breezes on the four courses used here.

title: KISSINGER WARNS ARABS ON OIL BAN
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 6Secretary of State Kissinger said today that the United States had been led to expect that the Arabs' oil embargo would be lifted and that their failure to lift it would be regarded as a form of blackmail.

title: The Death of the Heart
description: ABROAD AT HOME

title: CAMBODIAN TROOPS MEET HEAVY FIRE
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia, Feb. 6 (AP)Government forces ran into heavy fire today from Communistled insurgents on the east bank of the Basset about eight miles from the capital, according to reports from the field.

title: Reagan Is 63
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., Feb. 6 (UPI)Gov. Ronald Reagan, a leading contender in polls for the 1976 Republican Presidential nomination, was 63 years old today.

title: Thief Was Quicker
description: Anthony Mattone left the motor of his struck running yesterday morning when he dashed into a butcher ship at 42 Avenue C to make a quick delivery. But he wasn't quick enough. When he came out, the truck was gonealong with $15,000 worth of meat.

title: . . . Hello to Rationing?
description: The rationing of gasoline is spreading, despite opposition of President Nixon and fellow ideologues of laissezfaire. It is spreading not because of some socialist plot, but because inconvenience has disintegrated into chaos, in the words of Gov. Francis Sargent of Massachusetts.

title: Mountain Co op Has a Rockefeller To Help Guide It
description: After her husband and three children, Sharon Percy Rockefeller's chief preoccupation for the last six years has been Mountain Artisans. This is the crafts group she helped organize in Appalachia in 1968, a year after her marriage to John D. Rockefeller 4th, whom everybody calls Jay.

title: A Heyday. Dog Figures To Be One H of a Dog
description: What is an H dog? To a spaniel aficionado, it's a cocker from the kennel of Dr. and Mrs. Clarence Smith of Minneapolis. For all the Smith homebreds have name starting with HHenrietta, Handy Man, Hobbitand the kennel name is Heyday.

title: 6 Americans in Thailand Plead Guilty of Sacrilege
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Feb. 6 (AP)Six American teenagers charged with sacrilege for climbing a statue of Buddha pleaded guilty today before a Thai judge, who set sentencing for Friday, the United States Embassy reported.

title: FRANCE IS JOINING OIL TALKS WARILY
description: PARIS, Feb. 6France, finally announcing that she would take part in the conference of major oilconsuming nations be ginning Monday in Washington repeated her wariness today against involvement in anything like the cooperative action program proposed by the United States.

title: C.B.S. Promotes Small To Director of Reporting
description: William J. Small, bureau chief for C.B.S. News in Washington for the last 12 years, has been promoted to senior vice president and director of news, in overall charge of hardnews reporting and broadcasts for the Columbia Broadcasting System in New York.

title: HEATH EXPECTED TO CALL ELECTION
description: LONDON, Feb. 6  Several key leaders of the Conservative party said tonight that Prime Minister Heath was on the verge of calling a general election in the wake of the decision by the coal miners to strike on Sunday.

title: Business Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 6 (Reuters)Consumer credit outstanding rose $704million in December on a seasonally adjusted basisthe smallest monthly increase in almost two years.

title: PROF. IMRE LAKATOS, LONDON LOGICIAN, 51
description: LONDON, Feb. 7Prof. Imre Lakatos, professor of logic at the University of London, died here Saturday. His age was 51.

title: Disney Parks Suffer Decline in Attendance
description: E. Cardon Walker, president of Walt Disney Productions told the annual meeting yesterday that attendance at the Walt Disney World park near Orlando, Fla., had dropped 6.5 per cent since Oct. 1, 1973, compared with the previous year.

title: Schlosser to Replace Goodman as N.B.C. President
description: Herbert S. Schlosser, who last summer became president of the National Broadcasting Company's television network, has been promoted to corporate president in a new alignment of the senior management, which will become effective April 1.

title: MURPHY OIL VOTES A 21 STOCK SPLIT
description: The directors of the Murphy Oil Company voted yesterday in El Dorado, Ark., to split its common shares on the basis of 2 for 1. Shareholders will vote on the split at the company's annual meeting on May 1.

title: World Fertilizer Shortages Reported
description: CHICAGO, Feb. 5  A threemember delegation from Ecuador arrived here Sunday intent on contracting for fertilizer supplies from United States producers.

title: Bill on Pollution Signed
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 6 (AP) President Nixon has signed a bill that permits the Coast Guard to deal with offshore oil pollution that might threaten, to damage shoreline areas.

title: Senate Labor Panel Backs $2.20 Minimum Wage Bill
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 6 (AP)The Senate Labor Committee approved a bill today to raise the minimum wage to $2.20 an hour and extend coverage to an additional 7 million workers.

title: Sports Today
description: Manhattan vs. St. Joseph's and Rutgers vs. West Virginia, at Madison Square Garden. Eighth Avenue and 33d Street. First game, 7 P.M.

title: Snow Shortage Thaws Carnival at Dartmouth
description: In a season already filled with frustrations for many Eastern race committees because of the snow shortage, officials of the Dartmouth Winter Carnival yesterday found themselves falling into step. They announced a readjustment of the schedule and sitesof the Big Green's annual skiing jamboree.

title: The Night Train Stops at Canton
description: Several days before the recent Super Bowl game, Dick (Slight Train) Lane checked into the Houston hotel where the National Football League had its headquarters. He's on the scene every year, perhaps because he never was in a championship game himself in 14 seasons. It wasn't his fault. His teams weren't quite good enough, but he just might have been the best cornerback ever. When he was with the Detroit Lions, the Green Bay Packers were winning most of the championships. But their respect for Night Train Lane was obvious. Bart Starr seldom passed into his area. On orders. Don't throw anywhere near him, Vince Lombardi often reminded his quarterback. He's the best there is. But for several years after Night Train Lane became eligible for the Pro Football Hall of Fame, he somehow didn't receive enough votes for induction.

title: KISSINGER SCORES MILITARY SPYING
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 6Secretary of State Kissinger said today that military spying inside the White House should not have taken place and should not have been tolerated.

title: Mexican President Arrives In Bonn on an Official Visit
description: BONN, Feb. 6 (AP)President Luis Echeverria of Mexico arrived here today on his first official visit to West Germany.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
TENNESSEE CHECKS WELFARE RECIPIENTS
description: NASHVILLE, Feb. 6 (UPI) Thousands of welfare recipients were bused yesterday to a National Guard armory and other sites that served as checkpoints throughout Tennessee in an attempt to remove ineligible persons from the welfare rolls.

title: U.S. DOLLAR GAINS IN TRADING ABROAD
Ft. Dix: Awaiting Trial
description: FORT DIX, N. J.The first anniversary of the Paris ceasefire accords that ended our ground combat role in Vietnam was marked Jan. 27. For me, that date also marked the end of my first month in the Fort Dix stockade, awaiting trial for desertion. My crime: refusal to accept military duty in Vietnam.

description: WNBCTV, Channel 4, having made definite its plan to begin a twohour evening newscast about May 1, is developing it as a newsmagazine in four parts that will be unified by three anchormen, to rotate singly or in pairs.

Medvedev, the dissident historian known in the West for his unofficial history of Stalinism, issued a long welldocumented essay today praising and defending Aleksandr I. Solzhenitsyn's latest book as a mercilessly truthful work providing more insight into Russian prison life than Dostoyevsky's writings.

The library was to have been built this spring.

description: The 25th member of the House of Representatives to announce any intention not to run again is Mrs. Julia Butler Hansen, Democrat of Washington. Mrs. Hansen, who has been in the House since 1960 but had been a local or state official since 1937, announced her retirement yesterday. Thirtyseven years is a long time to be pursued by an endless string of people who want everything from post offices to gasoline, she said.
