description: There is probably more literature on great bouts of eystereating than any other food on earth. In a recently printed essay we recounted a few paragraphs on oystereating taken from M. F. K. Fisher's inimitable translation of Brillat Savarin:

title: John Barth Among 11 Named To Arts and Letters Body
description: The novelist John Barth and 10 others in the arts have been elected to membership in the National Institute of Arts and Letters. They fill vacancies left by death during the year and bring the honor society's roster up to 242.

title: Cowles to Resume Dividend By 5CentaShare Payout
description: Cowles Communications, Inc., announced yesterday it would resume paying dividends on common stock with a payment of 5 cents a share April 5 to holders of record March 15. Cowles paid its last dividend, also 5 cents a share, in December, 1969.

description: A crosssection of businessmen and economists yesterday characterized the Nixon Administration's twoandahalf year attempt to control prices and wages as failure and said that they welcomed an end to the experiment.

title: Miss Hamill Leads U.S. Skate Event
description: PROVIDENCE, R. I., Feb. 6 For the first time in her career, Dorothy Hamill of Riverside, Conn., found out today what it feels like to lead after the compulsory school figures event in the national figureskating championships at the Civic Center.

title: Music: A Fluent Flutist
description: As principal flutist of the New York City Opera Orchestra, John Wion gets the chance to play many solos, mostly in old and familiar works. But on Tuesday night at Carnegie Recital Hall, with Gilbert Kalish as his partner at the piano, Mr. Wion broke out of the cage. After a warmup with a Bach Sonata in B minor, deftly done, the progam plunged into the 20th century and stayed there.

title: Meat Shortages Seen
description: Meat and poultry are expected to be in short supply in su permarkets in some parts of the nation next week as a result of the growing impact of the truckers' strike.

title: 2 Aides of Mackell Testify They Lost Thousands in GetRichQuick Scheme
description: Two former Queens County prosecutors took the witness stand yesterday to testify that they had received weekly cash interest payments, the dividends of a fastmoney scheme, in the District Attorney's office in the Criminal Courts Building in Queens.

title: INQUIRY ORDERED IN ESSEX KILLINGS
description: NEWARK, Feb. 6Essex County was described today as an organized crime Wild West by a Superior Court judge who assigned a special grand jury to investigate approximately 20 gangland assassinations, most of which occurred in the last two years.

title: FUNDMISUSE INQUIRY SOUGHT AT LAUNDRY
description: The Acting United States Attorney for the Eastern District of New York, Edward J. Boyd 5th, has been asked to investigate the former management of a Brooklyn laundry for possible misappropriation of funds and concealment of assets, a Federal bankruptcy judge said last night.

title: Antitrust Suit Is Filed Against CocaCola of N.Y.
description: MADISON, Wis., Feb. 6 (UPI) A $2.7million antitrust suit has been filed against the CocaCola Bottling Company of New York.

title: STYLE WORKS MISS BROECKING
description: Hans Pfitzner has not had too many champions in this country, but recently his opera Palestrina made its mark on recordings, and some of out more enterprising lieder singers have again begun, exploring his ripe heritage of romantic song Among these artists is Arden Broecking, who observed the 25th anniversary of the composer's death with two Car. negie Recital Hall programs. At the first concert, last November, the soprano juxtaposed some of Pfitzner's songs with those of his almost exact contemporary, Richard Strauss Monday evening, she paired Pfitzner with Johannes Brahms.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: OAKLAND, Calif., Feb: 6 (AP)  Vida Blue, a holdout until late in spring training two years ago, agreed to terms for the coming season in less than three minutes, the Oakland A's owner, Charles O. Finley, said today. The 24yearold lefthanded pincher had a 209 wonlost record and a 3.28 earnedrun average last season for the world champions. Terms of his contract were not disclosed.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: CUTTING DOWN The new show at the OwensCorning Fiberglas Center, 717 Fifth Avenue, at 56th Street (759 3810), is about energy and expends some to tell you how to save it. It is a nice little live show, of demonstrations through the day, with just one smidgin of a commercial, a soft sell, that tells you how much you can save by using somebody's insulation. But for the rest, it's graphic, in a World's. Fairish sort of way.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yesterday was:

title: HOUSE SEAT VOTE PUZZLES EXPERTS
description: JOHNSTOWN, Pa., Feb. 6A Democratic victory here yesterday in the year's first Congressional election  a race touted as a Watergate referendummay have provided as many questions as answers about the mood of the American electorate.

title: The Screen: Wayne, Off the Range:Stars as.a Policeman in Warners'.'McQ.'
description: Reactionary movies about villainous cops have been as plentiful as children's nosebleeds throughout the last year. But "McQ," which opened yesterday at the Criterion Theater and the 86th Street East, is so much like "Magnum Force" that I'm awed by the nerve of Warner Brothers in releasing such similar pictures so close together.Before the credit sequence is finished, two cops are shot dead  which establishes the political climate of this movie. The police captain (Eddie Albert) snarls, "With uniformed officers being gunned down in the streets, that smells like radicals to me." Young men with long hair spill out of a paddy wagon, shouting "Pig!", and a policeman identifies them as "garbage."But Police Lieut. John Wayne discovers that some men in blue are involved in the narcotics trade. So he feels compelled to investigate the department itself. Meanwhile, his superiors are keen on curbing his feistiness  ever since he threw a man off a roof and that man's lawyers began "screaming about civil rights." Wayne replies, "Well, it kept him off the streets, didn't it?"Like Clint Eastwood in "Magnum Force," Mr. Wayne gets some eager signals from a couple of women; he can resist or succumb to them with equal indifference. The sexy dialogue over the Scotch ranges from "Refill?" "Why not?" to his telling Coolleen Dewhurst, "You know something? You are attractive."But Mr. Eastwood at his most languid isn't yet quite so wooden as Mr. Wayne. The latter's large, rosy face registers no more emotions than your grandmother's quilt. On learning that an old pal has been shot, his eyes widen slightly; his eyebrows droop a little when corruption in high places is unveiled; when Miss Dewhurst is killed, he manages to bang down the phone receiver and say "Damn." Still, he does convey some relish whenever he hits anyone.In this wildly undramatic picture, music and gunshots have to provide the gumption that the acting lacks. Surely Mr. Wayne should stick to Westerns: he's simply too slow to play any kind of policeman. Horseless in the streets of Seattle, he looks as though he needs a shot of sand.

title: Aides Throwing a Party For Beanie Aboard QE2
description: The Queen Elizabeth 2, moored at a Hudson River pier, will be the site of a birthday party for Mayor Beame on March 21.

title: Top Skippers Start Ocean Race
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla., Feb. 6It would be easy to defend the view that the Southern Ocean Racing Conference this winter is offering the finest yachting competition in the world.

title: SENATE PUTS OFF GENOCIDE ACCORD
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 6 (AP) The Senate today refused for a second time to cut off a filibuster against United States ratification of the 25yearold United Nations agreement to outlaw genocide.

title: Effects Spreading Here
description: Food shortages began to show up and some industries began layoffs as the effects of the sevendayold strike of independent truckers spread yesterday to the New YorkNew JerseyConnecticut area.

title: BILL ON ANALYSTS BACKED BY STATE
description: The office of the Attorney General of New York State endorsed yesterday legislation that would professionalize security analysts.

title: GASOLINE SUPPLY SQUEEZED AGAIN
description: While roundtheclock deliveries of gasoline were promised by many oil companies, the regional Federal energy administrator said here yesterday that other companies had reported that truck pickets were holding up deliveries once again.

title: F. Norman Hartmann, 67, Dies; ExPresident of LilyTulip Cup
description: BRUNSWICK, Ga., Feb. 6 F. Norman Hartmann, former president and a director of the LilyTulip Cup Corporation, died last evening at the General Hospital here. He was 67 years St. old and had lived at Simons Island since retiring on Dec. 31, 1970.

title: Stock Prices Edge Ahead As Volume Shows a Drop
description: Stock prices rose slightly yesterday to post the first gain in the last five sessions. But the market's monumental lack of activity was seen in the volume of 11.61 million shares the most meager turnover since Christmas Eve of 1973.

title: Events Today
description: Theater

title: Gasoline Drought in State Is Creating Staff Shortages at Some Institutions
description: TRENTON, Feb. 6  New Jersey, which probably has more giant fuel storage tanks and petrochemical aromas per acre than any state in the union, today seemed to be the archetypical victim of the national energy crisis. There was a great deal of anger, violence, anxiety and frustrationand little or no gasolinein the state.

title: $57 Outsider Wins Stakes In Florida
description: HALLANDALE, Fla., Feb. 6 Green Mill Farm's Frankie Adams, a New Yorkbred colt that couldn't win at Florida Downs last year, further confused the 3yearold picture in Florida today the when he scored a decisive victory in the $53,075 Hutcheson Stakes at Gulfstream Park. Under an excellent ride from Ron Turcotte, who saved ground all the way, Frankie Adams came through along the inside to get the lead approaching the eighth pole and then drew away to win by 2 lengths. Training Table and Judger finished in a dead heat for second, a head in front of Little Current.

title: Profit Climbs 23% at A. M. C.
description: DETROIT, Feb. 6  The American Motors Corporation, enjoying booming sales in its small cars during an energyconscious period, reported today that earnings in the last three months of 1973 were up 23 per cent on a 16.5 per cent sales gain.

title: CHANGES ORDERED ON PHONE DEPOSITS
description: ALBANY, Feb. 6  The Public Service Commission ordered the New York Telephone Company today to restructure its entire credit and deposit system within two months to offer service without any deposit at all to clients who answer positively three out of six questions.

title: Mariner 10 Photos Said to Show Nature of the Weather on Venus
description: PASADENA, Calif., Feb. 6Television images of Venus transmitted by Mariner 10 as it flies away from that planet have revealed a system of bands and streaks roughly parallel to the Venusian equator and strikingly reminiscent of those in the clouds of Jupiter.

title: CARL WEISS
Meskill Asks Transit Aid Plus $73Million in Tax Cuts
description: HARTFORD, Feb. 6  Gov. Thomas J. Meskill laid a redord, electionyear budget of $1.32billion before the General Assembly today, and asked hat more than $73million in tax cuts he proposed in it be made effective as quickly as possible, without waiting for the end of the fiscal year in June.

title: Government Securities Fall After Burns Statement
description: The Government securities market, pausing yesterday morning after a substantial advance for more than a week, started to slip yesterday afternoon. Prices relinquished much of their gains for the day. The turn in the market came largely after Arthur F. Burns, chairman of the Federal Reserve Board, told Congress that the central bank would not open up the spigot and permit the money supply to increase rapidly.

title: Hoffa Fails to Win Support In Request on Union Role
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 6 (AP) Attorney General William B. Saxbe said today the Justice Department would be likely to oppose the former teamster president, James R. Hoffa, in expected court efforts to lift restrictions blocking his future union activities.

title: 2 to 4 Inches of Snow And Freezing Rain Forecast for City
description: A winter storm warning was in effect last night for the metropolitan area with forecasts of snow followed by sleet and freezing rain that would make driving treacherous and flooding a hazard.

title: Nixon Offers Health Insurance Program With Costs Put at $5.9Billion a Year
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 6President Nixon sent his longawaited national health insurance proposal to Congress today, saying that it would add about $5.9billion a year to Federal spending and would, for the first time, offer all Americans comprehensive ealth coverage.

title: TALKS CONTINUE ON BREWERY SALE
description: Negotiations for the sale of the Rheingold brewery in Brooklyn continued yesterday between at least two prospective buyers and the company and the unions.

title: Consumer Notes
description: Leaving well enough alone is the secret to the delicious taste, it says on the back of a box of Quaker 100% Natural Cereal. Every ingredient is natural. Nothing has been processed in. No artificial flavoring. No preservatives.

description: The National Steel Corporation announced yesterday plans for a $300million expansion program designed to increase, its output by a million tons.

description: The Vatican published a revised liturgy for the sacrament of penance yesterday that makes possible a fundamental shift in the setting of the historic ritual from a simple encounter between priest and penitent to a communal rite.

description: Rupp Industries in Mansfield, Ohio said yesterday that it had renegotiated the repayment schedule on a $10.5million loan that was in default. A total of $5million will come due in five installments between July 31 and the end of the year, and the balance in two yearly payments in 1975 and 1976.

title: 2 POLICEMEN SUED BY CONVICTED RAPIST
description: Luther Hunter, a 27yearold convicted rapist, has filed a civil suit in Federal Court charging the two city police officers who arrested him four years ago with conspiring to violate his civil rights, and demanding that they pay $150,000 in damages.

description: KUWAIT, Thursday, Feb. 7A guerrilla group seized the Japanese Ambassador to Kuwait and several members of his staff at gunpoint yesterday in a bid to win freedom for four other guerrillas trapped on a ferryboat they had commandeered in Singapore.

description: Security Mortgage Investors reported yesterday that the North American Acceptance Corporation in Atlanta, which services $43million of moregage notes and landsales contracts for Security Mortagage, had filed a Chapter XI proceeding in the Federal District Court in Atlanta under the Bankruptcy Act.

title: 7 HEADQUARTERS OF ARMY TO CLOSE
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 6The Defense Department, responding to Congressional criticism that the military was getting topheavy with generals and admirals, has decided to abolish seven Army headquarters around the world.

He said that this would infringe on the confidentiality of his office and would possibly prejudice criminal trials.

description: MOLINE, Ill., Feb. 6 Those seeking evidence of an energy crisis, or of unemployment or a recession, may as well avoid the Quad Cities. Here, in what the local boosters call the Farm Implement Capital of the World, many skilled workers this week were taking home an extra $100 a week in overtime pay.

description: Weavers visiting the city are often irresistibly attracted to the School Products Company, with its profusion of vivid yarns and the aroma of fleece.

Board Ordered to Negotiate College Teacher Work Rules
description: TRENTON, Feb. 6 (AP)New Jersey's second highest court today ordered the State Board of Higher Education to negotiate with state college teachers and administrators over rules governing outside employment.

title: Bronx Parish Shows Drop in Confessions
description: Ten or 15 years ago, parishloners would line up at the confession booth at St. Jerome's Roman Catholic Church in the South Bronx seeking absolution for their sins.

description: MOSCOW, Feb. 6Following are excerpts from an essay by Roy A. Medvedev, the dissident Soviet historian and specialist on the Stalin period, on the book The Gulag Archipelago, 19181956, by Aleksandr I. Solzhenitsyn, which deals with the Soviet prison system:

title: HOUSE, 4104, GIVES SUBPOENA POWER IN NIXON INQUIRY
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 6The House of Representatives voted 410 to 4 today to grant the Judiciary Committee broad constitutional power to investigate President Nixon's conduct. The House thus formally ratified the impeachment inquiry begun by the committee last October and empowered the panel to subpoena anyone, including the President, with evidence pertinent to the investigation.

title: Nixon Names 4 in G.O.P. As Possible Successors
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 6 (UPI) President Nixon named four Republicans today as good posseibilities to succeed him in 1976.

title: Gervin Ruled Spurs' Property
description: SAN ANTONIO, Tex., Feb. 6 (UPI)A Federal judge ruled today that the American Basketball Association commissioner, Mike Storen, could not prevent the sale of George Gervin by the Virginia Squires to the San Antonio Spurs.

title: President of C.B.S. Assails Government Inroads on Freedom
description: Arthur R. Taylor, president of the Columbia Broadcasting System, Inc., assailed yesterday the arbitrary and capricious misuse of Government power, however well intended, that has been eroding the broadcasters' freedom and now is spreading to print journalism.

title: Irene a Financial Hit To All But Its Backers
description: In the 11 months since the musical Irene opened in the new Minskoff Theater, it has grossed about $6million. It is taking in more money than any other show on Broadway. Last week, Debbie Reynolds's final week in the showJane Powell steps into the title role tonight  Irene grossed $149,542, for a Broadway record. But the 167 limited partners who made the show financially possible have not received one cent back on their original investment of $800,000, and it will probably be at least one more yearshould the show run that long and continue to operate at closetocapacitybefore it even begins to turn a profit.

title: Consumer Agency Finds Peril in Rainbow Lamps
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 6 (UPI) The Consumer Product Safety Commission warned today that defects in thousands of socalled rainbow lamps could cause fatal electric shock.

title: Ending Phase 4: So Far It Follows Dunlop's Scenario
description: John T. Dunlop, director of the Cost of Living Council, dreamed last year about the way he would get the Government out of the rigid mandatory wageprice controls of Phase 4. He still has that dream, despite the nightmare of inflation that has swept the country. The Dunlop scenario, it was understood, anticipated a slowdown in the economy to take some pressure off pricesnow the slowdown is here. It also called for the cooperation of organized labor in the few major negotiations set for early 1974, and for an agreement with Congress to transform the Cost of Living Council into a freeform, freeswinging agency operating inside and outside Government to fight inflation.

title: SKYLAB ALTITUDE RISES A FEW MILES
description: HOUSTON, Feb. 6The last crew of Skylab astronauts, preparing to leave their orbiting laboratory Friday after nearly three months in space, maneuvered the 100ton craft a few miles higher above the earth this afternoon, so as to increase chances for a revisit by future space pilots.

title: Tractor Safety Unit Urged
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 6 (AP)The Occupational Safety and Health Administration has proposed that rollover protective structures be required on new agricultural tractors sold after Aug. 31 and operated by farm employes. The devices are designed to protect drivers from injury in case of a mishap.

title: Raul Castro Visits Moscow
description: MOSCOW, Feb. 6 (UPI)Raul Castro, Cuba's First Deputy Premier, arrived here today for an unofficial visit, the Tass press agency said.

title: 5 Principals Named In Seattle Six Bid
description: SEATTLE, Feb. 6 (AP)The five major stockholders in a $6million bid to gain a National Hockey League franchise for Seattle were identified today by Vince Abbey, vicepresident of the Western Hockey. League's Seattle Totems.

title: PROF. IMRE LAKATOS, LONDON LOGICIAN, 51
description: LONDON, Feb. 5Prof. Imre Lakatos, professor of logic at the University of London, died here Saturday. Hhis age was 51.

title: Dentist Goes on Trial In 1971 Slaying of His Wife
description: MINEOLA, L. I., Feb. 6The prosecutors in the murder trial of Dr. Robert F. Neulist, a wealthy North Shore dentist charged with shooting his wife to death in 1971, said today that the state's case would be based largely on circumstantial evidence.

title: People and Business
description: Najeeb E. Halaby, who remained on the financially embattled Pan American World Airways payroll until last Dec. 1 at his contract base, pay of $100,000 a year even though he was forced to resign as the international airline's chairman and chief executive officer almost two years ago, has hung out his shingle.

title: Stockholdings Of Insiders

title: Police Warn Public Of Swindle Plots By Bogus Officers
description: A Warning to the public about confidence men attempting to bilk them by impersonating, police officers or bank officials was issued yesterday by the police, who cited a rash of such swindles in recent months.

title: Goodby to Controls ...
description: The Nixon Administration, a reluctant convert to wageprice controls thirty months ago, has decided to throw in the towel. Its recommendation that Congress kill mandatory controls April 30, except for curbs on health services and oil, is a confession of White House helplessness to do anything direct to arrest higher prices.

title: A GEOTHERMAL ROLE BY NASA QUESTIONED
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 6 (AP) Spokesmen for the Nixon Administration and the Sierra Club questioned today a Congressional proposal to put the National Aeronautics and Space Administration in charge of geothermal energy.

title: COMPUTER BUSINESS SCHEDULED FOR SALE
description: The DearbornStorm Corporation announced yesterday it had signed an agreement in principle with a group of private investors in Chicago for the sale of its portfolio of International Business Machines Corporation systems 360 computers for $17million in cash.

title: State Sues Shell, Alleging Oil Hiding to Raise Price
description: Four oil companies, all members of the Royal Dutch Shell groupincluding the Shell Oil Company, one of the largest petroleum concerns in the United States  were charged yesterday in State Supreme Court with diverting and holding secretly in storage homeheating oil meant for New York area homeowners.

title: FIREMEN CONSIDER CONTRACT ACTION
description: HACKENSACK, Feb. 6A twoyear dispute over a new contract between local firemen and the City of Hackensack reached a climax with the firemen's union meeting tonight to decide what kind of job action it would take to win its demands.

title: Vatican Revises Sacrament of Penance
description: The Vatican published a revised liturgy for the sacrament of penance yesterday that makes possible a fundamental shift in the setting of the historic ritual from a simple encounter between priest and penitent to a communal rite.

title: Gairy Indicates No Reprisals As Grenada Becomes Nation
description: ST. GEORGE'S, Grenada, Feb. 6Prime Minister Eric M. Gairy, preparing to lead this tiny Caribbean island to independence at midnight, indicated today that he would take no reprisals against those who have joined in demonstrations against him.

title: Leads in Hope Golf
description: PALM SPRINGS, Calif., Feb. 6Only the thermometer and three golfers got into the 60's today as the 90hole Bob Hope Desert Classic got under way in bright sunshine but uncharacteristically gusty breezes on the four courses used here.

title: ELLMERS IS GUILTY IN 2 GIRLS' DEATHS
description: MORRISTOWN, Feb. 6John Ellmers of Bloomfield was found guilty here today of driving in willful or wanton disregard for the rights and safety of others, causing the death of two girls and injuries to a third in Madison last June 14. The misdemeanor charge carries a maximum sentence of three years in jail and a $1,000 fine.

title: AMEX ENDS MEED AS TRADING DROPS
description: In the slowest trading in more than four months, prices on the American Stock Exchange closed mixed yesterday with the index down but with advances slightly outnumbering declines. Price indexes in the overthecounter market, however, rose in most instances with advances also outnumbering declines in dull trading.

title: CODE ON EVIDENCE PASSED BY HOUSE
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 6 The House of Representatives approved today a new set of rules of evidence overning criminal and civil trials in the Federal court system. The vote was 377 to 13.

title: Gasoline Shortages Are Forcing Exurbanites to Readjust Their LifeStyle
description: UNION BRIDGE, Md., Feb. 6 Life is sweet here in the rolling horse country 68 miles northwest of Washington, where neighbors are truly neighborly and the outdoors are glorious and you can smell hay, even in the winter.

title: Guerrillasin Kuwait Seize Tokyo Envoy And Embassy Staff
description: KUWAIT, Thursday, Feb. 7A guerrilla group seized the Japanese Ambassador to Kuwait and several members of his staff at gunpoint yesterday in a, bid to win freedom for four other guerrillas trapped on a ferryboat they had commandeered in Singapore.

title: McGuire Out of Hospital
description: COLUMBIA, S. C., Feb. 6 (AP)  Frank McGuire, the South Carolina basketball coach, was released from the hospital today but he won't be back to work for about a week. McGuire was hospitalized Jan. 29. A university spokesman said McGuire had acute gastritis compounded by a ruptured blood vessel in the abdomen.

title: Newark Archdiocese Urges Gibson Act to Avert Stella Wright Shutdown
description: NEWARK, Feb. 6The Archdiocese of Newark, through its Institute of Social. Relations, issued a strong demand today that Mayor Kenneth A. Gibson take immediate action to avert the proposed shutdown of Stella Wright homes.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: Israeli Admits to Camden Killing

title: 100 PROTEST LOSS OF FORDHAM DEAN
description: One hundred students and faculty members in the evening session at Fordham University's Lincoln Center campus staged a demonstration yesterday to protest what they maintain was the forced resignation of an associate dean of students who set up an adulteducation program.

title: Family Finance: Unauthorized Phone
description: Roger Field, a science specialist for radio station WINS in New York, bought a $219 telephone  answering device some time ago and installed it himself in his apartment here. Some time later, he bought a telephone and also installed it.

title: MRS. O. P. HEGGIE
description: HANOVER, N. H. Feb, 6Mrs. Lilian C. Heggie, widow of O. P. Heggie, the stage and screen character actor, died Monday at the Mary Hitchcock Memorial Hospital. She was 88 years old and lived here and in Sierra Madre, Calif.

title: Senate Rules Panel Backs Federal Campaign Funding
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 6 (UPI) The Senate Rules Committee approved legislation today providing for the Federal financing of Presidential and Congressional elections.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Nuclear Strategy: The Interlocking Issues

title: Going From Rome to Canterbury
description: SANTA BARBARA, Calif.Last September I made a big decision. After a lifetime as a Roman Catholic, I was formally received into the Episcopal Church. Ordinarily such a move would have gone largely unnoticed, but because I had long been an editor or columnist for Commonweal and through the years had written on Catholic affairs for a variety of publications, religious and secular, the change was reported in The New York Times and picked up by the news services.

title: Colorado Oil Shale Tract
description: DENVER, Feb. 6 (AP)The Standard Oil Company (Indiana) and the Gulf Oil Corporation have formally signed yesterday the lease for the first oil shale tract in Colorado. The two concerns won the tract recently on a $210million bid.

title: GASOLINE SUPPLY SQUEEZED AGAIN Y TRUCK PICKETS
description: While roundtheclock deliveries of gasoline were promised by many oil companies, the regional Federal energy administrator said here yesterday that other companies had reported that truck pickets were holding up deliveries once again.

title: New Jersey Sports
Effects Spreading Here
description: Food shortages began to show up and some industries began layoffs as the effects of the sevendayold strike of independent truckers spread yesterday to the New YorkNew JerseyConnecticut area.

title: Fighter Steps Down
description: It had long been clear that Hungary's Communist Government would never grant the Roman Catholic Church even the circumscribed freedom to function that it exercises in other Sovietbloc countries so long as Joszef Cardinal Mindszenty remained the nominal Catholic primate. The Cardinal's inflexible antiCommunism, dating back at least to his troubles with the shortlived Bela Kun regime after World War I, had thus become a major obstacle to Vatican goals in Eastern Europe in an era of dtente.

title: WILLIAM B. BLOETH, FINANCIAL WRITER, 61
description: William B. Bloeth, an editor on the staff of the Dow Jones News Service since 1966, died yesterday, apparently of a heart attack, at his home in Baldwin, L.I. He was 61 years old and lived at 2549 South Grand Avenue.

title: Bridge: An Austrian World Titlist Recalled for a Bold Move
description: One of the world's most celebrated cardplayers died last month in Vienna, at the age of 69. He was Karl Schneider, perhaps the most brilliant member of the Austrian group that captured the world title in 1937 in Budapest. He continued to represent his country in the postwar years, until an accusation of improper conduct and mounting illhealth led to his retirement in 1957.

title: Weicker Hints Nixon May Have Committed Criminal Offense
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 6Senator Lowell P. Weicker Jr. suggested today that Presdent Nixon may have committed a criminal offense when he did not immediately report to the proper officials his information about the Watergate burglary.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Talks between Rheingold Breweries and at least two prospective buyers continued as lawyers for the brewers' unions and Rheingold appeared before the United States Court of Appeals for the Second Circuit on the unions' motion to compel arbitration on several issues and to keep the Brooklyn brewery open until the arbitration is resolved.

title: McCloy Testifies He Took the Oil Companies' Case on International Talks to President Kennedy
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 6 John J. McCloy, the Wall Street lawyer, told a Senate subcommittee today that, in representing 23 oil companies dealing with the oilproducing countries, he personally carried his clients' case to high Federal officials, including President Kennedy.

title: Conferees Approve A Revised Version Of Energy Measure
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 6 (UPI) House and Senate conferees approved a revised version of the longpending emergency energy bill today and sent it to both houses for another attempt at passage.

title: Racing Dates Set
description: PHILADELPHIA, Feb. 6 (UPI)  The summer racing season for thoroughbreds at Liberty Bell race track will run 82 days from May 29 to Aug. 31, officials announced today.

title: F. Norman Hartmann, 67, Dies; ExPresident of LilyTulip Cup
description: BRUNSWICK, Ga., Feb. 6 F. Norman Hartmann, former president and a director of the LilyTulip Cup Corporation, died last evening at the General Hospital here. He was 67 years old and had lived at St. Simons Island since retiring on Dec. 31, 1970.

title: Ballet: Past and Present
description: The Contemporary Dance System in its initial concert Tuesday evening, turned equally to the past and the present for repertory but was far better served by the past. This consisted of Anna Sokolow's astringent Lyric Suite, possibly her finest work, and Doris Humphrey's Day on Earth. Peter Sparling's Little Incarnations and Daniel Lewis's And First They Slaughtered the Angels were the contemporary entries as the company appeared at Pace University's Shimmel Center.

title: ENDS PROJECT ON JAIL INMATES
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 6In significant victory for prison reformers, the Federal Bureau of Prisons has decided to dismantle its behavior modification project in Springfield, Mo.

title: Briefs on Energy
description: NEW DELHI, Feb. 6 (UPI)The Soviet Union has sweetened its offer to sell TU154 airliners to India by pledging to provide the jet fuel required to operate them, Indian newspapers said today. The Soviet Union also offered to accept Indian rupees in payment for the fuel and to maintain stocks of spare parts on consignment India. The jetliners would be used on domestic runs by the Governmentowned Indian Airlines, which now uses Boeing 737's and Caravelles. The Americanbuilt jetliner has been favored for future purchases because of its lower fuel consumption and shorterrunway capabilities.

title: I.T.T. Sued by LSB
description: LSB Industries, Inc., said yesterday it had filed a suit in the United States District Court in Oklahoma City against the International Telephone and Telegraph Corporation for a minimum of $3.5million in damages. LSB charges that a 1973 agreement to supply I.T.T. with airhandling and fan Coil, products through its environmental control division was breached.

title: Middle Management Is Backbone of City Hall
description: Mayor Beame's ability to improve the efficiency of city government will be decided, to a large extent, by an unpublicized fragment of the City's Civil Service army of 250,000middle management.

title: Schinkel Dropped By Penguins
description: PITTSBURGH, Feb. 6 (UPI) The Pittsburgh Penguins, on a fivegame losing streak, discharged Coach Ken Schinkel today and appointed Marc Boileau, the coach of their Fort Wayne, Ind., farm, to succeed him.

title: Burden of Guilt
description: A filibustering minority has once again frustrated efforts in the Senate to ratify the 25yearold United Nations convention outlawing genocide.

title: SYLVAN SCHWARTZ
description: Sylvan Schwartz, a lawyer and president of First National Company, a manufacturers' outlet, died yesterday in Beth Israel Hospital. He was 65 years old and lived at 240 Central Park South.

title: A United House
description: With its overwhelming support of the impeachment inquiry by vote of 410 to 4, the House has destroyed any claim of White House loyalists that the pending investigation is a mere partisan vendetta. Such a demonstration of nearunanimity in this matter of grave national concern shows that members of both parties are deeply conscious of their constitutional responsibility to determine whether or not the manner in which the President has conducted himself constitutes cause for impeachment.

title: Excerpts From New Order of Penance
description: Following are excerpts from an unofficial translation of the Ordo Paenitentiae (the Order of Penance) published yesterday by the Vatican Congregation for Divine Worship:

title: Duryea Sets Up Gasoline Panel, Reacting to Wilson Crisis Steps
description: ALBANY, Feb. 6In a clear note of party dissonance, group of Republican legislators expressed dissatisfaction with Governor Wilson's response to the fuel shortage today as they announced that his rival, Speaker Perry B. Duryea, had established an Assembly gasoline crisis task force to begin immediate steps to ease the problem.

title: Books of The Times
description: JANE. By Dee Wells. 258 pages. Viking. $6.95. In the first chapter of Jane, by Dee Wells, two women say witty things to each other, without intermission, for eight and a half pages. On Page 39, we learn that Jane, an American girl living in London, is sleeping, in rotation, with three men: an English Lord, a Scottish burglar and a black American lawyer. Oh, I said to myself at that point, it's going to be one of those books. But this just shows the inadequacy of all such generalizations, because it is and it isn't.

title: DURYEA SETS UP GASOLINE PANEL
description: ALBANY, Feb. 6In a clear note of party dissonance, a group of Republican legislators expressed dissatisfaction with Governor Wilson's response to the fuel shortage today as they announced that his rival, Speaker Perry B. Duryea, had established an Assembly gasoline crisis task force to begin immediate steps to ease the problem.

title: Assembly Votes to Raise Fine to $500 For Health Violations at Migrant Camps
description: ALBANY, Feb. 6  The Assembly voted today to raise from $100 to $500 the maximum, fine that can be imposed againsL the operator of a migrant labor camp for violations of the Public Health Code.

title: APRIL 30 WINDUP OF MOST CONTROLS URGED BY SHULTZ
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 6The Nixon Administration recommended to Congress today that it let all wageprice controls expire on April 30 except for health care and petroleum products.

title: Lloyd Wright Fowles, 69, Loomis History Chairman
description: WINDSOR, Conn., Feb. 6Lloyd Wright Fowles, retired chairman of the history department at the Loomis School, I now the LoomisChaffee School, died in a nursing home here Saturday. He was 69 years old.

title: ALGERIA SEEKS RISE IN OIL PRODUCTION
description: ALGIERS, Feb. 6  Two agreements signed this week between the French Compagnie Frangaise des Ptroles (E.F.P.) and the Algerian National Oil and Gas Company (Sonatrach), covering both offshore and Sahara oil prospection demonstrate Algeria's intention to step up her oilexploration program.

title: KISSINGER WARNS ARABS ON OIL BAH
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 6Secretary of State Kissinger said today that the United States had been led to expect that the Arabs' oil embargo would be lifted and that their failure to lift it would be regarded as a form of blackmail.

title: GREEK VASE CASE ADVANCES IN ITALY
description: ROME, Feb. 6An assistant prosecutor who has been in charge of the inquiry into the way the Metropolitan Museum of Art in New York acquired a Greek vase for about $1million in 1972 today requested an investigatinng magistrate to take over the case and draw conclusions from the evidence so far gathered.

title: Indians to Make Statements
description: ST. PAUL, Feb. 6 (UPI)Dennis Banks and Russell Means, leaders of the American Indian Movement, will be allowed to make opening statements to the jury next Tuesday at the resumption of their trial on charges stemming from the Indian takeover of Wounded Knee, S. D. Federal District Judge Fred Nichol approved the move today.

title: $43,000 in Forged Checks
description: PHILADELPHIA, Feb. 6 (UPI) A Cape Coral, Fla., man was indicted by a Federal grand jury yesterday on charges of cashing more than $43,000 in ,forged checks. United States Attorney Robert E. J. Curran said the man, Richard Schneider, drew 142 checks on a Jersey City bank and cashed them in Philadelphia between March 19, 1972, and March 19, 1973.

title: Advertising: Selling High Notes
description: Don't you occasionally find yourself singing lines from a commercialI wake up each morning to Philadelphia brand cream cheese, or I gave my wife a cruise on the Sea Venturecatchy lines like that?

title: APRIL 30 WINDUP OF MOST CONTROLS URGED BY SHULTZ
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 6The Nixon Administration recommended to Congress today that it let all wageprice controls expire on April 30 except for health care and petroleum products.

title: Cambodia Orders Ouster Of French Correspondent
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia, Feb. 6 (Agence FrancePresse)Camodian authorities today announced the explusion of JeanJacques Cazaux, a correspondent of Agence FrancePresse.

title: 2 Maintenance Men Found Dead After Stabbings in Bowling Alley
description: HILLSIDE, Feb. 6  Two maintenance men were found stabbed to death early today in the Centre Bowl bowling alley, 1319 North Broad Street.

title: Cosmos 631 Launched
description: MOSCOW, Feb. 6 (AP)The Soviet Union launched today the 631st satellite in its Cosmos series, Tass the official press agency, reported.

title: Garden LineUps FIRST GAME7 P.M.
description: SECOND GAME

title: Chess: Let Perfection Stay a Dream, Lest It Become a Nightmare
description: Jose Raul Capablanca, whose genius was equalled only by his egotism, maintained, after losing his world championship to Alexander Alekhine in 1927, that, if one were satisfied to draw, we believe that it would not be impossible to draw all the games.

title: Gerulaitis Victor In Tennis, 75, 75
description: NORTH LITTLE ROCK, Ark., Feb. 6 (AP)Vitas Gerulaitis of New York won his second match in the $20,000 Arkansas tennis tournament today. He defeated George Hardie of Dallas, 75, 75.

title: Irene a Financial Hit To All But Its Backers
description: In the 11 months since the musical Irene opened in the new Minskoff Theater, it has grossed about $6million. It is taking in more money than any other show on Broadway. Last week, Debbie Reynolds's final week in the showJane Powell steps into the title role tonight  Irene grossed $149,542, for a Broadway record. But the 167 limited partners who made the show financially possible have not received one cent back on their original investment of $800,000, and it will probably be at least one more yearshould the show run that long and continue to operate at closetocapacitybefore it even begins to turn a profit.

title: Utilities Cite NuclearPower Benefits
description: Three utility executives reported yesterday that their nuclear power plants had proven more reliable and more economical than comparable fossilfueled plants.

title: Liberalized Capital Gains Taxes Favored as Spur to Small Investors
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 6The New York Stock Exchange and the Securities Industry Association joined today in endorsing legislation to liberalize capital gains taxes as an inducement to broader participation of small investors in equity capital markets.

title: Nixon's Health Plan
description: President Nixon sent his health insurance plan to Congress yesterday, saying it would add $5.9billion a year to Federal spending and would offer everyone comprehensive health coverage for the first time. Page 19.

title: FILMMAKER GIVES STUDENTS ADVICE
description: If I were starting today in the movie business, I would get together a bunch of my friends, draw straws and say, O.K., you're the director, you're the cameraman, you're the producer, you're the actor. And before you'd know it, we'd have a movie.

title: $20Million Sought By Boy Who Says Policeman shot Him
description: NEWARK, Feb. 6 (AP)A $20.3million damage suit was filed in Federal Court here today on behalf of a 17yearold Edison youth who said he was shot by a rookie policeman during a chase after he surrendered and pleaded with the officer, Please don't shoot me.

title: OneYear Bills Fell At Sale by Treasury
description: WASHINGTONFeb. 6The average rate on oneyear Treasury bills fell to 6.34 per cent today from 6.95 per cent in a similar sale a month ago. It was the lowest rate for oneyear bills since February, 1973.

title: Students Driving for A's in Trotting
description: WESTBURY, L. I., Feb. 6 Several months ago the newly formed Thoroughbred Racing Club of Queens College accepted an invitation from Jack Krumpe, New York Racing Association president, to visit Aqueduct and learn the details of the operation of the vast plant.

title: NEWS INDEX
COST KEEPS RISING FOR FOOD IN CITY
description: The cost of a market basket of 38 items commonly bought in the city's food stores rose 0.8 per cent last week, according to the City Department of Consumer Affairs. The cost rose to $59.34 from $58.84.

title: MUTINY REPORTED AT A JORDAN CAMP
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Feb. 6 (AP)Diplomatic sources said today that Jordanian troops Mutinied Sunday at a garrison near Amman because of discontent with their living allowance in a period of inflation.

title: HOUSE, 4103, GIVES SUBPOENA POWER IN NIXON INQUIRY
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 6The House of Representatives ??oted 410 to 4 today to grant the Judiciary Committee broad ??onstitutional power to investigate President Nixon's con??uct. The House thus formally ratified the impeachment ??quiry begun by the committee last October and empowered the panel to subpoena anyone, including the President, with evidence pertinent to the investigation.

title: Meat Shortages Seen
description: Meat and poultry are expected to be in short supply in supermarkets in some parts of the nation next week as a result of the growing impact of the truckers' strike.

title: Pro Transactions
description: BASEBALL

title: SKYLAB ALTITUDE RISES A FENS MILES
description: HOUSTON, Feb. 6The last crew of Skylab astronauts, preparing to leave their orbiting laboratory Friday after nearly three months in space, maneuvered the 100ton craft a few miles higher above the earth this afternoon, so as to increase chances for a revisit by future space pilots.

title: News Summary and Index
description: The Major Events of the Day

title: Commissioner Supports Right Of Aides to Run Mental Homes
description: ALBANY, Feb. 6The State Mental Hygiene Commissioner, Dr. Alan D. Miller, said today that he opposed any laws that would restrict the right of state employes to operate private homes for former mental patientsa restriction proposed by Attorney General Louis J. Lefkowitzbecause it would eliminate some of the best possible people.

title: Nebraska Legislature to Go To See Nixon About Trucks
description: LINCOLN, Neb., Feb. 6The Nebraska Legislature voted today to go en masse to Washington as soon as possible and tell President Nixon of its constituents' concern about the consequences of the independent truckers' strike.

title: EARLE M. SIMONSON
description: Earle M. Simonsen, a lawyer with the New York Telephone Company for 36 years until his retirement in 1963, died yesterday in the Staten Island Hospital, New Brighton. He was 75 years old and lived at 7484 Amboy Road, Tottenville, S. I.

title: Suit Accuses Westinghouse Of Bias Against Women
description: PITTSBURGH, Feb. 6 (UPI)The Westinghouse Electric Corporation was accused of sex discrimination in a class action suit filed yesterday in United States District Court here.

title: Johns Pair Takes Lead In Skating
description: PROVIDENCE, R, I., Feb. 6 Melissa Militano of Dix Hills, L.I., and her new partner, Johnnie Johns of Bloomfield Hills, Mich., took the lead today after the compulsory short program in the pairs event after the first day of competition at the United States figure skating championships at the Civic Center.

title: Changes Since Spanish Assassination Add Up to Rare Upheaval in Politics
description: MADRID, Feb. 6The bomb that ended the life of Premier Luis Carrero Blanco in December has produced a political and administrative upheaval of rare proportions in Spain.

title: Shutout Goalie's 5th of Season Vickers Tallies Three Times
description: The way Steve Vickers sees it, in that selfeffacing way of his, any dummy can score from the right goal post.

title: Revised Strike Pact Sent White House by Truckers
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 6Independent truck operators sent proposals for ending their strike, revised only in language and presentation, back to the White House today.

title: WILLIAM B. BLOETH, FINANCIAL WRITER, 61
description: William B. Bloeth, an editor! on the staff of the Dow Jones News Service since 1966, died yesterday, apparently of a heart attack, at his home in Baldwin, L.I. He was 61 years old and lived at 2549 South Grand Avenue.

title: Theater: White Nights
description: You cannot win them all and, moreover, you do not. The last production at the Theater of the Riverside Church was the prison drama Short Eyes, which is apparently being taken up by the New York Shakespeare Festival to bolster the flagging fortunes of its Lafayette Street theater. Last night, presumably flushed with success, the T.R.C.'s Performing Cooperative gave us the world premiere of two new musicals under the corporate title of White Nights.

title: Shipping/Mails All Hour's Given in Daylight Saving Time
description: SAILING TODAY

title: Governor Fills Panel Post
description: ALBANY, Feb. 6 (UPI)Governor Wilson announced today the reappointment of Jerry A. Danzig of New York City as member of the State Commission on Cable Television. Mr. Danzig, who will receive a salary of $20,000 a year, was television adviser to former Gov. Nelson A. Rockefeller. His term ends Jan. 1, 1979.

title: William Robertson Jr. Dead; Led Jersey Realty Groups
description: JERSEY CITY, Feb. 6William Robertson Jr., a past president of the New Jersey chapter of the American Institute of Real Estate Appraisers, the Jersey City Real Estate Board and the Hudson County chapter of the American Institute of Architects, died Sunday at his, home, 14 Duncan Avenue.

title: Market Placa: A Volatile Path In Superior Oil
description: It has been saidonly halffacetiouslythat the less you know about the Superior Oil Company, the more you like it.

title: WILSON PROPOSES VOLUNTARY PLAN ON GASOLINE SALE
description: Governor Wilson called yesterday for a voluntary statewide program starting Monday in which drivers with oddnumbered license plates would buy gasoline on oddnumbered dates and those with evennumbered plates would do their buying on evennumbered dates.

title: Brooklyn Nursing Home Plan Denied
description: The Board of Estimate, sidestepping an emotioncharged issue, voted yesterday to disapprove a plan for a 400bed nursing home on Ocean Parkway in Brooklynbut left the possibility open for the sponsor to come back with a lesser proposal that might placate an angry community.

title: Met Is International Host To a Gathering of Unicorns
description: A spectacular international gathering of unicorns will go on display today in the Metropolitan Museum of Art's noteworthy new show, Masterpieces of Tapestry from the Fourteenth to the Sixteenth Century.

title: Elsa Peretti: Zany and Talented
description: Elsa Peretti has long, elegant bones, cropped dark hair and what she describes as khakicolored eyes. At 11 o'clock one recent morning, she was wearing Halston's long red cashmere dress and cardigan. Curled up on the sofa in the living room of her friend, Joe Eula, she applied eye makeup as she talked, getting ready to go out to a business meeting.

title: Frederic E. Richter, 85, Professor of Economics
description: PRINCETON. N J.. Feb. 7Frederic E. Richter, who had I been a professor of economics at Harvard and Northwestern I.Jniversities, died today in a nursing home in Neshanic. He was 85 years old and lived at 79 Bayard Lane.

title: Crude Inventory Drop Reported by Mobil Oil
description: Crude oil inventories of the Mobil Oil Corporation declined by one million barrels in January, the company reported yesterday.

title: High School Sports
description: This is a tale of two basketball players from Brooklyn. One, Freddy Mobley of Baldwin School, operates in the obscurity of private school basketball. The other, Gordy McRae of Alexander Hamilton, plays in the Public Schools Athletic League limelight and is acknowledged as one the finer guards in the city by opposing players, coaches and college recruiters.

title: Nixon Adviser Predicts Lag In Food Price Increases
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 7 (Reuters)Gary L. Seevers, a member of President Nixon's Council of Economic Advisers, predicted today that food prices would stabilize or decline in the second half of this year, or at least rise at a slower rate than in the first six months.

title: Mets to Do Their Share In Conserving Energy
description: As well as attempting to defend their National League championship, the Mets will also try to help reduce the energy crisis during their 1974 home schedule.

title: Aide to Nixon Sees Only 100 in House For Impeachment
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 7President Nixon's assistant for Congressional relations, William E. Timmons, said today that only 100 members of the House would vote to impeach the President if the Vote was taken now.

title: Buffet at the Top for the Beames
description: Since the days of Mayor LaGuardia, the presidency of City Center has automatically passed to each of New York's mayors. Now it's Abraham D. Beame's turn. Which explains why he and Mrs. Beame were out with the artsminded last night, allowing the swells to fuss over them.

title: Pro Transactions
description: ATLANTA (NL)Signed Phil Niekro, Joe Niekro and Jimmie Freeman, righthanded pitchers; Ron Swoboda, Jimmie Collins, outfielders, and Jim Breazeale, first bate. man.

title: SUEZ MONITORING BY U.S. APPROVED
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 7Israel and Egypt have independently accepted an American proposal for the use of United States reconnaissance aircraft and satellites to monitor compliance with their troopseparation agreement along the Suez Canal, diplomats and Administration officials said today.

title: Nixon Tells His Lawyers To Consult Panel Counsel
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 7Lawyers for the White House and the House Judiciary Committee will meet soon, at President Nixon's initiative, to discuss the extent of White House cooperation with the committee's investigation of Mr. Nixon's conduct in office. cooperation with the committee's investigation of Mr. Nixon's conduct in office.

title: New Books
description: GENERAL

title: City Delays Buying Building in Queens On Propriety Issue
description: A budget amendment involving $5.2million for the purchase by the city of a building in Long Island City was held up yesterday after a Councilman raised some questions about the property.

title: News Summary and Index
description: FRIDAY, FEBRUARY 8, 1974

title: Ban on Shellfishing
description: PROVIDENCE, R. I., Feb. (AP)  Shellfishing has been banned over 872 acres at the mouth of Mount Hope Bay, the State Department of Health announced yesterday. The reason is an increase in pollution.

title: Events Today
description: Film

title: Highs and Lows New York Stock Exchange
description: THURSDAY, FEB. 7, 1974

title: Manhattan And Rutgers Win, 8073
description: John Hurley, a sophomore backcourt man with little playing time, woke up Manhattan College in the second overtime last night and prevented the Jaspers from giving the game away for a third time.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
lnvestigation Begun in Jersey
description: TRENTON, Feb. 7A county grand jury has begun an investigation of the gasoline crisis in New Jersey to establish a legal basis for determining whether the major oil companies are stockpiling fuel in an attempt to drive up prices.

title: Wattle Stays Amateur
description: Barring a new offer, Dave Wottle will continue to compete as an amateur during the 1973 track and field season.

title: Big Board Backs April 1 Start For Freeing SmallTrade Fees
description: The New York Stock Exchange recommended yesterday the elimination of fixed minimum commissions on orders of $2,000 or less starting April 1, 1974.

title: Serkin and Boulez Dazzle at Concert
description: We hear a lot, In this new Dark Age that we seem to be entering, about people being possessed by devils. What about a happier thought: possession by angels? The possibility suggested itself, fleetingly to be sure, at Wednesday night's New York Philharmonic Pension Fund Benefit Concert, at which Rudolf Serkin gave seraphic accounts of Mozart's Concerto in D minor (K. 466) and Beethoven's Ern, peror Concerto.

title: Pro Transactions
description: FOOTBALL

title: Kheel Criticizes Port Authority For Move to Raise PATH Fares
description: The Port Authority of New York and New Jersey was accused yesterday of moving again to raise PATH fares to 50 cents from 30 despite the opposition of Governor Byrne of New Jersey, the Jersey Legislature and half of the authority's own commissioners.

title: FIREMEN DEMAND HACKENSACK PACT
description: HACKENSACK, Feb. 7About 30 offduty Hackensack firemen began picketing City Hall today to protest what they assert are stalling tactics by the city in a twoyearold contract dispute.

title: Despite Broad Coverage of Nixon's New Health Insurance Plan, Critics Say It Has Serious Flaws
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 7President Nixon's new national health insurance plan is vastly more liberal than the one he introduced in 1971, but it extremely complicated, and critics contend it has serious flaws. Critics knowledgeable in the health field are unhappy about its reliance on the private health insurance industry, which they contend has had a mixed performance over the years, and about the use of state governments to regulate the insurance carriers. But they applaud the new plan's comprehensive coverage.

title: LOTTERY NUMBERS
Happiness Is Having New Snow
description: Joel Myers, the Penn State University meteorologist, who is the official weather forecaster for more than 50 snowmaking areas, was in a joyful mood yesterday. An overnight snowstorm had provided the East with its best ski conditions of the winter.

title: Polarization in Britain
description: A British Prime Minister usually calls an election when he believes his party has its best chance to win. Edward Heath has called an election for Feb. 28 because breakdown in negotiations with the National Union Mineworkers and the imminence of a paralyzing coal miners' strike had left him no alternative.

title: Screen: Blazing Saddles, a Western in Burlesque
description: BLAZING SADDLES, directed by Mel Brooks; screenplay by Mr. Brooks, Norman Steinberg, Andrew Bergman, Richard Pryor and Alan User, based on a story by Mr. Bergman; produced by Michael Hertzberg; director of photography, Joseph Biroc; editors, John C. Howard and Danford Greene; music romposed and conducted by John Morris; a Crossbow production, distributed by Warner Brothers. Running time: 93 minutes. At the Sutton Theater, 57th Street, east of Third Avenue. This film has been rated R.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: British Rule Spitting on Clubs Illegal

title: Nixon Sounds a Warning On RawMaterial Prices
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 7 President Nixon told Congress today that nations supplying the world with important raw materials other than oil will have a much harder time than the oilproducing countries in radically raising world prices.

title: Squires Rout Cougars, 12097
description: CHARLOTTE, N.C., Feb. 7 (AP)Virginia's front line accounted for 78 points, led by George Carter's 32, as the Squires trounced the Carolina Cougars, 12097, tonight in an American Basketball Association game.

title: Apparent Conflict Seen in Admiral's Testimony on Vietnam Raids
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 7Adm. Thomas H. Moorer, chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff, testified before the Senate Armed Services Committee 18 months ago that he had been unaware of the significance of the secret White House negotiations with the North Vietnamese in Paris in late 1971.

title: New Jersey Sports Winners and Losers
description: NEWARK, Feb. 7Ollie Gelston has a word for Montclair State's six basketball victories in a rowconfidence. And John Manning, a Montclair freshman, agrees. Manning was voted player of the week in the college division The New Jersey basketball writers.

title: Middlebury Freshman Wins Ski
description: HOLDERNESS, N.H., Feb. 7 (AP)Brant McDougall, a Middlebury College freshman from Erie Pa., won the crosscountry event, but Dartmouth into the team lead today in the opening event of the 64th Dartmouth Winter Carnival ski meet.

title: State Moves to Let Blue Cross Increase Hospital Payments
description: The State Insurance Department yesterday approved an increase of about 10 per cent in Blue Cross payments to hospitals in the greater New York area.

title: RICHARD WADDELL, ART DEALER, 50, DIES
description: Richard Hughes Waddell, owner and director of the Waddell Gallery at 50 W. 57th Street, from 1963 until last August when he became private art dealer, died Wednesday at his home, 238 East 61st Street, after a short illness. His age was 50.

title: Investigation Begun in Jersey
description: TRENTON, Feb. 7A county grand jury has begun an investigation of the gasoline crisis in New Jersey to establish a legal basis for determining whether the major oil companies are stockpiling fuel in an attempt to drive up prices.

title: Increased Role in Housing Urged on U.S. by Weaver
description: Dr. Robert C. Weaver, who became the nation's first black Cabinet officer in 1966 and who is professor at Hunter College, called on the Federal Government here yesterday to restore its subsidized housing program and take on a more direct role in providing lowand middleincome housing.

title: 9th in Row for Stars
description: SAN ANTONIO, Tex., Feb. 7 (AP)Jimmy Jones's 3point play with 52 seconds remaining lifted the Utah Stars to an 86.83 A.B.A. victory over the San Antonio Spurs tonight.

title: Contract Awards
description: The Alabama Power Company, an operating sunsidiary of the Southern Company, said yesterday it had signed a third coal purchase contract within a year with the United States Pipe & Foundry Company, a unit of the Jim Walter Corporation. Thy utility has agreed to purchase an additional 2 million tons a year of premium grade lowsulphur coal over a 21year period beginning in 1976. Under the total agreements, U. S. Pipe will now sell moo than 5million tons of coal a year to the utility and will realize more than $1.9billion in additions revenues over the lives of the three contracts.

title: The Screen
description: THE JAIL, by Michael Anderson, Paul Jacobs, Saut Landau and Bill Yahraus. At the Whitney Museum of American Art, Madison Avenue and 75th Street. Running time: 63 minutes. Until Wednesday.

title: Brooklyn Union Says Gas Terminal Holds EnergySupply Key
description: Approval for operation of a large liquefied natural gas terminal on Staten Island holds the key to this city's energy requirements, John E. Heyke Jr. chairman of the Brooklyn Uniot Gas Company, said yesterday.

title: Front Page 1  No Title
description: Larry & Jeery ollbert manage the Sunbrand Div of WILLCOX & CIBBS WGAMEX Advt.

title: CORRECTIONS
description: In a review of Susan Ries Lukas's novel Fat Emily in The New York Times last Friday, an endorsement of the book was attributed to Nora Ephron. This information, which was supplied by the publisher of the book, was incorrect. It was Nora Sayre, not Nora Ephron, who praised Fat Emily.

title: Summit Risks
description: The SovietAmerican decision to reaffirm pursuit of dtente with a Kissinger visit to Moscow in Marchto prepare another NixonBrezhnev summit meeting there, presumably in June comes at a time when the dtente itself is in trouble.

title: Jackson Up Front in 1976 Pack
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 7For Senator Henry M. Jackson, the power puzzle has fallen together almost too neatly.

title: U.S., Britain in Final
description: TORQUAY, England, Feb. 7 (UPI)Britain and the United States upheld their top seedings by reaching the final of the men's team event in the under21 tennis cup competition today.

title: Wood, Field and Stream: The Lead Pellets of Doom
description: It will surprise few who have followed the controversy over how to deal with the Problem of leadshot poisoning of ducks, geese and swans to learn that the Department of the Interiorwhose job includes the protection of wild creaturesclearly favors a ban on the use of that shot for waterfowling.

title: Nixon Requests $21Million For Arms Control Agency
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 7 (UPI) President Nixon asked Congress today to authorize $21million for continued operation of the Arms Control and Disarmament Agency over the next two years.

title: JUNKETS AN ISSUE FOR STATE AIDES
description: TRENTON, Feb. 7A 1[09]yearold law that requires outofstate land developers to pay for inspection junkets by New Jersey Real Estate Commissioners, who ultimately decide whether to permit sales to state residents, has become a source of embarrassment to the commission.

title: U.S. ACTS TO RAISE SUPPLIES OF CROPS
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 7 (UPI) In a move designed to bolster supplies available to domestic and foreign markets, the. Agriculture Department announced today that it would not extend price support loans on 197[09]crop grains, soybeans and cotton beyond their normal expiration dates this spring and summer.

title: SKYLAB 3 MISSION SET TO END TODAY
description: HOUSTON, Feb. 7The Skylab 3 crew tonight spent what was to be their last night aboard the orbiting workshop they have occupied for 84 days. Tomorrow the astronauts are to undock their Apollo spacecraft at 6:34 A.M., Eastern daylight time, and ride it to splashdown in the Pacific Ocean at 11:17 A.M.

title: Aide Says Mackell Tried to Minimize Inquiry in Swindle
description: Frederick J. Ludwig who was chief assistant district attorney of Queens when Thomas J. Mackell was the District Attorney, testified yesterday that Mr. Mackell had told him that members of their staff had invested in a fastmoney scheme and had cautioned him to proceed carefully with the investigation to avoid embarrassment and any kind of notoriety to the office.

title: JERSEYANS WILL GET LARGER TAX REFUNDS
description: NEWARK, Feb. 7 (AP)New Jersey residents are going to get larger tax refunds this year than last and many will get them sooner, the Internal Revenue Service announced today.

title: Dance: Scrolls in World Premiere
description: SCROLLS (premiere), Choreography, scur score, costume and lighting design, Alwi Nikolais. With Lisbeth lagnold, Stes Iannacone, Lynn Levine, Gladys Roman Robb Esposito, Janet Katzenberg, Suzan McDermaid, Gerald Otte, Jessica Sayre James Teeters and Fred Timm. Presente by the Nikolais Dance Theater at the Lyceum Theater.

title: Supplier Reciprocity Barred
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 7 (AP)Occidental Petroleum and the Diamond Shamrock Corporation have agreed not to require suppliers to buy from the two companies as a condition for getting orders, the Federal Trade Commission announced today.

title: Screen: Oshima's Ceremony Arrives
description: THE CEREMONY (Gishikl), directed by Nagisa Oshima; screenplay (Japanese with English subtitles) by Tsutomu Tamura, Momoru Sasaki and Mr. Oshima; director of photography, Tolchiro Narushima; editor, Kelichi Uraoka; music, Toru Takemitsu; produced by Sozosha/Art Theater Guild, for distribution by New Yorker Films. Running time: 122 minutes. At the First Avenue Screening Room, near 60th Street. This film has not been rated.

title: Mariner Data Give Hint of Origin of Venus
description: PASADENA, Calif., Feb. 7 Early analysis of the deluge of scientific data sent by Mariner 10 as it flew past Venus on Tuesday has lent support to the view that the manner in which that planet was horn and matured differed basically from that of the earth, leaving Venus barren of water from the beginning.

title: Yeoman Quoted as Saying Admirals Asked Files
description: Yeoman 1st Cl. Charles E. Radford, a principal figure in a Senate inquiry into military spying inside the White House, said last night that he had passed information from the files of Henry A. Kissinger to the Pentagon at the request of two admirals, C.B.S. News reported.

title: Net Up 75% at American Metal Climax
Aide Says Mackell Tried to Minimize Inquiry in Swindle
description: Frederick J. Ludwig who was chief assistant district attorney of Queens when Thomas J. Mackell was the District Attorney, testified yesterday that Mr. Mackell had told him that members of their staff had invested in a fastmoney scheme and had cautioned him to proceed carefully with the investigation to avoid embarrassment and any kind of nooriety to the office.

title: Bombing Toll 12 in Britain
description: BRADFORD, England, Feb. 8 (AP)The death toll rose to 12. today in Britain's worst terror attack of the century, the, bombing of a busload of troops and their families three days ago. The police believe the bombing was the work of a splinter group of the Irish Republican Army.

title: Miss Proell Wins Downhill Title
description: ST. MORITZ, Switzerland, Feb. 7When she's on skis, Annemarie MoserProell doesn't listen to her husband's warnings about going too fast.

title: OTB Bettor May Have to Pay Admission If State Has Way
description: If the State Racing and Wagering Board has its way, New York's offtrack bettors eventually will pay for the privilege of playing what originally was described as the New Game in Town.

title: Bruins Beat Blues, 53; Esposito: 46
description: BOSTON, Feb. 7 (AP)Wayne Cashman, Carol Vadnais and Johnny Bucyk struck for goals within a 2minute34second span in the second period and the Boston Bruins went on to a 53 National Hockey League victory over the St. Louis Blues tonight.

title: LATE CITY EDITION
description: Weather: Mostly sunny today; cold tonight. Fair and cold tomorrow. Temp. range: today 2338; Thursday 2833. Additional details on Page 61.

title: Maude's Maid Goes on to Good Times
description: Television devotees may mourn the departure of Esther Rolle as Florida, the black maid who cheerfully gave as much as she took from her white, uppermiddleclass employers in Maude.

title: No Lack of Pique in Fuel Pinch
description: In the last few months people in the metropolitan area have become increasingly suspicious and angry, insecure, devious, often violent and seldom resigned, all because of the lack of gasoline.

title: FORD SAYS NIXON
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 7VicePresident Ford said today ??resident Nixon had assured him that a release of key Water gate tape recordings and documents is being actively considered.

title: CROSSWORD PUZZLE
description: ACROSS

title: City Approves Cable TV Rate Increases
description: The Board of Estimate voted unanimously yesterday to permit New York City's two ailing cable TV systems, SterlingManhattan and TeleprompterManhattan, to increase their base monthly charges to subscribers to $7 for the service and $2 for rental of the converter, from the present comparable rates of $5 and $1. Permission was also granted to increase installation fees from $9.95 to $14.95.

title: Trackers Reach Accord, Leaders Ask Strike End
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 7Negotiators for independent truck operators called today for an end to the truck strike after reaching agreement with the Government on concessions that included a surcharge on freight rates.

title: Mrs. Ingrid Magnuson, 70, Detergent Manufacturer
description: Mrs. Ingrid Magnuson, chairman and president of the Magnuson Products Corporation, 50 Court Street, Brooklyn, died yesterday at the Peck Memorial Hospital in Brooklyn. She was 70 years old and lived at 50 Plaza Street, Brooklyn.

title: RIGHTS SUIT AIMS AT CHICAGO FUNDS
description: CHICAGO, Feb. 7Two Illinois civil rights groups asked a Federal Court today to order the suspension of all Federal general revenuesharing funtis for Chicago until it remedies racial discrimination in the Police Department.

title: Sisco Nomination Cleared By Foreign Relations Panel
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 7 (UPI) The Senate Foreign Relations Committee today unanimously approved the nomination of Joseph J. Sisco to be Under Secretary of State for Political Affairs.

title: Felon Faces $13.9Million Suit In Caribbean Hotel TakeOver
description: NEWARK, Feb. 7 (AP)  A $13.9million civil damage suit was filed today by a Caribbean island hotel owner who said his resort was taken over by an associate of the late underworld boss Angelo DeCarlo. Mr. DeCarlo died in 1973 after being released from a Federal prison.

title: CLASSIFIED ADVERTISING INDEX
description: Page

title: People and Business
description: Robert Anderson, 53 years old, was elected yesterday as chief executive officer of the Rockwell International Corporation. He had been president and chief operating officer since February, 1970. His new title is president and chief executive officer.

title: Bethlehem Will Cut Output Million Tons
description: The Bethlehem Steel Corporation said yesterday that it would have to cut back its raw steel production by about one million Eons in the next six months because of a shortage, of metallurgical coal.

title: BEAME ASKS SHIFT IN RENT CONTROLS
description: Mayor Beame, accused by opponents during his election campaign of being too close to realestate interests, yesterday urged state legislation on apartment rents and landlordtenant relations that was certain to be fought vigorously by landlords here.

title: Calif. Girl Wins Novice Skate Title
description: PROVIDENCE, R. I., Feb. 7 (AP)  Jeanne Chapman of Garden Grove, Calif., won the novice ladies title at the United States figure skating championships tonight at the Providence Civic Center.

title: Pennsy Reduces Losses; Pan Am Shows '73 Deficit
description: The Penn Central Transportation Company's trustees notified Judge John P. Fullam of the United States District Court in Philadelphia yesterday that the huge carrier had a net loss last year of $172.5million, record revenues of $1.96billion not withstanding.

title: 6 U.S. TeenAgers Are Fined In Thailand Sacrilege Case
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Feb. 7 (AP)Six American teenagers were fined $50 each last night and given threemonth suspended jail sentences for committing sacrildge by climbing on a statue of Buddha.

title: Ruling to Throw Out Conviction In Harlem Six Case Reversed
description: A decision to throw out a controversial murder conviction in the Harlem Six case was reversed yesterday by an appeals court.

title: Business Records
description: BANKRUPTCY PROCEEDINGS

title: About New York
description: It stole upon him Saturday, although he hardly knew it at the time, and he thought only that he was a little tired. On Sunday, however, he was still tired, and so he brooded about the passage of years and had melancholy thoughts about aging. That night, he went to a party, where he flung himself about so recklessly in an Irish jig that he got to feeling exhausted, When he returned home he brooded about cardiac arrest.

title: Senate Unit Approves Two
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 7 (Reuters)  The Senate Banking Committee approved today the nominations of Irving Pollack to be a member of the Securities and Exchange Commission and Henry C. Wallich to be a governor of the Federal Reserve Board. Both nominations now go to the full Senate for final confirmation, with no opposition expected.

title: Liguori Hopes to End 5Race Losing String Tonight
description: When we last left Marty Liguori, he was running the fastest indoor miles of his careerand losing each time in the final few strides.

title: ANSWER TO PREVIOUS PUZZLE
A Bad Idea Persists
description: Nothing arouses the fears of prison inmates more than socalled behavior modification programs, and no wonder. Behavior modification is a catchall term that can mean anything from brain surgery to a kind of Clockwork Orange mental conditioning; it usually includes drug experimentation, and in all too many cases it is aimed more nearly at producing docile prisoners than upright citizens.

title: POMPIDOU HAS FLU, STIRRING RUMORS
description: PARIS, Feb. 7The Elyse Palace announced today that Prestdent Pompidou is ill with flu, unleashing a flood of longmuted rumors that he may soon resign for health reasons and call new elections. resign for health reasons and call new elections.

title: BRITISH ELECTIONS CALLED BY HEATH FOR MONTH'S END
description: LONDON, Feb. 7  Prime Minister Heath, taking his struggle with Britain's coal miners to the voters, ordered Parliament dissolved today and called a general election for Feb. 28.

title: ROBERT TRUEBLOOD, LEADING ACCOUNT ANT
description: Robert M. Trueblood, since 1967 chairman of the board of Touche Ross & Co., public accountants, died yesterday in Chicago, where he lived. He had suffered from leukemia. His age was 57.

title: Briefs on Energy
description: U.S. Ruling.to Cost City $420,000

title: U.S.BUILT JET PLANT SOUGHT FOR SOVIET
description: LOS ANGELES, Feb. 7 (UPI) The Soviet Union has asked three United States aerospace companies to build a sevenfactory complex for commercial jetliners in the Soviet Union, The Armed Forces Journal has reported.

title: Airlines Are Fed Up Over the Free Meals
description: Was the steak missing on your last flight to Miami? Did the stewardess neglect to give you a bag of nuts with your martini?

title: OccidentalLibya Exploration Pact Set
description: Dr. Armand Hammer, chairman of the Occidental Petroleurn Company, announced yesterday that its subsidiary in Libya had signed a new 35year agreement with the Libyan Government for oil exploration.

title: MRS. MARGARET THOMAS
description: SOMERS, N. Y. Feb. 7Mrs. Margaret Ledyard Field Thomas, widow of David C. Thomas who was vice president of the advertising firm of Cecil & Presbrey, died yesterday at the Somers Manor Nursing Home. She was 89 years old and lived at 200 East 66th Street, New York, and in Madison, Conn.

title: Market Place: Simplicity Simplicity Of Fashion Now
description: The Simplicity Pattern Company, the dominant manufacturer of paper patterns for women's and children's clothing, has been one of those quietly spectacular stocks that long ago found a niche in the nifty fifty holdings of the major bank trust departments.

title: Suspect, 21, Seized In Hillside Murders At a Bowling Alley
description: HILLSIDE, Feb. 7  A 21yearold East Orange man was arraigned today on charges of murdering two maintenance workers at a bowling alley here yesterday.

title: Meat Supplies Dip Dramatically in City
description: Wholesale meat supplies (have been dramatically reduced here, the city's Department of Consumer Affairs said yesterday after surveying the effect of the truckers' strike, and many items may not be available at all by the beginning of next week, even if the strike is settled immediately.

title: Brimmer of Federal Reserve Finds Black Job Gains in 1973
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 7Employment opportunities for black Americans rose significantly in 1973, according to Dr. Andrew F. Brimmer, member of the Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System.

title: Elder and Harris Lead Miller By Shot at 140 in Desert Golf
description: PALM SPRINGS, Calif., Feb. 7Johnny Miller, who set a record by winning the first three tournaments of the 1974 pro golf tour before being forced out by a heavy cold, moved into a strong position in the Bob Hope Desert Classic today by scoring a secondround 69 for a 141 total. It left him one stroke behind Lee Elder, who added a 71 to his openingday 69, and Labron Harris, who posted a 140 by shooting his second 70.

title: Avon Increases Dividend
description: Directors of Avon Products, Inc. increased yesterday the quarterly dividend on Avon common stock from 35 cents share to 37 cents a share. The new dividend is payable March 1 to holders of record Feb. 18.

title: Haig Sees Nixon Near End of Tunnel
