title: A Summary of the Actions and Rulings in Variety of Cases Announced by the United States Supreme Court
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 19The United States Supreme Court took the following actions today:

title: For the Children, Some Things to Do
description: Films

title: Simon Increases Gasoline For 20 States This Month
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 19William E. Simon, the Federal Energy Administrator, ordered today emergency allocations of 84 million gallons of gasoline this month to 20 states, including New York, New Jersey and Connecticut.

title: Philadelphians, Led By Mehta, Display Splendor in Planets
description: Perhaps it was just as well that Gustav Holst's interest in planets was astrological rather than scientifically astronomical or literarily mythological. It helped him to produce one of the more imaginative and colorful orchestral works of the World War I era. When all its seven sections are played together, as they were in the Philadelphia Orchestra's concert in Philharmonic Hall on Monday night, the work seems overdrawn, and what was once considered an advanced piece now has its trite passages.

title: KENT STATE INCIDENT IS RECREATED BY U.S.
description: KENT, Ohio, Feb. 19 (AP)Shots rang out over a nearly deserted campus at Kent State University as Justice Department officials recreated the 1970 clash between National Guardsmen and antiwar demonstrators. Four students were killed and nine wounded in the May 4 gunfire.

title: William Snaith, Designer, Dies; President of Loewy/Snaith, 65
description: William T. Snaith, president of the pioneering industrial design concern of Raymond Loewy/William Snaith, Inc., died yesterday while undergoing openheart surgery in New York Hospital. He lived on Route 57 in Weston, Conn., and at 400 East 56th Street. He was 65 years old.

title: 2 Officers Say Bribery Pervaded Narcotics Unit
description: Two New York police officers have given evidence showing that at least half of the detectives assigned to the lite unit charged with arresting major heroin dealers here were accepting large cash bribes be tween 1968 and 1971, law enforcement sources said yesterday.

title: Seminary's Students Walk Out, Will Continue Studies in Exile
description: ST. LOUIS, Feb. 19Most of the students at the Concordia Lutheran Seminary here abandoned the institution today and said that they would continue theological studies at a seminary in exile at St. Louis University Divinity School, which is run by Jesuits.

title: CITY POST KEPT BY MRS. NORTON
description: Mayor Beame announced yesterday the reappointment of Eleanor Holmes Norton as chairman of the City Commission on Human Rights.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yesterday was:

title: NEW LAW ON RAPE SIGNED BY WILSON
description: ALBANY, Feb. 10Governor Wilson signed into law today an act eliminating the need for corroboration to prove the crime of rape. In the Assembly, another measure sought by women'srights advocatesoutlawing credit and banking discrimination  was passed and sent to the Senate.

title: Oil Spills Bring Out New Specialists
description: CAMDENDavid Stith, a specialist in fighting oil spills, was relaxing in his office here one day when a call from an oilcompany official sent him racing to the scene of a spill on the Delaware River near Chester, Pa.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: A Price Dip Noted For Family Dinner

title: France Agrees to Give Libya LongTerm Aid in Return for Oil
description: PARIS, Feb. 19  France and Libya today signed an agreement in principle for a longterm program of Libyan economic development.

title: Loss of Ford Seat Shakes G.O.P.; Democrats Predict Sweep in Fall
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 19The loss of Vice President Ford's former Congressional seat to Democrat yesterday  left Republicans badly shaken today, while Democrats jubilantly predicted landslide victories this fall.Mr. Ford said he was just a little bit frightened by the election outcome in Michigan's Fifth District. George Bush, the Republican National Chairman, said he was concerned. Watergate killed us, said William McLaughlin, the Republican State Chairman in Michigan.In the election, Richard F. VanderVeen, the Democrat, defeated Robert VanderLaan, the Republican candidate, by 53,008 votes to 46,159.

title: Extension of Control Asked
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 19 (AP)  Senator William Proxmire, Democrat of Wisconsin, urged Congress today to extend wage and price controls for at least 30 or 45 days beyond their April 30 expiration date. Mr. Proxmire, in a Senate speech, also suggested that Congress consider setting up machinery to prevent or roll back selected price and wage increases that would have a substantial effect on inflation.

title: Soviet Opens Big NaturalGas Relatively Near Markets in Europe
description: The Soviet Union, pursuing an active policy of resources development, has opened up a huge natural gas field that yields sulphur, a key chemical material, as a byproduct.

title: SILVER AT PEAKS IN ACTIVE TRADING
description: Silver futures set another record in active trading here yesterday after a session marked by wildly swinging prices. One commodity broker, with weariness in his voice, described the trading as chaos.

title: SAIGON ESTABLISHES LINKS WITH SAUDIS
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Feb. 20 The Foreign Ministry announced today that South Vietnam and Saudi Arabia had agreed to establish full diplomatic relations.

title: Law Graduate Held In $607,000 Fraud
description: A 33yearold Harvard Law School graduate, described by the police as independently wealthy but fascinated by the challenge of constructing elaborate schemes to steal money, was arrested yesterday and charged with thefts of $607,000 in bonds.

title: KISSINGER TO VISIT MIDEAST TO SPUR A SYRIAN ACCORD
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 19President Nixon announced today that Secretary of State Kissinger would go to the Middle East next week to help get talks under way between Israel and Syria. But he had nothing to say about the lifting of the Arabs' oil embargo against the United States.

title: New Brunswick's New Black Mayor Takes His Post
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, Feb. 19 Aldrage B. Cooper Jr. today became the first black Mayor of this city of 47,000, the seat of Middlesex County, succeeding Mrs. Patricia Q. Sheehan, who resigned to betome New Jerseys Conunisgoner of Public Affairs.

title: Main Break Washes Out Downtown IRT During Rush
description: Hundreds of thousands of subway riders were delayed yesterday morning after a water main broke at Canal and Varick Streets and sent 600,000 gallons gushing into the Seventh Avenue IRT Canal Street station.

title: Flowers to Join W. F. L. Club in 1975; Boston Franchise Shifts to New York
description: The World Football League brought to New York yesterday the skeleton of a new team and at the same time took away one body, that of Richmond Flowers of the Giants. Flowers said that he would exercise the option clause in his Giant contract and that next year, after becoming a free agent on May 1, 1975, he would play for the Honolulu team of the W.F.L.

title: On British Hustings
description: LONDON, Feb. 19The handscribbled newspaper billboards across the newly scrubbed Inns of Court on Fleet Street are alive these days with alarming statistics about the economy of Britain.

title: Nastase Beats Hardie In Open Tennis, 61, 64
description: SALISBURY, Md., Feb. 19 (AP)Ilie Nastase of Rumania, the No. 1 seed, swept into the third round of the national indoor open tennis championships tonight with a 61, 64 victory over George Hardie.

title: Illegal Cambodian Arms Trade With Rebels Seen
description: Foreign military analysts say, for example, that there is ample evidence showing that at least some of the artillery shells that have fallen on Phnom Penh recently, killing and wounding nearly 1,000 people, reached the insurgents through corrupt officials.

title: Hearst Details Food Plan Aimed at Freeing Daughter
description: SAN, FRANCISCO, Feb. 19Randolph A. Hearst disclose' a food distribution plan today that will be financed with $2million contribution by him operated, by an experience staff, supervised by representa tives of the poor and dedicates to getting his daughter, Patricia, released by her abductors.

title: Guild Sues on Paper Rules
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 19 (UPI)  The Newspaper Guild filed suit today in a Federal District Court to keep the Justice Department from implementing regulations that would allow newspapers to combine their operations without approval of the Attorney General. The suit, filed on behalf of the Guild by the Institute for Public Interest Representation at Georgetown University's law center, seeks to reverse regulations that exempt papers from antitrust laws involving profit pooling, price fixing and market splitting by joint newspaper operations.

title: Clark Raises Tuition by $300
description: WORCESTER, Mass., Feb. 19 (AP)  Clark University announced a $300 tuition increase today, starting with the 19741975 academic year. The increase will raise the annual tuition to $3,100.

title: Arthur Elrod Killed in Crash; Interior Designer Was 49
description: PALM SPRINGS, Calif. Feb. 19 (AP)  Arthur Elrod, an interior designer whose work on be seen in nearly every major city in the country, died in car accident here yesterday. He was 49 years old.

title: CROSSWORD PUZZLE
description: ACROSS

title: Eastern College Hockey
Ervin Opens Drive For a Bill to Halt Senseless Busing
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 19 (AP)  Senator Sam J. Ervin Jr. opened today a new drive for legislation to end what he called this senseless, forced busing of schoolchildren to achieve racial balance.

title: TV: Looking In on Continental Baths
description: Tonight's Wednesday Night at the Movies on the National Broadcasting Company network is called A Case of Rape to be reviewed in this space tomorrow and it is one of the better madeforTV films this season. However, it opens with warning that the program treats a sensitive subject in a mature and forthright manner not recommended for children and others who might be disturbed. As TV swings steadily toward the more permissive, that warning could become a regular fixture on the home

title: Senate Votes Energy. Bill With Oil Price Rollback
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 19Despite a new threat of  a presidential veto, the Senate approved today a compromise emergency energy bill rolling back domestic crude oil prices.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: LEEDS, England, Feb. 19 (AP)Bristol City scored one of the biggest British soccer upsets in recent years today when it defeated previously unbeaten Leeds United, 10, and advanced to the quarterfinals of the English Football Association Cup.

title: Witness Says Brown Reported Having Had Static With Cops
description: Hours after the murders of Police Officers Gregory P. Foster and Rocco W. Laurie two years ago, a witness at Henry S. Brown's murder trial said yesterday, Mr. Brown went to a Brooklyn apartment, took a revolver from under his coat and spilled live and spent shells onto a bed.

title: Market Place: Clues and Cues From Reports
description: When corporations fail to say in their annual reports what they tell the Securities and Exchange Commission in their regular 10K reports, Wall Street professionals who have the time and resources to mine facts on file with the agency may gain an edge.

title: E.E.C. Unit Fails On Farm Accord; Elections Blamed
description: BRUSSELS, Feb. 19The European Economic Community's agricultural ministers meeting here today failed to agree on farm prices for the 197475 season and gave up all hope of meeting the March 1 deadline for the decision.

title: HEARING SET ON BID TO SUBPOENA NIXON
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 19  A hearing has been scheduled March 15 in Superior Court here to resolve an attempt by John D. Ehrlichman and two other former White House aides to subpoena President Nixon as a witness at their upcoming trial in Los Angeles.

title: Cape Cod Studies Plan To Form the 51st State
description: BARNSTABLE, Mass., Feb. 19 (AP)The 15town Barnstable County Selectmen's Association has voted to study a proposal for Cape Cod to secede from Massachusetts to form the 51st state in the Union.

title: Nordic Ski Race Won By Myrmo
description: FALUN, Sweden, Feb. 19 (AP)Norway finally cracked the Eastern European domination of the World Nordic ski championships today when Magne Myrmo won the men's 15kilometer crosscountry race.

title: 4 EXPERTS NAMED FOR ROTHKO CASE
description: The Attorney General's office obtained permission in Surrogate Court yesterday to set definite dates for the appearance of art experts in the trial of the challenge to the handling of the estate of Mark Rotko, the abstract expressionist painter.

title: Bridge: Kaplan and Kay Combination Changes but Still Triumphs
description: The worldrenowned partnership of Kaplan and Kay was in action with a difference at the New York Hilton Hotel here Monday.

title: JAMES SKINNER JR., EXHEAD OF PHILCO
description: PHILADELPHIA, Feb. 19 (AP)James M. Skinner Jr., former president of the Philco Corporation was found dead today in his car, with its motor running in the garage of his home in Chestnut Hill. He was 65 years old.

title: INA Unit Sees Losses
description: The Insurance Company of North America, a subsidiary of INA Corporation, has estimated that insurance losses of up to $5million might result from the unprecedented rainfall and flooding in northern and central Australia, it was announced yesterday.

title: Senate Votes Energy Bill With Oil Price Rollback
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 19Despite a new threat of Presidential veto, the Senate approved today a compromise emergency energy bill rolling back domestic crude oil prices.

title: HARRY C. SIMON
description: Harry C. Simon, president and founder of Sitrue Products Inc., paper and tissue manufacturers, which was liquidated last year after it was acquired by Doeskin Products, Inc., died yesterday at Flower Fifth Avenue Hospital. His age was 89 and he lived at 470 Park Avenue.

title: Going Out Guide
description: PLAY IT AGAIN The Performers Committee for TwentiethCentury Music is back for a new, eighth season of retrospective concerts. Tonight at 8, it will be this is your life for Aaron Copland, whose compositions span 50 years. The concert, at Columbia University's McMillin Theater, Broadway and 116th Street, will include a number of Copland's less performed works, and will reflect stages of his musiccreating life from As It Fell Upon a Day in 1923, to Duo for Flute and Piano, 1971.

title: DOLLAR ADVANCES IN SOME MARKETS
description: LONDON, Feb. 19 (UPI)The price of gold clung to nearrecord levels today, while the dollar steadied and even gained in some markets.

title: Exemplary Board
description: The reorganized Board of Higher Education, which sets policy for the City University, offers an example other public bodies in this city and state with its decision to open its monthly meetings to the public and press.

title: Girl, 16, Is Held as Thief Who Took Victim's Check
description: A 16yearold girl who used an imitation plastic gun to rob an actress of $4 and then forced her to write a $25 check was held in $1,000 bail yesterday for a grand jury investigation.

title: PREARRANGEMENT IN OIL BIDS FOUND
description: Investigators for the California Legislature say they have uncovered evidence that some of the nation's major oil companies may be circumventing the state's rules on bidding for offshore oil.

title: About New York Paying More but Buying More
description: The news the other day was that the Department of Labor's price index on farm products and processed foods rose 3.1 per cent in January, which meant that it had gone up 30 per cent in a year. On Ogden Avenue in the Bronx, it meant that people were still buying lots of food, although now they were doing it with more care.

title: MERGER PLANNED FOR WARD FOODS
description: Ward Foods, Inc., announced yesterday it had agreed in principle to merge the Tobin Packing Company of Rochester into a wholly owned subsidiary of Ward Foods. Tobin Packing is a regional meat packer in upstate New York with sales of about $110  million last year. The company markets mostly premiumpriced meat products.

title: Jersey Gas Deal Broker Indicted for Hess Theft
description: Ernest Saldutti, Cherry Hill, N. J., gasoline dealer and broker, who said yesterday that he could provide 68 million gallons of gasoline for New Jersey service stations, is under indictment for larceny and the theft of gasoline from the Hess Oil Company, a spokesman for Governor Byrne said yesterday.

title: BID ON PRICE RISES HINTED AT BY G.M.
description: DETROIT, Feb. 19 (UPI)The General Motors Corporation hinted today it might seek another price increase on its 1974 models despite an earlier pledge to hold the line until 1975 models are introduced in September.In a statement indicating it definitely will want to raise prices on the 1975 models, G.M. said, in fact, we may have to seek relief before that time.The four major United States auto makers received permission to increase prices in December and; with the exception of the Chrysler Corporation, agreed there would be no further increases until September.

title: LEONARD BUCK, 80, ORE DEALER, DIES
description: Leonard J. Buck, founder of Leonard J. Buck & Co., Inc., importer and exporter of manganese and other ores, died yesterday of a heart attack at his winter home, Allwood Planation, in Thomasville Ga. He was 80 years old and lived also in Far Hills, N. J.

title: A.C.L.U. Sues on Surveillance By U.S. Amy in West Germany
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 19The American Civil Liberties Union filed suit in United States District Court here today to enjoin the United States Army from continuing surveillance of American servicemen and civilians in West. Germany.

title: Russian Deplores Linguistic Barbarism
description: MOSCOW, Feb, 17The defenders of the purity of the Russian language have a new bone to pick with the Pentagon. It is responsible, one leading linguistdiplomat lamented, for helping to insinuate corrupting terminy into the Russian mother tongue.

title: PARENTS REASSURED ON REYE'S DISEASE
description: CHICAGO, Feb. 19 (AP)A Chicago doctor has assured alarmed parents that there is no epidemic of Reye's syndrome, a disease that has killed 11 children in Wisconsin and Illinois in the last two weeks.

title: Omen or Omission?
description: There is always a period of quiet transitional chaos at the beginning of a new administration when appointments are being made and policy is vague and no one knows which way to jump. At this time, partly through inertia and partly through dislocation, inestimable damage may be done. This appears to be true for the Office of Midtown Planning and Development, one the special planning offices established by Mayor Lindsay that have set a record for constructive and creative guidance of the city's growth.

title: Greece Reports Thwarting Of a Communist Coup Plot
description: ATHENS, Feb. 19The Government said tonight that it had defeated a Communist plot to overthrow it through renewed student disorders this week and had arrested Communist leaders, 13 of them members of the central committee of the banned party.

title: New Curbs on Opposition Proposed in South Africa
description: CAPETOWN, Feb. 10Legislation that appears intended to surpress all opposition was laid before the South African Parliament today by Prime Minister John Vorster's Government. The Government has a firm majority in Parliament.

title: BADILLO ASKS EASING OF RULES ON VOTING
description: Representative Herman Badillo, the Bronx Democrat, urged yesterday that the requirements for voter registration be relaxed so that more people could register and vote. The best way to do this, he said, would be to permit registration by mail instead of in person.

title: I.R.S. RETHINKING SUBPOENA POLICY
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 19The Internal Revenue Service has decided to rethink the policies and procedures under which, it issues subpoenasparticularly subpoenas involving pressthe commissioner of the tax agency said today.

title: Illinois Central Industries Finds Midas Sales Slower
description: Sales of brake pads by the Abex Corporation, a subsidiary of Illinois Central Industries, have not yet been materially affected by reduced automobile driving, according to William B. Johnson, chair, man of the big conglomerate.

title: Aid Program Needed
description: AMSTERDAM, The NetherlandsAlthough the Arab oil embargo was deliberately aimed at The Netherlands with the idea of punishing it for a policy seen as biased in favor of Israel, Dutch ingenuity managed to minimize boycott effects and Dutch generosity is concerned with the effects of the energy crisis on the world's poor, developing lands.

title: A.L. Publicist Resigns
description: BOSTON, Feb. 19 (AP)Tom Monahan, publicity director for baseball's American League since June, 1972, has resigned effective June 1.

title: Brooklyn Hearings On City's Budget Focus on Schools
description: Members of the Board of Estimate and the City Council's Finance Committee made the third stop in their decentralized capitalbudget hearings yester day, listening to pleas of Brooklyn residents in a daylong session at Borough Hall.

title: Bill Asks Gasoline Rationing
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 19 (AP) Calling predictions of an early end to gasoline shortages a fraud, Senator Lowell P. Weicker, Republican of Connecticut, introduced legislation today that would make rationing mandatory. The crisis isn't easing; it's getting worse, he said.

title: Bank Robbed of $100,000
description: ARLINGTON HEIGHTS, Ill., Feb. 19 (UPI)  A masked gunman robbed the drivein unit of the First Arlington Heights National Bank of $100,000 early today. He met the teller, whose name was withheld by the police, as she arrived to open the drivein facility shortly before 7 A.M. and forced her to open a small vault where the money was kept.

title: 2 Mansions on 91st Dubbed Landmarks Of Beaux Arts Style
description: Two BeauxArtsstyle mansions on 91st Street near Fifth Avenue were designated city landmarks yesterday after a fouryear dispute with the buildings' owner, the Convent of the Sacred Heart.

title: GleasonHope Prelude Attracts 30,000 at Golf
description: LAUDERHILL, Fla., Feb. 20 The pro golfing tour moved into Florida today aided by some theatrical props.

title: 2 Towers Rise Above Mediocrity
description: It is no secret that the design of most of New York's recent speculative office buildingsthose built by developers who seek to fill them with tenants, rather than those put up by the occupants themselyes  has been abysmal. But in the office boom of the midnineteensixties, it seemed as anything with four walls and a roof could be rented, and more imaginative design was all too often passed up as a needless frill.

title: Chess: Ay, There's the Ruoto See A Goal and Then, Alas, to Flub
description: There is nothing worse than to fight an uphill battle courageously and then, in sight of the goal, flub it.

title: G.M. OVERSEAS NET SHOWS 27.8% RISE
description: DETROIT Feb. 20The General Motors Corporation said today earnings from overseas operations amounted to $216million in 1973, up 27.8 per cent from $169million in 1972.

title: Panel Backs Reactor Project on Coast
description: SANTA BARBARA, Calif., Feb. 20The California Coastal Zone Conservation Commission reversed itself today and approved the expansion of a shoreline nuclear power plant near San Diego that it had previously banned for environmental reasons.

title: Canadian Aide to Study Foreign Investing
description: OTTAWA, Feb. 19Canada's new arbiter of foreign investment proposals says that he is scarcely more certain than anyone else in this capital city about just how his potentially powerful job will evolve.

title: DEMOCRATS SEEK QUICK NIXON TEST ON IMPEACHMENT
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 20  Democratic members of the House Judiciary Committee decided today to seek specific items of Watergate evidence from the White House to test President Nixon's willingness to cooperate with the House impeachment inquiry.

title: NEW GAS QUOTAS DEFENDED BY U. S.
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 20  Federal energy officials expressed concern today over what they considered misinterpretation of the amount of relief provided through an emergency allocation of new gasoline supplies to 20 states hard hit by shortages.

title: CONFEREES VOTE $800MILLION AID TO MASS TRANSIT
description: A HouseSenate conference committee voted out an $800million emergency masstransitaid bill yesterday that transit officials here said could be a major step toward saving New York City's 35cent fare.

title: Venezia Tries Riding in Japan, And Finds It's a TwoDay Week
description: Mike Venezia was working hard at Belmont Park yesterday morning, riding horses in preparation for the start of the local thoroughbred campaign on Monday. The 27yearold Brooklynborn jockey has been working horses for almost two weeks, ever since his return from Japan. And it was not our 3yearold picture he wanted to talk about yesterday; it was about his sojourn in Japan.

title: A Million for Mailer
description: Norman Mailer is reported to have signed a $1million contract with Little, Brown, the Boston publishing house, fore rights to his next novel. The figure is the highest known payment agreed to for an unpublished work of fiction, according to a number of publishing executives. Details, Page 24.

title: What Bees and Flowers Know...
description: BERKELEY, Calif.  Charles Darwin's idea of natural selection through survival of the fittest has been interpreted by some people to mean that life is a freeforall struggle in which fitness is equated with aggression by tooth and claw and the ability to achieve an immediate advantageas if it were a law of nature that must be obeyed.

title: Mine Removal in Suez Canal Progresses
description: CAIRO, Feb. 20Egypt, using some of the most advanced naval mine detection equipment in existence, has cleared several miles of the Suez Canal of mines and shells accumulated since the war of June, 1967, according to Osman Ahmed Osman, the Minister of Reconstruction.

title: The Other News
description: International

title: Cougars Defeat Squires
description: GREENSBORO, N.C., Feb. 20 (UPI)Mack Calvin's 21 points led eight Carolina players in double figures tonight as the Cougars posted a 128121 triumph ever the Virginia, Squires.

title: The Moorer Affair
description: Testimony by Secretary of State Kissinger and Admiral Thomas H. Moorer, chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff, in the Senate Armed Services Committee's inquiry into military spying in the White House presents a profoundly disturbing picture of civilian weakness and ethical confusion at the highest levels of the Government.

title: Couple Survives Crash
description: GATLINBURG, Tenn., Feb. 20 (UPI)  A couple was led to safety yesterday after spending more than three days in the snowshrouded mountains where their plane crashed. Five other survivors were rescued Monday. A spokesman for the Great Smoky Mountains National Park Service said Russell McCarra and his wife, Zella, of New Orleans, were in good shape considering the threehour trek through rain, snow sleet and high winds.

title: Dunlop Opposes '74 CarPrice Rises
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 20 (UPI) The Government's top price cotnroller said today he opposed any new price rises on 1974model cars and trucks and indicated that the auto industry ought to stick to an antiinflation pledge made just three months ago.

title: NORMAN SERPHOS, PHILATELIST DIES
description: NEW ROCHELLE, N. Y., Feb. 20Norman Serphos, former president of the Scott Stamp & Coin Company, Inc., of West 47th Street in New York, one of the oldest philatelic concerns in the country, died here today at a nursing home. He was 83 years old and lived at 24 Keogh Lane.

title: Nets Beat Tams for 9th Time
SUBHUNTING JETS RECEIVED BY NAVY
description: SAN DIEGO, Feb. 20The first of the Lockheed S3A carrierbased jet aircraft that the Navy says will revolutionize its capability to hunt down and destroy nuclear submarines were delivered to the Pacific fleet here today.

title: Precarious Truce Remains After Rampage in St. Albans
description: The windows and the cash registers have been replaced. The tacos and the thick shakes are being sold again. And Charlie Brown and Mouse and Apache Kid are back in their favorite seats at the Jack in the Box.

title: U.S. Asks Meeting on Monday Of FollowUp Group on Energy
description: BRUSSELS, Feb. 20  The United States has invited the 12 other major oilconsuming nations that participated, in the energy conference in Washington last week to return on Monday for the frist meeting of the followup coordinating group.

title: Grace Church Vote Calls for Demolition Of Historic Houses
description: Members of the vestry of Grace Church, the Gothic Revival landmark at Broadway and 10th Street, voted yesterday to go ahead with plans to build new facilities requiring the demolition of two adjacent historic houses on Fourth Avenue.

title: KISSINGER MEETS WITH ARAB ENVOYS
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 20  Secretary of State Kissinger today held a last meeting with the Arab envoys currently visiting Washington, setting the stage for the next round of Middle East negotiations.

title: Economists in Paris Put Theory Aside and Strike
description: PARIS, Feb. 20Some of the world's sharpest economic brains have failed to solve their own central economic problems, and so they went on strike today.

title: People and Business
description: The Chicago Board Options Exchange, established last April as an offspring of the Chicago Board of Trade, named its first three public directors yesterday.

title: 60% OIL ACCORD SIGNED BY QATAR
description: DOHA, Qatar, Feb. 20 (Reuters)Qatar signed today an agreement with the two oilproducing companies here giving the state a 60 per cent share in their operations.

title: SUGAR MEN URGE CONTROL EXTENSION
description: Spokesman for sugar growing and refining industries urged Congress today to reject Administration proposals to eliminate domestic sugar planting controls, grower subsidies and a $110millionayear processing tax on sugar. Instead, an industry spokesman told the House Agriculture Committee, Congress should extend the Federal sugar control law which expires at the end of 1974 with continued but raised marketing quotas and with pricing changes aimed at encouraging increased production.

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: Kuwait Reported Easing Oil Prices
description: LONDON, Feb. 21The Financial Times reported tonight that the Kuwaiti Government was prepared to sell stateowned oil at lower prices than it had hoped for in its major auction.

title: $750 Is Paid for Dog Killed by Policeman
description: DETROIT, Feb. 20 (AP) To Peter Saber, money cannot replace Tiny, his mediumsized mongrel dog. But he felt those he held responsible owed him something, nonetheless.

title: C.U.N.Y. Fives in Tourney
description: The City University of New York basketball tournament will be held at Roosevelt Hall on the campus of Brooklyn College on Feb. 28, March 2 and 3. Competing will be Banich, Brooklyn, City, Hunter, John Jay, Lehman, Medgar Evers, Queens and York. Brooklyn College won the 1973 tournament.

title: Television
description: Cable TV

title: CROSSWORD PUZZLE
description: ACROSS

title: Shipping/Mails All Hours Given in Daylight Saving Time
description: Incoming Passenger and Mail Ships

title: PRICES HIT PEAKS FOR COMMODITIES
description: The nation received As loudest signal to date yesterday that consumer prices would soar much higher in coming weeks and months. It came as commodity traders and speculators bid up the prices of most raw materials to record or nearrecord levels once again yesterday.

title: Miss Kulakova Winner Of Nordic Ski Event
description: FALUN, Sweden, Feb. 20 (AP)Galina Kulakova of the Soviet Union captured her seventh world title today, winning the women's 10kilometer crosscountry race in the world Nordic ski championships. She beat Barbara Petzold of East Germany and Helena Takalo of Finland.

title: Brandt Aides Divided on Leaning to U.S or Conciliating France
description: BONN, Feb. 20In the wake of France's challenge to the rest of Europe and the United States at the Washington energy conference, a debate about West Germany's role in the future of Europe, is under way in Chancellor Willy Brandt's Government.

title: Business Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 20The Securities and Exchange Commission adopted today a rule permitting investment companies to offer to shareholders the privilege of reinvesting proceeds of a redemption of company shares without the usual sales charges.

title: WITNESS IS UNSHAKEN BY BROWN'S LAWYER
description: Despite almost two days of crossexamination, the prosecution's major witness clung to her story that Henry Brownon trial for the murder of two police officers on the Lower East Side two years agoin effect confessed in her presence that he was involved in the killings.

title: Briefs on Energy
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Feb. 20 (AP)Saudi Arabia has agreed to supply oil to South Vietnam and its military forces despite the embargo against its American backers, highranking South Vietnamese officials reported today. The officials, who refused to be identified, said the oil agreement had been worked out in connection with an agreement between South Vietnam and Saudi Arabiaannounced todayto establish diplomatic relations.

title: Jersey Dealers Seek Release Of Gasoline Before Allocation
description: TRENTON, Feb. 20  The president of the New Jersey Gasoline Retailers Association said today that major fuel suppliers should be ordered to draw newly allocated supplies of gasoline from current inventories so that they might reach the state's servicestation operators this week.

title: Moscow Again TestFires A Missile Into the Pacific
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 20 (AP) The Soviet Union testfired a big new missile with dummy multiple warheads into the Pacific yesterday, the Pentagon announced today.

title: NEWS INDEX
description: Page

title: POSITION OF FED ON RESERVES HIT
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 20

title: Stations in Neighboring Towns Feel Effects of Shutdown in Greenwich
description: GREENWICH, Conn., Feb. 20 Wayne Konitschek, the owner of two of a cluster of gasoline stations in Stamford near the Greenwich line, sold so much gasoline today after all 46 stations in Greenwich shut down in protest that he was more worried than ever about making his allotment last out the month.

title: Dave Anderson
description: With his curly blond hair, John Gianelli resembles an angel expelled from paradise for having outgrown his wings. John Gianelli is 6 feet 10 inches, hardly the accepted height for a cherub but ideal for the New York Knicks to employ him as a center in their season of need. In five weeks, the National Basketball Association playoffs will begin. By then, the Knicks hope that Willis Reed will have recovered from knee surgery. In their history, the Knicks have won the N.B.A. championship twice. Each time Willis Reed was selected as the most valuable player in the playoffs. He has been the Knicks' core as well as their center. But there is no assurance that he will be playing properly when the playoffs begin. There is instead, John Gianelli, the alternative. In the early minutes of Tuesday night's game with the Portland Trail Blazers at Madison Square Garden, the alternative spun his 220 pounds and dunked the ball. At a sidecourt table, Willis Reed and another Knick convalescent. Dave DeBusschere, clapped their hand in spontaneous appreciation.

title: SHOP TALK If You're Too Busy, Lazy, Untalented, or Just Tired
description: Tradition would have it that in the spring a young man's fancy turns to thoughts of love. Tradition would also have it that in the spring a woman's (no age differentiation here) fancy turns to cleaning and decorating. Well, as someone once said, it ain't necessarily so, and it never was.

title: $200,000 Golf Ball Theft
description: PROVIDENCE, R. I., Feb. 20 (AP)The Providence police reported today the weekend theft of some $200,000 worth of golf balls from the Uniroyal, Inc., plant here.

title: Soloists Enhance Barzin's Orchestra In Strong Concert
description: Leon Barzin and his National Orchestral Association focused attention on concerted works for piano in their concert at Carnegie Hall on Tuesday night and had Minoru Nojima on hand to help them.

title: Miss Hearst Spends Birthdy as Captive While Family Presses Food Plan
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Feb. 20On her 20th birthday today, Patricia Hearst was a silent captive, held somewhere by members of the radical Symbionese Liberation Army who kidnapped her for political purposes 16 days ago.

title: Gutts Stadium, Gains in Georgia
description: A resolution to rename the University of Georgia's Sanford Stadium in honor of the late football coach, Wally Butts, has passed the Georgia Senate, but may have rough going when it gets to the House.

title: Notes on People
description: Gov. Thomas P. Salmon of Vermont yesterday removed himself from the scramble of potential candidates to fill the seat of Senator George D. Aiken, who is retiring, by announcing he will seek a second term in the State House. Vermont finds itself today in the hurlyburly of unprecedented political jockeying in the wake of Senator Aiken's announced retirement, said Governor Salmon. I for one want no part of this carnival atmosphere at a time when credibility in government at all levels is at its lowest ebb.

title: OvertheCounter Quotations
... And What the Poodles Don't
description: An attorney for Rose Mary Woods, trying to establish that his client had not intentionally erased part of a crucial White House tape recording, has declared that the six experts appointed by Judge John J. Shim to examine the tapes don't know any more about tape machines than a poodle.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: The emergence of several state governorsShapp of Pennsylvania, McCall of Oregon, Sargent of Massachusettsas key figures filling gaps left by the President and Congress in dealing with the gasoline shortage and price spiral underscores a littlenoticed factor which has contributed to the present crisis of the Presidency.

title: Earnings Break Records at TRW
description: TRW, Inc., had record sales and earnings in the fourth quarter and all of 1973, H. A. Shepard, chairman, reported yesterday from the company's headquarters in Cleveland. He attributed the advances to gains in sales of electronic components, computerbased services, oilfield pumping equipment and other energyrelated products.

title: Pitt Five Registers 22d Victory in Row
description: PITTSBURGH, Feb. 20 (AP) Seventhranked Pitt sank 11 of 12 shots from the foul line in the last four minutes tonight to defeat Temple, 5649, and gain its 22d consecutive college basketball victory.

title: Recital
description: It isn't often that a debut recital yields such cultivated pianism as one heard throughout Vasso Devetzi's first solo appearance here on Tuesday night at Alice Tully Hall. The Greek pianist had played once before in New York, in joint recital with Mstislav Rostropovich, the Soviet cellist, and has been active in Europe for more than 10 years. So, the maturity of her playing should have surprised no one.

title: Turkey Asks U.S. for Restudy Of Ban on Cultivation of Opium
description: ANKARA, Turkey, Feb. 20Turkey has asked the United States to undertake a joint reexamination of the ban on cultivation of opium by Turkish farmers, Foreign Ministry sources said today.

title: H. LAURENCE HARTER Special to The New York Times
description: GARDEN CITY, L. I., Feb. 20 H. Laurence Harter, retired president of BrownHarter Cadillac, Inc., in Hempstead, died yesterday in Nassau Hospital. He was 72 years old and lived at 19 Barnes Lane.

title: Imperiale's I.R.S. Audit Is No Bar to Race, He Says
description: NEWARK, Feb. 20Senator Anthony Imperiale confirmed today that he had been the subject of a farreaching Internal Revenue Service audit and an investigation by the United States Attorney's office that inspired reports in recent days that he was preparing to withdraw from the city's mayoral race.

title: BAN ON FAVORITISM IN GAS SALES VOIDED
description: TUCSON, Ariz., Feb. 20 (UPI) A Federal judge today overruled William E. Simon's order prohibiting gasoline dealers from favoring their regular customers.

title: Front Page 2  No Title
Bachelor Adopts Vietnamese Orphan, 3
description: FLORENCE HARBOR, Feb. 20  Threeyearold Pham Ngoc Linh, an orphan from Vietnam, received a new name, a new home and met his bachelor foster father and foster grandparents for the first time as he arrived at Kennedy International Airport today after a twoday flight from Saigon.

title: HEARING ON BREAKIN POSTPONED A MONTH
description: LOS ANGELES, Feb. 20 (UPI)  A pretrial hearing in the burglary case against three former White House aides was postponed for a month today because of a delay in serving a subpoena on President Nixon.

title: Mitchell and Stans Hear Judge Outline Case to Jury Panel
description: Prospective jurors obtained their first formal information yesterday on the range of charges and potential witnesses in the trial of former Attorney General John N. Mitchell and former Commerce Secretary Maurice H. Stan.

title: STOCK CONVERSION BACKED BY A.T.&T.
description: Directors of the American Telephone and Telegraph Company approved yesterday a plan for converting publicly held shares of the Illinois Bell Telephone Company into A. T. & T. common shares. The plan calls for a conversion ratio of 0.9 shares of A. T. & T. for each share of Illinois Bell, which has a total of 69,338,359 shares outstanding.

title: Glamour List Stars As Market Rallies
description: Glamour issues  prominent casualties of the current bear marketled a brisk rally yesterday afternoon in the stock market.

title: SpecialInterest Pressure on TV Rising, Local Programers Told
description: LOS ANGELES, Feb. 20Broadcasting is in for it. Our block is about to be busted. Our private club is about to be integrated. Our programs will be selected for us, because the havenots now want a piece of the action.

title: Leopard Is Now Thriving Species
description: NAIROBI, KenyaThe leopard, long held by some wildlife organizations to be an endangered species, has been found in recent studies still existing in abundant numbers in every African country south of the Sahara. The new findings, which suggest that the elusive and rarely seen leopard is even more plentiful than the lion, are prompting some conservation groups to begin toning down earlier warnings of the leopard's imminent extinction.

title: Seattle Plan, Hearst Model, Feeds Many
description: SEATTLE, Feb. 20 (AP)The Neighbors in Need program established here in 1970 in the aftermath of widespread layoffs in the aerospace industry now has 80 distribution points for food for the needy around the state.

title: Ford, in Talk With Nixon, Links Republican Defeat to Watergate
description: CINCINNATI, Feb. 20Vice President Ford told President Nixon in a private meeting today that the Watergate scandal was at least in part responsible for the Republican loss of a crucial special Congressional election in Michigan on Monday.

title: Reid, in a Detailed Disclosure, Puts Net Worth at $4.1Million
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 20 Representative Ogden R. Reid, a Westchester County Democrat, today became New York State's first candidate for Governor to make an exhaustive, documented public disclosure of his personal finances.

title: Gold Price Eases After Early Gains In London Trading
description: LONDON, Feb. 19 (UPI) The price of gold rebounded briefly in early trading here of its record of $152 an ounce reached Monday but the metal was pegged lower at $150 in the afternoon price fixing.

title: KERMIT KEGLEY
description: Kermit Kegley, a former Broadway actor and stage manager, died Tuesday of a heart attack in Fenton, Mo., in the offices of Communico, a concern producing industrial shows and displays, where he was production manager. He was 54 years old and lived in Chesterfield, Mo.

title: Aeros Rout Knights
description: HOUSTON, Feb. 20 (AP)

title: Rockets End Losing String
description: DENVER, Feb. 20 (UPI)  Steve Jones, fed by Al Smith, a backcourt mate, hit six straight field goals midway through the second half tonight to give the Denver Rockets a 124117 victory ever the Kentucky Colonels and break a fourgame losing streak. Jones wound up with 24 points, the same as Smith, who also had 21 assists. Dave Robisch led. Denver with 30 points and 12 rebounds. Dan Issel led Kentucky with 31. He hit 10 straight baskets at one stretch, but only two in the fourth quarter. John Roche had 20 for Kentucky and Artis Gilmore had 18 with 13 rebounds.

title: Fishermen Cut Bait in a Protest on Prices
description: BELFORD, N.J., Feb. 20The lowslung trawlers of the Belford fishing fleet rode languidly at dockside today in quiet protest to a sharp slump in the wholesale price of whiting, one of the most popular types of fish in the New York market.

title: Market Place: Letter of Credit And Expans
description: The nation's real estate investment trusts have found a financing method that makes it relatively easy for them to raise capital in situations where they are not able to borrow directly.

title: Reid, in a Detailed Disclosure, Puts Net Worth at $4.1Million
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 20 Representative Ogden R. Reid, a Westchester County Democrat, today became New York State's first candidate to make an exhaustive, documented public disclosure of his person. al finances.

title: Drug Charge Laid to Aide Of Narcotics Prosecutor
description: All assistant district attorney In the office of the city's special narcotics prosecutor has been indicted for allegedly giving small quantities of the drug Quaalude to two other staff members of the office.

title: A New Father Gigante: Defender of Power Politics
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Feb. 20For the last two days the Rev. Louis R. Gigante of the Bronx, who was, elected a New York City Councilman last November, has surprised a group of Harvard students with his views on the benefits of bossism, political machines and the oldfashioned Tammany Hall clubhouse.

title: Leafs Halt Sabres
description: TORONTO, Feb. 20 (UPI) Rick Kehoe scored a pair of goals and Darryl Sittler and Paul Henderson added one goal each tonight to lead the Toronto Maple Leafs to a 42 victory over the. Buffalo Sabres.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: An assistant district attorney in the office of the city's special narcotics prosecutor has been indicted for allegedly giving a small quantity of the drug Quaalude to two other staff members of the office.

title: Inge Sand Is Dead at 45; Royal Danish Ballet Soloist
description: Inge Sand, soloist of the Royal Danish Ballet who made her American debut in 1954, at the Jacob's Pillow Dance Festival near Lee; Mass., died of cancer last week in Copenhagen. She was 45 years old.

title: STOCKS POST RISE ON AMEX AND OTC
description: Prices on the American Stock Exchange and the overthecounter market rose yesterday although trading volume decreased on both markets.

title: Labor Projects Goal of Electing VetoProof Congress This Year
description: BAL HARBOUR, Fla., Feb. 20The A.F.L.C.I.O., encouraged by the Democratic victory in the special Congressional election in Michigan Monday, set itself a goal today of electing 25 more Representatives and seven more Senators friendly to labor in November in order to insure a vetoproof Congress.

title: ABSENTEE BALLOTS VOTED ON PRIMARY
description: ALBANY, Feb. 20The Senate voted unanimously today to authorize absentee balloting in primary elections in New York State beginning this September.

title: Al Dark Is Rehired by Finley As Manager of Oakland A's
description: OAKLAND, Calif., Feb. 20 Alvin Dark, discharged by Charles O. Finley as manager of the Kansas City Athletics in 1967 a few months before the team moved to Oakland, was rehired today to take the place of Dick Williams, under whom the A's won the last two World Series.

title: CONFUCIUS CALLED NOT REALLY LOYAL
description: Special to The New York Times

title: CLASSIFIED ADVERTISING INDEX
description: Page

title: Iraq and Iran Exchange Charges in. U.N. Council
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Feb. 20Iraq and Iran blamed each other in the Security Council today for recent border, fighting in which at least 65 persons were killed. However, privately they were discussing a proposal for a special representative to be sent to the area to look into their dispute.

title: BIRCH WILSON
description: READING, Pa., Feb. 20 (AP) Birch Wilson, the last suriviving member of the group that formed the Socialist party in Berks County in 1910, died Monday in Reading Hospital. He was 91 years old.

title: Mitchell and Stans Hear Judge Outline Case to Jury Panel
description: Prospective jurors obtained their first formal information yesterday on the range of charges and potential witnesses in the trial of former Attorney General John N. Mitchell and former Commerce Secretary Maurice H. Stans.

title: Washington Lottery Killed
description: OLYMPIA. Wash., Feb. 20 (UPI)  Gov. Daniel J. Evans has vetoed a bill creating state lottery. The measure had narrowly passed the House and the Senate. The profits would have been used for education.

title: EXNIXON WRITER TALKS OF SCANDAL
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 20  Two weeks ago, on ms last day as a White House speech writer, Lee W. Huebner watched horrified as a former staff colleague, Egil Krogh, Jr., said goodbye on television as he prepared to begin a Watergaterelated jail term.

title: Wilson Passes the Buck
description: Governor Wilson's persisting refusal to make alternateday gasoline rationing mandatory throughout the state leaves New York City with no choice but to move rapidly to the local mandatory system proposed by Mayor Beame.

title: Bridge: Errors on Duplicate Board Plague Tournament Directors
description: A deal that is fouled because some careless player puts the wrong cards, or the wrong number of cards, into the slot in the duplicate board is an intolerable nuisance in tournament play.

title: Smith Nearly Upset In Coliseum Tennis
description: UNIONDALE, L. I., Feb 20 Sttan Smith, the defending champion of the World Championship Tennis tour, lost the first set today to a lowly qualifier, Sherwood Stewart, while on the adjoining court Alex Metreveli, the secondseeded player from the Soviet Union, began by dropping an 0.6 set to unheralded Geoff Masters of Australia.

title: City Plans Gasoline Curb After Wilson Bars Action
description: Governor Wilson refused yesterday to mandate alternateday sales of gasoline in New York State despite the pleas of Mayor Beame. In an Albany news conference, the Governor said that he realized the voluntary plan now in effect in the state was not working perfectly, but that he did not feel it was time for a Mandatory program.

title: How Talk of Artichokes Led to a Grande Bouffe
description: What started out as simple reflection on a dish we always hunger for when we think of Rome, ended in an absolute orgy of eating or, as one guest dubbed it, l'abbuffata. La grande bouffe Italian style.

title: A New Father Gigante: Defender of Power Politics
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Feb. 20For the last two days the Rev. Louis R. Gigante of the Bronx, who was elected a New York City Counciltiari last November, has surprited a group of Harvard students with his views on the benefits of bossism, political machines and the oldfashioned Tammany Hall clubhouse.

title: far Group Withdraws Charges Against Kunstler
description: The grievance committee of the Association of the Bar of the City of New York has withdrawn disciplinary charges it brought last month against William M. Kunstler, lawyers for Mr. Kunstler said yesterday.

title: DEMOCRATS SEEK QUICK NIXON TEST ON IMPEACHMENT
description: Democratic members of the House Judiciary Committee decided today to seek specific items of Watergate evidence from the White House to test President Nixon's willingness to cooperate with the House impeachment inquiry.

title: Discreditation
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 20An exchange of correspondence:

title: Energy Crisis Inducing Return To City Stores and Attractions
description: The energy crisis may be slowing down the rest of the nation, but in many ways, it is pumping new life into the central city.

title: Measles Cases in State Increase to Over 1,000
description: TRENTON, Feb. 20 (UPI)The number of measles cases reported in the state since September grew to more than 1,000 by today, and Department of Health officials said the epidemic was still spreading.

title: Rhode Island Losses Put At $173Million in Navy Pay
description: PROVIDENCE, R. I., Feb. 20 (AP)Rhode Island lost nearly $173million in salaries to military and civilian workers last year as a result of Navy cutbacks in the area, a Navy report said today.

title: Company Has Faithin Trust
description: Not many merchandisers of clothing trust their customers to the extent that Avon, famous for doortodoor selling of cosmetics, does. Avon's new Family Fashions subsidiary, which is selling men's and women's clothes, including shoes, by mail, will let anyone keep the articles for 10 days, wear them during that time and then, if not satisfied, return them at Avon's expense.

title: AntiU.S. Demonstration Is Banned in Mexico City
description: MEXICO CITY. Feb 20 The Mexican Government tonight banned an antiAmeri can demonstration called by the Mexican Communist party to coincide with the opening of Secretary of State Kissinger's conference with LatinAmerican foreign ministers here tomorrow.

title: JAZZ DRIVE MARKS LEIGHTON'S PLAYING
description: Somehow the old swing pianists never seem to lose their touch. Bernie Leighton, who was playing with Benny Goodman's orchestra in 1940 when he was 19 years old, later went on to earn a music degree at Yale, to give a Carnegie recital playing Bach, Hindemith and Bertk, to serve as accompanist to a long list of singers including Frank Sinatra, Tony Bennett and Pearl Bailey, and to be musical director for innumerable radio and television shows. But he still plays swimging jazz piano.

title: BIG LEFRAK PROJECT. OPPOSED IN QUEENS
description: Opposition to a proposed 4,500unit Lefrak middleincome housing project in Kew Gardens Hills, Queens, was voiced last night by about 1,500 residents.

title: PROTEST GROWS IN CONNECTICUT
description: HARTFORD, Feb. 20  A gathering protest against Federal Energy Office regulations threatened today to disrupt gasoline sales across Connecticut.

title: Enoch Powell to Speak For ProLabor Group
description: LONDON, Feb. 20Enoch Powell, the controversial Conservative figure, announced today that he would speak next weekend for an organization that advocates voting for the Labor party in the general election Feb. 28.

title: Briefs On The Arts
description: George Balanchine will choreograph a new version of Coppelia, his first fulllength work in seven years; it was announced by the New York City Ballet. The work will have its world premiere at the Saratoga Performing Arts Center on July 17, during the company's summer season at Saratoga, Spring. Alexandra Danilova, a wellknown interpreter of the ballet's lead role, will assist Mr. Balanchine in staging the production. Rouben TerArutunian will design the scenery, and the costumes will be executed by Karinska.

title: 117 Nations Meet In Geneva to Plan New Rules of War
description: GENEVA, Feb. 20On the invitation of Switzerland, 117 nations today began a fiveweek meeting here to bring the rules of war up to date in view of the increase in guerrilla warfare since the 1949 Geneva conventions were drafted.

title: BONN UP ON GAM, MAY RAISE SPEED
description: BONN, Feb. 20West Germany has enough gasoline to lift the 100kilometer speed (63 miles an hour) imposed on superhighways last November in an effort to save fuel, but will not until next month, according to Government spokesmen.

title: '74 Elections: G. O. P. Dilemma
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 20The premise of Democratic strategy in the upset victory Monday in the Congressional election in Grand Rapids, Mich.and the shattering implication for Republicans everywhereis that disapproval of the Nixon Administration is now the most powerful cur rent in American politics, even in local contests.

title: BRASCO IS CALLED CONSPIRACY VICTIM
description: The chief defense attorney for Representative Frank J. Brasco asserted yesterday that the Brooklyn Democrat was the victim of a conspiracy by the Government's chief witness and others in the bribery trial of the Congressman and his uncle, Joseph Brasco, at the Federal Court House here.

title: 2 Leaders Arrive in Riyadh
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Feb. 20 (AP)President Sadat and Colonel Qaddafi arrived in Saudi Arabia tonight to confer with King Faisal on a unified Arab oil policy and peace strategy.

title: Westminster Big One in Any Language
description: Westminster has an appeal that no other show in America has. Not only does it attract entries from all over the country, but it also brings numerous visitors from overseas. Carla Molinari, secretary of the Portuguese Kennel Club, and Mrs. Franoise Firminhac of Paris were here for the second year in row and were as enthusiastic this time as on their first trip.

title: Aaron Stands Firm On Missing Opener
description: ATLANTA, Feb, 20 (AP) Henry Aaron said tonight. there was no chance he would change his mind and start a game in the Atlanta Braves' seasonopening series at, Cincinnati April 4 to 7.

title: LATE CITY EDITION
description: Weather: Sunny, mild today; cold tonight, Chance of rain tomorrow, Temp. range: today 3448; Wed. 4152. Additional details on Page 58.

title: OCCIDENTAL'S NET SHOWS 152% RISE
description: The Occidental Petroleum Corporation reported yesterday a 152 per cent increase in its fourthquarter earnings and nearly sevenfold improvement in annual profits last year.

title: Venezia Tries Riding in Japan, And Finds It's a TwoDay Week
description: Mike Venezia was working hard at Bemont Park yesterday morning, riding horses in preparation for the start of the local thoroughbred campaign on Monday. The 27yearold Brooklynborn jockey has been working horses for almost two weeks, ever since his return from Japan. And it was not our 3yearold picture he wanted to talk about yesterday; it was about his sojourn in Japan.

title: BEANIE CONSIDERS NEW PRISON CHIEF
description: Milton Williams, a Bronx lawyer, is being considered by Mayor Beame as a replacement for Benjamin J. Malcolm as Commissioner of Correction.

title: No. 50 for Esposito
description: BLOOMINGTON, Minn., Feb. 20 (AP)Phil Esposito, the Boston center, recorded three goals tonight, giving him 50 for the season, as the Bruins rallied to tie the Minnesota North Stars, 55, in a N.H.L. game. Esposito tied the game at 15:32 of the third period on a power play, sweeping in a loose puck at the corner of the crease to get him to the 50goal level for the fourth straight season.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: NEW DELHI, Feb. 20  The ruling party of the northeastern tribal state of Nagaland was beaten by an opposition party in elections for the state assembly, according to results announced today. The Nagaland Nationalist Organization, which has governed the state since it was formed 10 years ago, won 23 of the 60 seats. The opposition United Democratic Front gained 25, and the rest were won by independents who now hold the balance of power.

title: Advertising: Have a Prune?
description: We New Yorkers are a proud lot, and why shouldn't we be? We live in the nation's largest city, the hub of fashion, finance, culture and communications.

title: AIR HIJACKER FAILS IN SOUTH VIETNAM
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Feb. 20A 19yearold South Vietnamese killed himself and two army officers with a grenade today after the civilian airliner he tried to hijack to Hanoi landed at an airport south of Hue.

title: '74 Held Critical for Curbing Inflation
description: A key Administration economist said yesterday that 1974 is the critical year for reducing inflation in the United States. But he warned that the Government, to achieve that goal, must resist political pressure to overstimulate a sagging economy during the first half of the year.

title: VISAS ARE OFFERED TO SOLZHENITSYNS
description: MOSCOW, Feb. 20The wife of Aleksandr I. Solzhenitsyn said today that the Soviet authorities had formally advised her that she and her family could join the exiled author as soon as they complete the visa formalities, and without giving up their Soviet citizenship.

title: People in Sports: Fred Perry Puts Spark in Tennis Centennial
description: Fred Perry, a threetime Wimbledon champion in the nineteenthirties, is in New York to commemorate the 100th anniversary of tennis. He rates the late Bill Tilden the greatest player of all, considers today's women players far superior to those of his day, but warns that the sport currently is being threatened by various group power struggles.

title: Yeoman Tells Panel Of Role of Admirals
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 20  A Navy yeoman told the Senate Armed Services Committee today how be had tipped a White House clerical assignment into an opportunity to do a job for the Joint Chiefs by illicitly collecting top secret and eyes only messages meant for President Nixon and Henry A. Kissinger.

title: Gesell Rejects Chapin Plea To Bar Testimony by Dean
description: Federal Judge Gerhard A. Gesell ruled today against a claim of attorneyclient privilege that would have kept John W. Dean 3d from testifying at the perjury trial of Dwight L. Chapin, formerly President Nixon's appointments secretary.

title: Sad and Qaddafi Fly to Saudi Arabia
description: CAIRO, Feb. 20President Anwar elSadat of Egypt and Col. Muammar elQaddafi of Libya flew together today to Saudi Arabia to visit King Faisal.

title: High Court Backs Jury Trials in Tenant Bias Suits
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 20 The Supreme Court unanimously ruled today that a landlord being sued by a tenant to whom he refused to rent is entitled to have a jury decide whether he is guilty of racial discrimination and what damages he should pay.

title: Bumpers Rejects House Race
description: LITTLE ROCK, Ark., Feb. 20 (AP)  Gov. Dale Bumpers, a Democrat, ruled out today any race for the House of Representatives but said he had not gone any further in deciding on his political future. The Governor is reportedly considering seeking reelection, opposing Senator J. W. Fulbright or retiring from politics.

title: The Swamps and Marshes
description: If you would understand the importance of what are commonly called wetlands, but which we long knew as marshes and bogs and swamps, know them in late winter and early spring. Know them when the trickling waters of the hillsides are creeping down toward the valleys. That is when and how floods are born, if there are no wetlands to sponge up those waters and feed them slowly into the brooks and rivers. Those bogs and swamps can do more than all the dams and diversion channels ever designed to check spring floods.

title: NEW LIFE SOUGHT FOR OLD CHURCH
description: The Rev. Norman Charles, an ebullient 38yearold black minister, is helping put new life in an old church that had seen letter days.

title: Long Shot Victor at Gulfstream
description: HALLANDALE, Fla., Feb. 20  The 3yearold racing picture in Florida, hopelessly muddled before today's $77,440 Fountain of Youth Stakes at Gulfstream, was even more recondite when it was over. Harbor View Farms Green Gambados, a long shot, held off the powerful late run of Judger to win it, with Eric's. Champ third and Buck's Bid fourth.

title: Nastase Is Upset by Barthes in Tennis
description: SALISBURY, Md., Feb. 20 (AP)  Pierre Barthes of France upset lie Nastase, 63, 06, 64, in the third round of the National Indoor open tennis championships today.

title: Bottlers Here Strive to Block Ban on Disposable Containers
description: Bottling companies and food stores sought at a state hearing yesterday to block a proposal to make refundable beverage containers mandatory in New York State, as they are in Oregon and Vermont.

title: Dr. Charles Beck, 58, Dies; Psychiatrist at Mt. Sinai
description: Dr. Charles Beck, a psychiatrist affiliated with Mount Sinai Hospital since 1948, died of cancer there on Tuesday. He was 58 years old and lived at 49 East 96th Street.

title: NEW GAS QUOTAS DEFENDED BY U. S.
description: Federal energy officials expressed concern today over: what they considered misinterpretation of the amount of relief provided through an emergency allocation of new gasoline supplies to 20 states hard hit by shortages.

title: Damage to Dodd Seen in Abortive Fuel Deal
description: TRENTON, Feb. 20In the words of his own news release on Sunday, the State Senate President, Frank J. Dodd of Essex county, is rapidly developing a national reputation for his expertise in dealing with the gasoline shortage in New Jersey.

title: Raiders' Partner Loses Davis Fight
description: Wayne Valley's motion for summary judgment against Al Davis, managing general partner of the Oakland Raiders, was denied in Alameda County Superior Court yesterday.

title: Cambodia Says Its Planes Hit 2 Captured Howitzers
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia, Feb. 20 (UPI)Cambodian Air Force planes today destroyed two American artillery pieces captured by Communist rebels, the military command said The search continued for artillery used to shell Phnom Penh.

title: SILBERMAN QUERIED ABOUT PROSECUTOR
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 20 (AP) Laurence H. Silberman, nominated to be Deputy Attorney General, said yesterday that he would resign rather than carry out any Presidential order to dismiss Special Prosecutor Leon Jaworski, except for gross improprieties.

title: Title Skiing Draws Top Field Today
description: HENNIKER, N. H., Feb. 20 In a season in which postponements and cancellations have marred the Eastern racing scene, members of the host Pat's Peak Ski Club are showing persistance in preparing for tomorrow's twoday United

title: J. LESTER EHRLICH Special to The New York Times
description: EAST ORANGE, N. J., Feb. 20J. Lester Ehrlich, retired sales office manager of the Instrument Division of the McGraw Edison Company in West Orange, died Sunday in Tampa, Fla., while on a visit. He was 69 years old.

description: Governor Wilson refused yesterday to mandate alternateday sales of gasoline in New York State despite the pleas of Mayor Beame. In an Albany news conference, the Gover nor said that he realized the voluntary plan now in effect in the state was not working perfectly, but that he did not feel it was time for a mandatory program.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: Three former workers at the Bergen County Children's Shelter, including one who later took a supervisor's job at the Passaic County Children's Shelter, have been indicted in Hackensack on charges they had beaten 11 young boys'All three were dismissed following the alleged incident on Nov. 13 at the Bergen County institution in Paramus, but one, LeRoy Blakely, 29 years old, went to work in Passaic.

title: Bumpers Rejects House Race
description: LITTLE ROCK, Ark., Feb. 20 (AP)  Gov. Dale Bumpers, I Democrat, ruled out today any race for the House of Representatives but said he had not gone any further in deciding on I his political future. The Governor is reportedly considering seeking reelection, opposing Senator J. W. Fulbright or retiring from politics.

title: Consumer Agency Proposal Gaining in Congress
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 20 The argument over setting up an. agency to represent consumers within the Federal Government  an annual affair in Congress during each of the last five years  may finally be settled in 1974.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: I feel you should react as you feel you should react.Governor Wilson, recalling his words to Mayor Beanie about the Mayor's decision to seek mandatory gasoline allocation. [21:2.]

title: VISAS ARE OFFERED TO SOLZHENITSINS

title: VOTE ON GAMBLING URGER AT DEBATE
description: NEWARK, Feb. 20  State Senator Wayne Dumont Jr., and former Assemblyman Brian T. Kennedy, taking opposing sides in a debate over legalizing gambling in New Jersey, agreed today that the public should have the right to a referendum on the question.

title: Foundries Freed From Curbs
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 20 Iron and steel foundries were exempted from wage and price controls today by the Cost of Living Council. Annual foundry sales of $6.5billion account for about 8 per cent of the $51billion steel industry's total sales volume. Controls have now been lifted from about 70 per cent of the steel industry.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
New Hampshire Victor
description: AMHERST, Mass., Feb. 20 (AP)Jamie Hislop scored a powerplay goal at 18:36 of the third period tonight enabling New Hampshire to defeat Massachusetts, 75, in a college hockey game.

title: A Million for Mailer
description: Norman Mailer is reported to have signed a $1million contract with Little, Brown, the Boston publishing house, for rights to his next novel. The figure is the highest known payment agreed to for an unpublished work of fiction, according to a number of publishing executives. Details, Page 24.

title: Phillips Petroleum and Sun Oil Cut Their Prices on Propane
description: Price Changes

title: Pro Transactions
description: BASEBALL

title: STRATFORD GETS CHANGE OF NAME
description: The American Shakespeare Festival in Stratford, Conn., celebrating its 20th anniversary, is changing its name to the American Shakespeare Theater. No longer is it simply a summer festival, but an almost yearround institution, touring as well as playing on its home ground, producing modern plays as well as Shakespeare and with some of its actors working a ninemonth season. Despite a reduced budget, the American Stratford is now entering a period of expansion.

title: Energy Crisis Inducing Return To City Stores and Attractions
description: The energy crisis may be slowing down the rest of the main but in many ways, it is pumping new life into the central city.

title: Suit for Consumers Says Credit Cards Hurt Cash Buyers
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 20 (UPI) Consumers Union today sued two credit card companies, American Express and BankAmericard, accusing them of forcing merchants who accept the cards to discriminate against cash customers.

description: Theater

title: Sports News Briefs
description: Two Felt Forum Bouts Set

title: RIOTS AGAIN ERUPT IN AN INDIAN STATE
description: NEW DELHI, Feb. 20 (UPI) Rampaging mobs battled the police today in Ahmadabad, capital of the western state of Guajarat, where rioting over the last 40 days has left some 52 dead.

title: Venezuela Plans Takeover
description: CARACAS, Venezuela, Feb. 20 (UPI)The ruling Social Christian Party said today that it would introduce a bill for nationalization of Venezuela's oil industry within two weeks.

title: TEANECK PROJECT VOTED BY COUNCIL
description: TEANECK, Feb. 20  The Township Council, by a 4to3 vote early today, approved plans to construct a highrise, office and apartment complex. However, the future of the project remained in doubt because of legal questions raised by a petition campaign mounted by its opponents.

title: U.S. COURT UPHOLDS KERNER CONVICTION
description: CHICAGO, Feb. 20 (AP)The United States Court of Appeals for the Seventh Circuit has upheld the convictions of former Gov. Otto Kerner and his close associate, Theodore J. Isaacs, for Illinois race track stock dealings.

title: Soviet Trade Leaders Here For Talks With U.S. Group
description: A Soviet trade delegation headed by Vladimir S. Alkhimov, Deputy Minister of Foreign Trade, arrived here yesterday from Moscow for a meeting of the U.S.U.S.S.R. Trade and Economic Council.

title: Books of The Times
description: TRISTES TROPIQUES. By Claude LviStrauss. Tranlated from the French by John and Doreen Weightman. Illustrated. 425 pages. Atheneum. $12.50.

title: Stage: Suicide in Women
description: Under the direction of Kevin O'Connor, the Theater at St. Clements is becoming a significant force in the New York resident, or institutional, theater. It has taken over the lovely building on West 46th Street previously operated by the American Place Theater, and it is doing some very interesting work, both in its main auditorium and in its basement theater. In the basement it currently has a show called Disquieting Muses, subtitled A Response to the Suicides of Women Artists.

title: ALVIN ROSEMAN EXAID OFFICIAL
description: PITTSBURGH, Feb. 20Dr. Alvin Roseman, a professor at the University of Pittsburgh and a former Government official, died today while attending a meeting. He was 63 years old.

title: Nation's Real Output Edges Up; Rate of Inflation Also Advances
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 20The nation's real output the rate of inflation were a little larger in the fourth quarter of last year than liminary estimates had indicated, the Commerce Department reported today.

title: Murtha Takes House Seat
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 20 (UPI) John P. Murtha Jr., a Democrat, winner in the 12th Congressional District election in Pennsylvania, took the oath of office today, after Republicans were assured they would get the seat if a recount proved the Republican the winner. The House voted approval of a resolution that cited precedent for swearing in a member on the basis of an official vote count although a recount in the race was still incomplete, Mr. Murtha edged out Harry M. Fox by 422 votes in the special election Feb. 5.

title: New Summary and Index THURSDAY, FEBRUARY 21, 1974
description: International

title: 12,000 Reportedly Injured By Aerosol Cans Each Year
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 20 (UPI)The Consumer Product Safety Commission said today there was an estimated total of 12,000 injuries every year associated with Aerosol spray products, perhaps more than 1,000 caused when the cans explode.

title: NIXON SAYS U.S. BIDS EUROPE AID FORCES
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 20 (Reuters)  President Nixon said today that the United States was warning its European allies that they must furnish more support for American forces in Europe to avoid a withdrawal of some.

title: Personal Finance
description: One of the most complicated problems to unravel when a debtor is faced with a number of bill collectors is the order of payment.

title: Ministers of a Changed Hemisphere Convene Today
description: BUENOS AIRES, Feb. 20In meetings with LatinAmerican foreign ministers starting tomorrow, Secretary of State Kissinger will be facing a continent whose political and economic panorama has changed radically, altering may of the preconceptions that provided the guidelines of American policy in the area as recently as three years ago.

title: Israelis to Continue Pullback
description: CAIRO, Feb. 20 (Reuters) The remaining Israeli soldiers on the west side of the Suez Canal were preparing today to pull back in the fourth stage of the disengagement of forces provided by the IsraeliEgyptian agreement.

title: CONFEREES VOTE $800MILLION AID TO MASS TRANSIT
description: A HouseSenate conference committee voted out an $800million emergency masstransitaid bill yesterday that officials here said could be a major step toward saving New York City's 35cent fare.

title: Balloonist Last Sighted By a Plane on Tuesday
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 20 (AP)Thomas Gatch Jr. of. Alexandria, Va., who is trying to become the first man to cross the Atlantic Ocean in a balloon has been neither seen nor heard from since midday yesterday, the Air Transport Association said today.

title: ANSWER TO PREVIOUS PUZZLE
GOING OUT Guide
description: BRAIN TRYSTS Seminar buffs could make Thursday a standing date at the Loeb Student Center of New York University as two separate series on contemporary topics begin there today. A discussion of the sexual basis of racism at 4 P.M. by Dr. Edward Maynard, chairman of the black studies department at Hostos Community College, will initiate a series on The Black Experience in the Americas sponsored by the Institute of AfroAmerican Affairs. Check the bulletin board of the Loeb Center, 566 La Guardia Place at Washington Square, for room number. Four admissionfree seminars through May 9. Carolyn Dorsey, at 5987095, has dates and program information.

title: Met to Stage New Productions Of Two Operas in June Festival
description: New productions of Bartk's Bluebeard's Castle and Puccini's Gianni Schicchi will be introduced by the Metropolitan Opera during its 1974 June Festival, which is to begin on May 27 and run for three weeks.

title: Closed Shop
description: When the city agreed last August to add $4 million the $23 minion a year it pays to the Health Insurance Plan of Greater New York for protecting municipal employes and their families, one reform it insisted on was appointment of an ombudsman to help insure highquality medical care.

title: Gain Reported by AllVolunteer Army
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 20 The Army reported progress today in developing an allvolunteer force that it said was of better quality and more combatready than the Army was when the draft ended slightly more than a year ago.

title: Moslem Nations Make Mideast Focus of Gathering in Pakistan
description: LAHORE, Pakistan, Feb. 20Foreign ministers from Moslem nations today made the Middle East the major issue of the conference of Islamic states that opens here Friday.

title: Prices on the Credit Markets Are Mixed as Several New Issues Are Offered
description: Prices remained mixed in the bond markets yesterday with several large new offerings in the tax exempt and corporate sector finding good initial response. In the corpo rate market underwriters headed by Salomon Brothers offered $100million of 8 per cent Manufactur ers Hanover Corporation debentures at 99.25, to yield 8.19 per cent in 30 years, and $50million of eightyear notes at par with 7.6 per cent interest coupons.

title: City Elections Board Advocates Mail Registration for Any Voter
description: The city's Board of Elections urged yesterday that the state election law be amended to permit registration of any voter by mail instead of requiring registration in person.

title: Hawks Blank Seals
description: CHICAGO, Feb. 20 (UPI)

title: World Church Council Gives $450,000 to 29 Groups
description: GENEVA, Feb. 20The. World Council of Churches announced today that it was distributing $450,000 to 29 organizations from its Special Fund to Combat Racism.

title: CORRECTION
description: An article in yesterday's issue of The New York Times erroneously identified Albert Shanker as president of the American Federation of Teachers. Mr. Shanker is first vice president of the national union; the president is David Selden.

title: Penguins Gain 11 Tie With Blues
description: PITTSBURGH, Feb. 20 (AP) Syl App's breakaway goal early in the final period enabled the Pittsburgh Penguins, to tie the St. Louis Blues, 11, tonight in a National Hockey League game.

title: Dagge Outpoints Moyer
