description: WEST BERLIN, Feb. 20 (UPI)The German middleweight champion, Eckhard Dagge outpointed Denny Moyer of Portland, Ore., in a 10round match tonight. The 24yearold West Berliner scored his 11th consecutive victory.

title: Flyers Beat Wings
description: DETROIT, Feb. 20 (AP)

title: Maryland Sues in Effort To Raise Gasoline Supply
description: The state of Maryland filed suit against William E. Simon, the Federal energy administrator, and 20 major oil companies yesterday in an effort to force an increase in gasoline supplies to the state.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Jersey College of Medicine to Expand

title: PRICER HIT PEAKS FOR COMMODITIES
Hal Scharlatt, Editor in Chief Of E.P. Dutton & Co., Dies at 38
description: Hal Scharlatt, vice president and editor in chief of E.P. Dutton & Co., the book publishers, died of a heart attack after a tennis game on Tuesday in Long Branch, N.J. He was 38 years old and lived at 459 Monmouth Place in West End, N.J.

title: Kissinger in Mexico City For Private Latin Talks
description: MEXICO CITY, Feb. 20Secretary of State Kissinger arrived here today for three days of private talks with LatinAmerican and Caribbean foreign ministers.

title: Front Page 1  No Title
description: WILLCOX & GIBBS sells Pfaff Industrial Sawing Equipment (WGAMEX)ADVT.

title: Consumer Notes
description: Mrs. Arnold Bleecker of Tenafly, N.J., asks a question that a lot of other people have asked: How many times is a supermarket allowed to make a profit on an item?

title: Stars Streak Ends at 14
description: SAN DIEGO, Feb. 20 (UPI) Stew Johnson scored 30 points tonight to lead the San Diego Conquistadors to a 10997 victory over Utah, breaking the Stars' 14game winning streak.

title: Escapism in Alabama
description: President Nixon escaped from the majority of the American people, whose silence no longer seems synonymous with approval of his stewardship, to seek solace in being told by Gov. George Wallace that he was among friends in Huntsville, Alabama. In return for Mr. Wallace's blessing, Mr. Nixon gave thanks for the assurance that here in the heart of Dixie he could find reaffirmation that the character of America is strong and we are going to continue to be a great nation.

title: Limn's Vision Guides Returning Dancers
description: They said it couldn't be done, and now the Jose Limn Dance Company is trying to do it. Against all expectations, an American moderndance company is making a longterm effort to survive the death of its founder and to carry his works and teachings into the future.

title: Radio
description: 9:0610 AM., WQXR: Piano Permantles, Nelson Freire and Lorin Hollander. Impromptu in C minor, Schubert; Piano Sonata No. 17 in D minor, Beethoven. 10:0612 N, The Listening Room. Robert Sherman, host. Guests: Thea Dispeker, artist manager; Audrey Michaels, Arts Press Representative; Vera Michaelson, artist representative; Elly Ameling, soprano.

title: $21.1Million Lost By T.W.A. in Month; A Strike Is Blamed
description: Trans World Airlines reported yesterday a $21.1million net loss for January and attributed the showing principally to a lose of traffic and market share resulting from the 45day flight attendant strike from Nov. 4 to Dec. 18.

title: Entertainment Events Today
description: Theater

title: Ministers of a Changed Hemisphere Convene Today
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 20Secretary of State Kissinger is taking to the Mexico City meeting of foreign ministers his vision ion of a new spirit of Western Hemisphere community rather than a concrete plan for reshaping United States relations with Latin America.

title: Long Shot Victor at Gulf stream
description: HALLANDALE, Fla., Feb. 20  The 3yearold racing picture in Florida, hopelessly muddled before today's $77,440 Fountain of Youth Stakes at Gulfstream, was even more recondite when it was over. Harbor View Farms Green Gambados, a 401 shot, held off the powerful late run of Judger to win it, with Eric's Champ third and Buck's Bid fourth.

title: PERON AIDE STIRS DISPUTE ON JEWS
description: BUENOS AIRES, Feb. 20  President Juan D. Pern's personal secretary, Jos Lopez Rega has created a political controversy here by suggesting that the presence of Jews in the Argentine Government has put the country at a disadvantage in negotiations with Arab nations.

title: Julie Eisenhower Improves
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 20 (UPI) Mrs. David Eisenhower, the former Julie Nixon, is gradually getting her strength back after surgery for an ovarian cyst, Helen McCain Smith, Mrs Nixon's press secretary, said today.

title: Youngest Tennis Pro
description: PHILADELPHIA, Feb. 20(AP)Kathy Kuykendall, at the age of 17 the youngest ever to turn tennis professional, has been signed by the Philadelphia Freedoms of the World Team Tennis League.

title: Role in Medical Schooling Planned for South Jersey
description: TRENTON, Feb. 20Governor Byrne announced plans today to expand the New Jersey College of Medicine and Dentistry to the southern part of the state within two years.

title: U.S. Says Fruit Prices Will Continue to Climb
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 20 (AP)  The Agriculture Department had further bad news for consumers today: Fruit prices are going to keep climbing.

title: Jack Banner, 67, Founder Of Public Relations Concern
description: Jack Banner, cofounder of Banner & Greif, one of the oldest publicrelations firms in the country, died Monday night following a heart attack at his home in Long Branch, N. J. He Was 67 years old.

title: Chill in Genoa Deepens Into Major Italian Oil Scandal
description: ROME, Feb. 20Last November, a school and a hospital in Genoa complained that they couldn't get any fuel for heating despite longstanding contracts with oil companies. A young judicial magistrate opened an investigation.

title: Pistons Rally to Defeat Lakers, 112110
description: DETROIT, Feb. 20 (AP), Ailing Bob Lanier came off the bench to lead a fourthquarter Detroit comeback that carried the Pistons to a 112110 National Basketball Association victory over the Los Angeles Lakers tonight.

title: Syria Reports Destroying Israeli MachineGun Post
description: DAMASCUS, Feb. 20 (AP)Syria said that her forces destroyed an Israeli machinegun post and its crew in a 15minute clash on the Golan Heights today. The size of the crew was not reported.

title: Interested in 1976 Olympics? Now Is Time to Order Tickets
description: If you want to buy a ticket for any events at the 1976 Summer Olympics, send your requests in now.

title: MRS. MEIR PLANS MINORITY CABINET; BIDS DAYAN STAY
description: JERUSALEM, Thursday, Feb. 21  Premier Golda Meir announced last night that she was prepared to form a minority coalition cabinet after negotiations aimed at forming broader coalition had failed.

title: Law and Politics
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 20The downfall of Senator Joseph McCarthy can be traced to one dramatic moment at the ArmyMcCarthy hearings. It was on June 9, 1954, when the Army's lawyer, Joseph N. Welch, asked him, Have you no sense of decency, sir, at long last? Have you left no sense of decency?

title: Japanese Prices Rise
description: TOKYO, Feb. 20 (Reuters)

title: Driver Dispute Disrupts Delivery of Papers Here
description: A dispute that disrupted deliveries of some morning newspapers in the city yesterday was settled later in the day, according to a spokesman for the Metropolitan News Company.

title: MRS. MEIR PLANS MINORITY CABINET; BIDS RYAN STAY
description: JERUSALEM, Thursday, Feb. 21Premier Golda Meir announced last night that she was prepared to form a minority coalition government and that she had asked Defense Minister. Moshe Dayan to serve in the. next Cabinet.

title: New jersey Sports
description: LODI, Feb. 20Springtime can't come soon enough for Marty DiCrosta. Even now, at the age of 65, DiCrosta still gets that yearning for baseball about this time of year. Marty, one of Bergen County's semipro greats, confines himself to Little League umpiring, but last summer showed the younger generation he still can drill a softball.

title: Miss Tisot Wins Slalom
description: APRICA, Italy, Feb. 20 (UPI)Cristina Tisot won the Italian women's special slalom title today after the defending champion, Claudia Giordani, fell and dropped out. The 19yearold Miss Tisot clocked an aggregate of 85.62 seconds for two runs. Patricia Siorpaes was second in 86.11 and Paola Hofer third in 87.94.

title: VERDELLE GARNETT
description: Verdelle Garnett, assistant professor in the department of student life at Manhattan Community College, died of an embolism on Monday at her home, 431 East 20th Street: She was 43 years old.

title: Rockwell Pact Reached
description: PONTIAC, Mich., Feb. 20 (AP)  Bargainers for the United Auto Workers and Rockwell International reached a tentative settlement on a new contract early today, a U.A.W. official announced.

title: Lexington to Vote on Plea For Nixon to Stay Away
description: LEXINGTON, Mass., Feb. 20 (AP)Residents of historic Lexington are being asked to vote on whether President Nixon should be asked to stay away from the town's bicentennial celebration.

title: Garden LineUps
description: FIRST GAME7 P.M.

title: WILSON SHARPENS BID FOR MORE FUEL
description: ALBANY, Feb. 20Although he again declined to press for mandatory alternateday gasoline sales, Governor Wilson today took a somewhat sharper tone in importuning the Federal Government to allocate more gasoline to the state.

title: Nixon Asks Congress for the Authority To Keeps Curbs on Cost of Health Care
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 20 (AP)  Declaring that inflationary pressures are still strong in the medical field, President Nixon asked Congress today for authority to continue Federal controls on health care costs.

title: Weather Reports and Forecast
description: Sunny and mild weather will continue throughout the Northeast today. Skies will be partly cloudy along the rest of the Eastern Seaboard, while clouds are expected to develop over the eastern edges of the Ohio Valley. It will be warmer in the Ohio Valley and the plateau region and the Rockies; cooler temperatures are expected over the Mississippi Valley and Southern Plains States. Showers and thundershowers will spread from southern Illinois to Georgia and central Texas, while rain will prevail from lower Michigan to Oklahoma; snow is forecast from upper Michigan to western Kansas. It will be partly cloudy from the northern and western edges of the Plains States to southern California. Snow is expected in the northern Rockies, while rain will develop along the coast of the Pacific Northwest.

title: STRATFORD GETS CHANGE OF NAME
description: The American Shakespeare Festival in Stratford, Conn., celebrating its 20th anniversary, is changing its name to the American Shakespeare Theater. No longer is it simply a summer festival, but an almost yearround institution, touring as well as playing on its home ground, producing modern plays as well as Shakespeare and with some of its actors working a ninemonth season. Despite a reduced budget, the American Stratford is now entering a period of expansion.

title: TV: Fiction Sticks Close to Fact in A Case of Rape
description: A Case of Rape, presented on the National Broadcasting Company network last night from 9 to 11, managed to make a fictional portrait of a rape victim stick close to the unpleasant facts. The most prominent fact is that the experience of bringing charges against the rapist can be as harrowing as and even more personally destructive than the crime itself.

title: Recital
description: It isn't often that a debut recital yields such cultivated pianism as one heard throughout Vasso Devetzi's first solo appearance here on Tuesday night at Alice Tully Hall. The Greek pianist had played once before in New York, in joint recital with Mstislav Rostropovich, the Soviet cellist, and has been active in Europe for more than 10 years. So, the maturity of her playing should have surprised no one.

title: Striking St. Louis Students Meet at Seminary in Exile
description: ST. LOUIS, Feb. 20 (UPI)For the first time in a month, the majority of students and faculty of Concordia Seminary were in class today, not on the seminary campus but at a seminary in exile.

title: JOSEPH R. SILBERSTEIN Special to The New York Times
description: PITTSBURQH, Feb. 20Joseph R. Silberstein, president of the Baiter Paper Company, the Advance Paper Company and the American Specialty Paper Manufcturing Company, died of a heart attack at his home yesterday. He was 77 years old.

title: Mailer Getting $1Million for Next Novel
description: Little, Brown, the Boston publishing house, has contracted to pay Norman Mailer $1million for rights to his next novel, publishing sources said this week.

title: MACKELL RECALLS LEGITIMATE PLAN
description: Thomas J. Mackell, the former Queens District Attorney, took the stand yesterday in his trial, and acknowledged that certain members of his staff had invested in a socalled getrichquick scheme, but he said he believed then that the venture was a legitimate business.

title: The Election in Michigan Had Its Roots in Boston
description: BOSTON, Feb. 20An unbelievable upset, John P. Marttila was saying, with great deal of relish, over and over again. Outside his sparsely furnished office, a pile of suitcases and a garment bag were topped by a headline in The Detroit Free Press: The Democrat Wins Ford Seat and Calls for Nixon to Quit.

title: Stage: Suicide in Women
description: Under the direction of Kevin O'Connor, the Theater at St. Clements is becoming a significant force in the New York resident, or institutional, theater. It has taken over the lovely building on West 46th Street previously operated by the American Place Theater, and it is doing some very interesting work, both in its main auditorium and in its basement theater. In the. basement it currently has a show called Disquieting Muses, subtitled A Response to the Suicides of Women Artists.

title: Meat in Market Basket Rose by 7% Last Week
description: The city's Consumer Affairs Department reported yesterday that meat prices in its weekly Market Basket survey rose 7 per cent last week as a result of the truckers' strike, which pinched supplies.

title: Coalition Introduces Bill To Repeal Rent Decontrol
description: ALBANY, Feb. 20  A bipartisan coalition of 60 legislators, most of them from New York City, introduced bills today to repeal the vacancydecontrol rent law, rollback the rents of decontrolled apartments and authorize localities anywhere in the state to implement rentcontrol laws.

title: UTILITY SEEKING 2 COAL CONCERNS
description: Merger Newa

title: Market Place: Gulf & Western Splits Analysts
description: Gulf & Western Industries, Inc., once an aggressive conglomerate, has settled down to operate its many acquisitions of the highflying days of the late nineteensixties.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: Official Wants W.F.L. Out of Canada

title: Warriors Win, 122.103
description: CLEVELAND, Feb. 21 (AP) Rick Barry and George Johnson each scored 23 points to lift the Golden State Warriors past the Cleveland Cavaliers, 122103, tonight in the N.B.A.

title: CHARLES B. ALLEN
description: Charles B. Allen, partner in Allen & Brown, tax consultants here, died Feb. 14 in Silver Spring, Md. He was 87 years old and lived in Arlington, Va.

title: Michigan Study Hails Advances by Blacks
description: ANN ARBOR, Mich., Feb. 21 (UPI)A study on minorities released today showed that Michigan had more elected black officials than any other state.

title: Wilson Gets Wide Power To Handle Energy Crisis
description: Mayor Beame made public yesterday his mandatory plan for alternateday gasoline sales, providing for fines up to $250 and jail terms of up to five days for violators.

title: Reserve Sparks Spurs
description: SAN ANTONIO, Tex., Feb. 21 (AP)A reserve guard, George Karl, tallied 17 points tonight as the San Antonio Spurs posted a 123102 A.B.A. victory over the Utah Stars.

title: Amex Rises 6th Straight Day
description: Prices on the American Stock Exchange rose yesterday for the sixth consecutive session in steppedup trading. Advances also were recorded in the overthecounter market as volume increased.

title: F.B.I. Study of Watergate Paper With Alleged Excision Reported
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 21Wellplaced sources said today that the Federal Bureau of Investigation was looking into an apparent excision from White House document subIpoenaed by the special Watergate prosecutor, Leon Jaworski.

title: People in Sports: Aaron Says His Season Will Start in Atlanta
description: No chance, said Henry Aaron when asked whether he might start one of the three season opening games that Atlanta is scheduled to play in Cincinnati April 4 through 7, Following last Saturday's announcement by Bill Bartholomay, Braves' chairman that the 40yearold sluggeron the brink of breaking Babe Ruth's career home run record of 714would be saved for Atlanta's home opener there had been heavy criticism. It included allegations that the Braves were giving up hopes of a National League Western Division title and, in effect, dumping those by not using Aaron.

title: Waldheim Bids World Help SubSahara Area
description: OUAGADOUGOU, Upper Volta, Feb. 21Secretary General Waldheim said today that peoples and countries could disappear from the face of the map in West Africa if the world did not help with longrange efforts to make the subSahara region selfsupporting.

title: ExState Insurance Chief Nov Lobbyist
description: TRENTON, Feb. 21 (AP)A member of the cabinet of former Gov. William T. Cahill who is starting to build a new law practice based on representing clients before state agencies has obtained his first account.

title: Tim Horton Killed
description: Tim Horton, a 44yearold defenseman with the Buffalo Sabres of the National Hockey League, was killed yesterday in an automobile wreck. Horton spent 18 years with the Toronto Maple Leafs, where he was on four Stanley Cup winners and made the allstar team three times. Details on page 36.

title: Gold Prices Hit Peaks in Europe; Dollar Is Weaker
description: LONDON, Feb. 21 (UPI)  Gold prices again soared to records on the big European bullion markets today, riding a wave of what dealers said was continuing uncertainty in foreign exchange markets. The dollar plummeted on major European exchanges.

title: The Supersingers' Opera
description: I Puritani, which came to New York City Opera last night, was Bellini's last opera. He composed it in 1835, and died about nine months later. As early as 1844 it was heard in New York, but it has not had many local performances since then. The last time New Yorkers could see a staging was in 1918. The Metropolitan revived it for the great Spanish singer Maria Barientos.

title: Protest at Princeton
description: PRINCETON, Feb. 21 (UPI) About 150 students and faculty members at Princeton University staged a sunup to sundown fast yesterday in sympathy with a similar fast continuing in Moscow by three Jewish activists. Mark S. Mellman, chairman of the University's Soviet Jewry Committee, said the Soviet activists were protesting the fact that they have not been allowed to leave for Israel beginning in 1970 and 1971.

title: Robert Brink, Formeriustice Of State, Supreme Court, Dies
description: BINGHAMTON, N.Y., Feb. 21 (AP)Robert Brink, a former State Supreme Court Justice, died yesterday in a hospital here. He was 74 years old.

title: E. German Team Wins Ski Relay
description: FALUN, Sweden, Feb. 21 (AP)East Germans upset the favorites, the Soviet Union and Norway, today to win the 40kilometer men's relay in the world Nordic ski championships.

title: Music: The Minnesotans
description: Although the idea of lining up Jacob Druckman's Incenters, Ravel Piano Concerto in G and Bruckner's Symphony No. 3 in D minor to make a symphonic program is not one that would occur to everybody, it seemed quite reasonable in the concert the Minnesota Orchestra played lat Carnegie Hall on Wednesday night under the direction of Stanislaw Skrowaczewski.

title: Article 1  No Title
Collegians In Sulkies At Westbury
description: WESTBURY, L.I., Feb. 21. The first intercollegiate driving championship became a reality this morning as horses and post positions were announced for tomorrow night's twodivision pacing competition at Roosevelt Riceway.

title: Retail Store Sales Up 2%
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 21The Department of Commerce reported today that department store sales last week was an estimated $733million, up 7 per cent from the yearearlier $731million. Tote retail store sales were about $8.876billion, up 2 per cent from last year's $8.687billion.

title: King, Casals Advance
description: DETROIT, Feb. 21 (AP)Mrs. Billie Jean King and Rosemary Casals gained quarterfinal berths in the Virginia Slims tournament with secondround victories today.

title: Winnebago to Make Trucks
description: Winnebago Industries, Inc., a manufacturer of recreational vehicles in Forest City, Iowa, announced yesterday that it was introducing a commercial truck suitable for use in pickup and delivery operations. Production of the trucks on Dodge chassis will begin next month. They are priced at $5,075 to $5,425.

title: Farm Safety Week Set
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 21 (AP)  President Nixon today proclaimed the week beginning July 25 as National Farm Safety Week.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Byrne Hopes to Close Trenton Prison

title: Liver Cancer Case Found by Doctors In 2d Plastic Plant
description: Another case of a rare liver cancer has been found among vinyl chloride workers, this one at a Union Carbide plant in South Charleston, W. Va.

title: Utility Rates Protested At an Austin Tea Party
description: AUSTIN, Tex., Feb. 21 (UPI)A thousand demonstrators, most of them elderly retired persons on fixed incomes, carried teabags to the Austin Tea Party yesterday and threw them on the steps of the Capitol to protest increased utility rates caused by energy shortages.

title: Little Growth Is Foreseen In State Economy in 1974
description: ALBANY, Feb. 21  The State Council of Economic Advisers predicted today that the state's economy would show little growth this year with slight increases in personal income, employment remaining reasonably close to 1973 levels and a rise in the unemployment from 5.1 per cent last year to 5.5 per cent this year.

title: Solzhenitsyn Leaves Zurich, Apparently Bound for Norway
description: GENEVA, Feb.21Aleksandr I. Solzhenitsyn, the exiled Russian writer, left Switzerland today on an international express train, apparently bound for Copenhagen, Denmark, on his way to Norway.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: REGINA, Saskatchewan, Feb. 21 (AP)The Canadian Government will take whatever steps are necessary to, keep the World Football League out of Canada, Marc LaLonde, the Health Minister, said today. A W.F.L. franchise has been awarded to a Toronto group and the league plans to start competition this fall.

title: Wilson Gets Wide Power To Handle Energy Crisis
description: ALBANY, Feb. 21The Legislature voted overwhelmingly today to give Governor Wilson broad emergency powers to deal with the energy crisis. He requested such action more than six weeks ago in his State of the State message, but since then he repeatedly has said he would be reluctant to exercise these powers.

title: N.B.C. Sues F.C.C. Over Pensions Fairness Ruling
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 21 (AP) The United States Appeals Court heard arguments today that the Federal Communicaitions Commission was misusing the fairness doctrine by imposing its news judgment over broadcasters in investigative reporting.

title: Business Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 21 AP)  The Interstate Commerce Commission suspended today a general freight rate increase sought by the nation's railroads but authorized an increase on export rates for grain and grain products.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Old Ferry Boat Runs Into Storm at Auction by City
description: The placidif varied life of the city ferry boat Gold Star Mother ran into a storm yesterday as the city tried to auction off the craft.

title: Energy Saving Is a Hit In Con Ed's Box Score
description: Consolidated Edison's 12th weekly energy box score, released yesterday, indicates a drop in energy consumption for the week ended Feb. 17 compared with the corresponding week last year.

title: U.S. OFFERS LATINS A NEW COMMUNITY
description: MEXICO CITY, Feb. 21Secretary of State Kissinger today began talks with 24 LatinAmerican and Caribbean foreign ministers with a call for the creation of a new Western Hemisphere community of nations.

title: New Jersey Sports
description: NEWARK, Feb. 21  When you have a scholarship you feel like you are working for somebody, said Lou Wejnert of Jersey City State. I was not enjoying myself so I dropped out of school. I wanted to play basketball for fun and not feel like I was working.

title: Barbed Wire to Ring Community As Residents Complain of Crime
description: LAKEWOOD, N. J., Feb. 21 Leisure Village, a retirement community here that has prided itself in offering its 4,000 residents an escape from the clamor and crime of the cities, is girding its perimeter fence with barbed wire to keep out intruders.

title: ROTHKO EXECUTOR CHARGES DATA GAP
description: One of the executors of the estate of Mark Rothko, the abstract expressionist painter, testified in Surrogate Court yesterday that he had been prevented from learning prices obtained for the late artist's paintings by another executor who had an interest in the gallery that sold them.

title: JERSEYANS LAUDED ON GASOLINE PLAN
description: TRENTON, Feb. 21  They state energy administrator, Richard W. DeKorte, and top Federal and state law enforcement officials said today that they were finding public compliance with newly instituted gasoline regulations extremely high.

title: Kidnapped Editor John Reginald Murphy
description: ATLANTA, Feb. 21Except for high public visibility, the Atlanta Constitution editor J. Reginald Murphy, teemed an unlikely candidate for his abduction by a radical revo tionary army.

title: TIM HORTON DIES; HOCKEY STAR, 44
description: ST. CATHARINES, Ontario Feb. 21 (APTim Horton, the hockey defenseman with till Buffalo Sabres, was killed early today when his sports car crashed off the Queen Elizabeth Way. He was 44 years old.

title: OIL COOPERATION OFF LATIN AGENDA
description: MEXICO CITY, Feb. 21Diplomatic sources said today that hemispheric cooperation in the world energy crisis, a most sensitive issue in current interAmerican relations, had been dropped from Secretary of State Kissinger's discussions with Latin American foreign ministers here this week.

title: House Leaders Seeking To Save the Energy Bill
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 21House leaders sought today to salvage an emergency bill that received a procedural setback yesterday when the House Rules Committee voted to open key features to parliamentary challenges when the measure reaches the House floor next week.

title: Court Rules P.S.C. Can Make Utilities Bury Power Lines
description: ALBANY, Feb. 21The Appellate Division of State Supreme Court ruled here today that the Public Service Commission had the authority to require that utility lines be installed underground in new residential subdivisions of five units or more.

title: Rhode Island Escapee Taken
description: PROVIDENCE, R. I., Feb. 21 (AP)Thomas R. Knott Jr. of Pawtucket, the last of three inmates who escaped from Rhode Island State Prison Feb. 6, was arrested in New Orleans yesterday on an armed robbery charge, the police said.

title: Aramco Aide Says Faisal Warned U.S. Last August of War
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 21 (AP) An official of the ArabianAmerican Oil Company said today that Saudi Arabia warned the United States last August of a new Middle East war and an oil embargo within six months but was ignored.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: All Hours Given in Daylight Saving Time

title: News Summary and Index
Vietnam Defoliation Scars Expected to Last a Century
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 21The American use of chemical herbicides in the Vietnam war, long a subject of controversy, caused wounds to the ecology of South Vietnam that may take at least a century to heal the National Academy of Sciences has concluded.

title: Laird Will Direct Study On Fuel Shortage Impact
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 21 (AP) Melvin R. Laird, who was President Nixon's domestic affairs adviser and his Secretary of Defense, agreed today to head a $million private study of the fuel shortage's impact on national life.

title: Man Found on Street Dies of Gunshot Wound
description: A 21yearold man died of gunshot wounds in his head and chest last night after he was found lying in a street in the Park Slope section of Brooklyn shortly before midnight, the police said.

title: Cutbacks and Low Morale Trouble N. I. H.
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 21Thu National Institutes of Health one of the greatest and moss productive medical research or ganizations in the world, is go ing through a time of tight bud. gets, manpower cuts and policy disputes with the Nixon Admin. Istration.

title: Collegians In Sulkies At Westbury
description: WESTBURY, L.I., Feb. 21 The first intercollegiate driving championship became a reality this morning as horses and post positions were announced for tomorrow night's twodivision pacing competition at Roosevelt Raceway.

title: City Is Asked for More School Funds at Staten Island Budget Hearing
description: City officialssome of whom lost their wayventured to Staten Island yesterday for the fourth in a series of capitalbudget hearings in the outer boroughs.

title: Kissinger Asserts Resignation Report Is Just Nonsense
description: MEXICO CITY, Feb. 21A newspaper report that Secretary of State Kissinger said he would resign if the House of Representatives voted to impeach President Nixon was denied today by Mr. Kissinger and by the source of the report.

title: It's Out of the Way, Even a Bit Eerie, but Worth the Trip
description: In the interest of giving this column a bit of geographical spread, I got into a cab the other day and told the driver to get me down to 39 Debrosses Street, the address of Ponte's, which had been described to me as a dockside restaurant with the daily menu chalked on a blackboard.

title: Cornell Faces Penalties On Recruiting Violations
description: Cornell University faces the possibility of severe penalties from the National Collegiate Athletic Association and the Eastern College Athletic Conference as the result of recruiting violations in basketball committed during the current season. Cornell may expect heavy punishment since the Ivy League school is currently serving a oneyear probation from the N.C.A.A. for recruiting violations in hockey.

title: Police Seeking 1971 Car In Slaying of Executive
description: Kenneth Smith, a 33yearold American Airlines executive found slain last Tuesday night on a deserted road in Berkeley Heights, was apparently shot while sitting in the front seat of a 1971 car, then pushed from the automobile onto the road way, according to Karl Asch, the Union County Prosecutor.

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: 4 SEASONS OFFICIAL GETS YEAR IN PRISON
description: OKLAHOMA CITY, Feb. 21 (AP)A cofounder of Four Seasons Nursing Centers of America was sentenced to year in prison and fined $10,000 today for his part in what Federal Judge called the biggest swindle I've ever seen. United States District Court Judge Luther Eubanks told Thomas J. Gray that he realized that the multimilliondollar stock swinde was largely matter entered into by your halfbrother, former Four Seasons President Jack L. Clark, but you profited.

title: Gromyko and Pope Discuss Jerusalem, Mideast and Peace
description: ROME, Feb. 21  Foreign Minister Andrei A. Gromyko of the Soviet Union, winding up a fourday visit to Italy, called on Pope Paul today and discussed the Middle East and the future of Jerusalem with him.

title: Music: A Rare Performance of Don Quichotte Is Staged by Sarah Caldwell in Boston
description: BOSTON, Feb. 21Massenet's Don Quichotte is not an opera known to many in this country, though it has had sporadic performances here and there. The last time New York saw it was in 1926, with Feodor Chaliapin, who had created the title role in 1910. Last night, Sarah Caldwell staged it for the Opera Company of Boston at the Orpheum Theater, and a large audience went to observe the curiosity.

title: AIDES SAY HOUSE NEED NOT ALLEGE CRIME TO IMPEACH
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 21 Lawyers for the House Judiciary Committee flatly rejected today arguments that President Nixon was subject to impeachment only for indictable criminal offenses.

title: KUWAIT REJECTS ALL BIDS FOR OIL
description: BEIRUT, Feb. 21The Government of Kuwait today rejected all bids for the 85 million barrels of crude oil that it had put up for auction last week and invited international companies to submit new offert with a minimum price of $11.54 a barrelthe posted price for Kuwait crude.

title: Bond Prices Mixed Again as Quiet Trading Continues
Excerpts From Impeachment Study by House Aides
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 21The following are excerpts of a memorandum prepared for the House Judiciary Committee by the impeachment inquiry staff lawyers on conduct for which a president might be impeached:

title: A Message From Home
description: It is not at all surprising that Democrats on the House Judiciary Committee stiffened their posture on Richard Nixon's possible impeachment just two days after a Democratic candidate won the supposedly safe Republican Congressional seat that Gerald Ford had given up in Michigan.

title: LOTTERY NUMBERS
WEEK'S CAR OUTPUT TRAILED 1973 LEVEL
description: DETROIT, Feb. 21The United States auto industry is scheduled to build 166,275 cars this week, off 23.9 per cent from the 218,457 cars built in the corresponding week last year.

title: Sabres Play Flames to A 44 Tie
description: BUFFALO, Feb. 21 (UPI)Don Luce put in a late thirdperiod goal tonight, his second of the game, as the Buffalo Sabres rallied from a threegoal deficit to tie the Atlanta Flames, 44.

title: EARLY END IS HINTED IN DEMOCRATIC SUIT
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 21 (UPI)  The Democratic National Committee chairman Robert S. Strauss, indicated today that an outofcourt settlement may be imminent in the party's $6million Watergate suit against President Nixon's 1972 campaign committee.

title: Rep. Griffiths 38th In House to Declare Intentions to Retire
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 21  Representative Martha Griffiths of Michigan, a leader in the fight for equal rights of women, announced today that she would not seek reelection this year.

title: Bridge:
description: The success of the American Contract Bridge League, which gives its blessing each year to more than 800 sectional and regional tournaments, creates special problems.

title: GRAFT ON L.I. LAID TO RER,RONCALLO, 4 OTHERS IN G.O.P.
description: Representative Angelo D. Roncallo and four other Republican officials in Nassau County were accused yesterday in Federal indictment of having participated in a scheme to extort money from a Long Island contractor for the benefit of the Republican party.

title: Transit Breakthrough
description: The emergency masstransit aid bill agreed upon by a HouseSenate conference committee represents an extraordinary breakthrough on behalf of public transportation throughout the country. Its benefits would be of special value in the New York metropolitan area, which accounts for 40 per cent of the country's transit riders.

title: HAPPY ANNIVERSARY
description: Anita, Mom, Dad, Love StanleyAd??

title: Endangered Oil Bill...
description: Over the stubborn opposition of President Nixon and the oil lobby, who have fought a delaying action against the emergency energy bill, a twothirds majority of the Senate this week passed a compromise conference version of the bill calling for price rollbacks on oil and measures to conserve energy. It also gave the President standby authority to order fuel rationing. Now the House Rules Committee, dominated by Congressmen sympathetic to the oil industry, has abused its power by setting this basically sound, middleoftheroad bill up for almost certain extermination.

title: Capt. John Moore, Chaplain On Nimitz's Staff, Is Dead
description: WYNNEWOOD, Pa., Feb. 21  Capt. John Warner Moore, U.S.N., retired, a Presbyterian chaplain in both World Wars, who served as Pacific Fleet chaplain on the staff of Adm. of the Fleet Chester W. Nimitz from 1943 to 1945, died Feb. 14 at the age of 87.

title: Ben S. Gregory, 84, Dead; Commercial Flier, Inventor
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Feb. 21 (AP)Ben S. Gregory, an inventor and aviator who survived seven air crashes, died at his home Tuesday. He was 84 years old.

title: $1Billion for Poor Lands Is Pledged by Shah of Iran
description: TEHERAN, Iran, Feb. 21The Shah of Iran today proposed the creation of a new development fund, backed by oil mohey, for poorer countries and pledged more than $1billion to the fund, whose aim would be to ease problems caused by higher oil prices.

title: Prime Rate Reduction Looms; Prices on Big Board Advance
description: The stock market posted its second brisk advance in a row yesterday amid rising hopes for an early resolution to the Arab oil embargo.

title: Canada Postpones Hearing On Deportation of Fugitive
description: MONTREAL, Feb. 21 (AP) The Immigration Appeal Board agreed yesterday to postpone the hearing of Raid Estremera of New York, who is appealing a deportation order issued against him on Feb. 5.

title: Jonathan vs. Peking
description: WINTER HAVEN, Fla.I've got this great return that I really want to use in Peking.

title: Dance: Neville and Beck
description: Phoebe Neville's delightfully precise dances almost make everyone else's look irresponsibly frantic. During a decade when changing dance styles became a way of life, she decided to explore minimal movement and poetic concentration, and she has continued to do so with impressive effect. Monday evening at the Cubiculo she gave the first performance of Cartouche, on a program shared with Christopher Beck.

title: Sills Joins Greats In Puritan Role
High School Sports
description: Eight teams, including Clinton, the defending champion, remain in the Public Schools Athletic League playoffs. The opening round produced some startling performances, but no upsets. Taft, Bryant, Jackson, Fort Hamilton, Haaren, Hughes and New Utrecht are the other survivors. George Johnson of New Utrecht, Butch Lee of Clinton and Alex Eldridge of Taft will have the college recruiters flocking to the quarterfinal games.

title: Front Page 2  No Title
description: John Dexter Ii Managing Director of WILCOX & GIBBS Ltd. (WgAMEX) Advt

title: False Equity Assets Put at $143Million
description: LOS ANGELES, Feb. 21The trustee of the Equity Funding Corporation of America has identified and eliminated from the company's books $143.4million of fictitious or fraudulently inflated assets.

title: Dayan Associates Doubt He'll Stay On
description: JERUSALEM, Feb. 21Associates of Defense Minister Moshe Dayan said today that they doubted that he would agree to serve in the minority government announced by Premier Golda Meir last night, despite her repeated requests that he remain.

title: F.B.I. Investigating Brutality Complaint By Motorist Against Middletown Police
description: NEWARK, Feb. 21  The Federal Bureau of Investigation said today that it was looking into a charge against the Middletown Police Department by a businessman who said that Mace had been sprayed in his eyes while he was in custody on a traffic complaint.

title: MAX SEIGEL
description: CLIFTON, N.J., Feb. 21 Max Seigel, owner of the realestate corporation of his name here and a past president of the New Jersey Board of Realtors, died Wednesday in the Passaic General Hospital. He was 69 years old and lived on Hepburn Road.

title: $1Billion for Poor Lands Is Pledged by Shah of Iran
description: TEHERAN, Iran, Feb. 21The Shah of Iran today proposed the creation of a new development fund, backed by oil money, for poorer countries and pledged more than $1billion to the fund, whose aim would be to ease problems caused by higher oil prices.

title: Boy Scouts Present Nixon With Set of Gold Medals
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 21 (UPI)President Nixon told a group of 15 Boy Scouts at his White House office today that all the problems Scouts were working on, including the energy shortage, fortunately are problems of peace.

title: Bach Group Offers 7 Arias, 2 Cantatas
description: The Bach Aria Group always sees to it that the performing duties are evenly distributed. At Wednesday night's concert in Alice Tully Hall, the total of seven arias and two complete cantatas (Nos. 8 and 108) added up to three arias apiece for the four vocalists and two obbligato assignments for each of the four solo instrumentalists.

title: NEW TONE ENTERS CHINESE CAMPAIGN
description: HONG KONG, Feb. 21The official Chinese Communist newspaper warned yesterday, in a strikingly moderate editorial, that the current mass campaign in China should avoid getting entangled in certain questions.

title: Wilson Shuns Comment on Watergate
description: ROCHESTER, Feb. 21Moving his unofficial election campaign upstate, Governor Wilson declined to offer an opinion of the Watergate affair tonight, saying he could do so only with such firsthand information as access to grandjury minutes.

title: HEARST CAPTORS STEP UP DEMANDS
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Feb, 21 The kidnappers of Patricia Hearst demanded today that her family provide $4million more in free food and threatened to break off communications if the demand was not met within 24 hours.

title: Fire Kills 4 in Canada
description: KITWANCOOL, British Collumbia, Feb. 21 (AP)An explosion and fire destroyed a mobile home, killing four children in this northcentral community, the police reported. The Royal Canadian Mounted Police said that an explosion in an oil stove yesterday apparently ignited th?? blaze.

title: BIG OIL CONCERNS ARE CUTTING BACK IMPORTS OF CRUDE
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 21  Some of the nation's major oil companies are deliberately reducing their imports of crude oil because they are unhappy with the Government's allocation program for crude, according co Administration sources close to the energy situation.

title: CITY TO AID AILEY IN PARKS PROGRAM
description: The Alvin Ailey City Center Dance Theater will receive $35,000 allocation from the city for free performances in the parks this summer, Edwin L. Weisl Jr., the Prks, Recreation and Cultural Affairs Administrator, announced yesterday.

title: Tesoro Sets Stock Split
description: Shareholders of the Tesoro Petroleum Corporation in San Antonio, Tex., approved yesterday a 2for1 split of the common stock at the company's annual meeting. Following the meeting, directors announced an increase in the quarterly dividend to 6 cents a share, on a postsplit basis, payable March 29 to holders of record on March 4. The company's previous dividend before the split was 10 cents a share.

title: HOUSE PANEL GETS JAWORSKI OUTLINE
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 21Leon Jaworski, the special Watergate prosecutor, turned over to the House impeachment inquiry today a list of evidence gathered or subpoenaed from the White House by his office over the last eight months in its investigation of the Watergate scandal.

title: A FiveAlarm Fire Damages Six Floors Of Buffalo Building
description: BUFFALO, Feb. 21A spectacular fivealarm fire destroyed the interior of the upper six floors of the historic 13story Prudential Building in the downtown section here tonight. Two persons, one a fireman, were slightly injured. The cause was not determined.

title: TV: Of Courage and Roy Campanella
description: It's Good to Be Alive, being presented tonight from 9 o'clock to 11 on the Columbia Broadcasting System, is solidly entrenched in the category of profiles in courage. It is based on Roy Campanella's autobiography of the same name, and was written by Steven Gethers and directed by Michael Landon, formerly of longrunning Bonanza fame.

title: Lack of Gasoline Called a Peril To Parking Industry in the City
description: New York's parking problem has taken an ironic turn: It's the garage or lot operator who has the problem now, coping with halfempty facilities.

title: Ashe, Laver Upset
description: LONDON. Feb. 21 (AP) Roscoe Tanner of Lookout Mountain, Tenn., pulled the upset of the. $44,000 World Championship Tennis tournament today by beating the topseeded player, Rod Laver of Australia, 63, 57, 64, to advance to the semifinal round.

title: DELAFLOR, IN DEBUT, PLAYS SKILLFULLY
description: Manuel Delaflor, a Mexican pianist who made his New York debut on Wednesday night at Carnegie Recital Hall, played a demanding program with considerable skill. A Mozart sonata (K. 332) was accurate and wellproportioned, though not pliant enough in its phrases. Beethoven's Sonata in A flat (Op. 110) turned somewhat muddled in the fugal finale, but it toe received a solid, intelligent performance. To play Op. 110 as ably as Mr. Delaflor did, one must have talent and excellent schooling, and he is lacking in neither.

title: ANSWER TO PREVIOUS PUZZLE
Big Soviet Loan Deal Approved by Eximbank
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 21 (Reuters)The United States ExportImport Bank today approved loan agreements of over $194million to finance two major industrial projects in the Soviet Union.

title: LOTTERY NUMBERS Feb. 21, 1974
description: New York761703

title: ...Why It Should Pass
description: The emergency energy billwith its provisions for price rollbacks and controls as an alternative to the Administration's own proposal for a socalled windfall profits taxrepresents a compromise effort to restrain monopoly pricing without cutting off the supply of essential fuel.

title: Tams Down Rockets
description: MEMPHIS, Feb. 21 (AP) Wil Jones hit a seasonhigh 26 points tonight to lead the Memphis Tams to a 111106 victory over the Denver Rockets in the American Basketball Association.

title: Beame Asked by Landlords To Declare Oil Emergency
description: The Council of Property Owners Associations, representing landlords of two million apartments, yesterday called on Mayor Beame to declare a fueloil emergency in the city.

title: NEWS INDEX
description: News Summary and index, Page 35

title: BRONX EXPRESSWAY CLOSED FOR REPAIRS
description: The CrossBronx Expressway was to be closed between Bruckner Boulevard and the Major Deegan Expressway until 8 A.M. today to repair damage caused last evening when several manhole covers were blown off, bringing down part of the concrete support of the Arthur Avenue overpass.

title: Atlanta Constitution Editor Kidnapped; Revolutionary Army Seeks $700,000
description: ATLANTA, Feb. 21The editorialpage editor of The Atlanta Constitution was kidnapped last night and today sent a taperecorded message to his paper saying that his abductors wanted $700,000 in ransom.

title: HEARST CAPTORS STEP UP DEMANDS
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Feb. 21SAN FRANCISCO, Feb. 21The kidnappers of Patricia Hearst demanded today that her family provide $4million more in free food and threatened to break off communications if the demand was not met within 24 hours.

title: Frederick Paul Keppel, 67, Of Price, Waterhouse Dies
description: Frederick Paul Keppel, a former member of Price, Waterhouse & Co., certified public accountants, died yesterday at Maryland General Hospital in Baltimore after a brief illness. He was 67 years old and lived in Westminster, Md.

title: WAYNE IN U.S. SUIT ATTACKS LAND LAW
description: NEWARK, Feb. 21 (AP) A littlepublicized New Jersey law that helps owners of land to reap higher profits in sales to urbanrenewal programs is under attack in a Federal court suit here.

title: Red Smith
description: The first time Charlie Finley fired Alvin Dark, the circumstances were about as unappetizing as circumstances can get when a baseball manager and his employer are parting. Instead of mouthing the conventional inanities about the splendid job the manager had done and the lamentable necessity of making a change in the best interests of all concerned, Finley put Dark away as a liar, and a disloyal liar to boot. The cordial climate was warmed even more by the playersthey were then a bad team called the Kansas City Athletics unaware of their bright destiny as Oakland A'swho issued statements calling Finley a menace to baseball, among other things. When Finley rehired Dark day before yesterday, the newold manager of the A's had tears of gratitude in his eyes and a catch in his throat, according to United Press International, As for Good Time Charlie, he laid an arm around Alvin's shoulders and spoke as follows: Yes, he managed the club before. Yes, he was fired. Yes, he's back. And yes, he expects to be fired again some day.

title: That Amazing Decker Girl Is A. A. U. F. Feature Tonight
STATIONS PONDER LONG GAS STRIKE
description: GREENWICH, Conn., Feb. 21  Gasoline retailers here threatened today to extend thei rtwodayold shutdown indefinitely as the protest spread Ito two other towns and strike sentiment appeared to be growling throughout the state.

title: Geneva War Conference Delays Start of Its Work
description: GENEVA, Feb. 21 (Reuters) Delegates to the 117nation conference on the Geneva war conventions tonight gave up until next week attempts to start work on bringing the 25yearold agreements up to date.

title: PROFIT AND SALES INCREASE AT RCA
description: The RCA Corporation reported yesterday a new high of $1.18billion in fourthquarter sales. This represented a gain of 11.3 per cent over the $1.06billion reported in the final quarter of 1972. Net income rose 19.7 per cent to $53.4million, or 70 cents a share, from $44.6million, or 58 cents a share on fewer shares, in the like 1972 period.

title: NIXON SHIFTS PLAN ON DRUG TRAFFIC
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 21 President Nixon withdrew today his proposal for life imprisonment without parole for twiceconvicted heroin traffickers but called for a mandatory threeyear sentence for wide range of narcotics sellers.

title: Excerpts From Tape of Editor
description: ATLANTA, Feb. 21Following are excerpts from the tape cassette sent to The Atlanta Constitution today by J. Reginald Murphy, its editorialpage editor who was abducted last night. The cassette was addressed to James Minter, managing editor of The Constitution:

title: Wood, Field & Stream Even Predators Have Rights
description: Many socalled sportsmen have not yet learned that the birds and animals they pursue have a life of their own beyond man's needs and desires.

title: Test for Mrs. Gandhi
description: Only two years ago India's Prime Minister Indira Gandhi enjoyed popularity and power exceeding even that of her father, the late revered Jawaharlal Nehru. After India's triumph over Pakistan in the Bangladesh war, Mrs. Gandhi's New Congress party scored stunning victories in state elections across the country, routing a divided and dispirited opposition. Her triumph raised effusive hopes that India would enjoy a new era progress under strong, united leadership.

title: General Tax Cut Opposed by Burns; Longer ExecutivePay Curbs Asked
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 21 The chairman of the Federal Reserve Board strongly opposed today a general tax cut or substantially enlarged expenditures by the Government to cope with the current stagnation of the economy and rising unemployment.

title: Dance: Scheherezade
description: Murray Louis has entitled his latest dance piece Scheherezade, a dream, and in this day of unrelated titles it is perhaps worthwhile, for once, to take the subtitle seriously.

title: Marquette Downs Manhattan, 7359, Georgetown Wins, 8873, at Garden
description: Marquette held a basketball defensive clinic last night at Madison Square Garden.

title: MISS CARROLL PLAYS ON SYLVIA SYMS BILL
description: The combination of Barbara Carroll, the tall, slim, elegant jazz pianist, and Sylvia Syms, the short, round cuddlesome jazz singer, at the 5:45 Interludes at Town Hall on Wednesday had its physical incongruities (The Mutt and Jeff of the cabaret business, muttered a voice in the rear as they took a bow together). But, musically, they were a very cbtnpatible couple. In fact, one of the matt interesting aspects of their, onehour program was the perceptive and very participatory manner in which Miss Carroll provided accompaniment to Miss Syms's singing.

title: James Daugherty, Artist, Dead; Children's Book Author Was 84
description: WESTON, Conn., Feb. 21 James H. Daugherty, an early nonobjective artist of the synchromist school, which structured paintings by means of flat planes And disks of brilliant color, died today in Boston nursing home. Mr. Daugherty, who also won distinction as a writer and illustrator of children's books on American historical themes, was 84 years old and lived on Broad Street here.

title: Plot on Store Safe Fails
description: NASHVILLE, Feb. 21 (UPI) Two men posing as telephone company workers abducted the wife of an assistant manager of the KMart store and forced her husband to empty the store's safe, the police said today, However, when James Ezell attempted to follow instructions and deliver the money, the abductors were apparently scared off. Mrs, Ezell was found in the trunk of the family car unharmed.

title: U.S. Says Date of Nixon Trip To Europe Has Not Been Set
description: The date for President Nixon's expected trip to Western Europe is still open, the White House said today.

title: Concert: Bostonians Play Tippett
description: It was a British evening that the Boston Symphony Orchestra offered in Avery Fisher Hall on Wednesday night. Colin Davis, the British musician who is one of the Bostonians' principal guest conductors, was on the podium. In the Schumann Piano Concerto the soloist was Michael Roll, also British, and the other work in the program was the Third Symphony of Sir Michael Tippett, in which the soloist was the Belfastborn soprano Heather Harper.

title: Why Galanos Gave His Audience a Shock Treatment
description: He's the grand old man of American fashion, though he's still in his forties. He began knocking them dead with his first collection in 1951 and eight years later entered fashion's Hall of Fame.

title: Laotian Premier Says Accord On Coalition Rule Is Imminent
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, Feb. 21The Premier, Prince Souvanna Phouma, marked the first anniversary of the ceasefire in Laos today by telling the nation that after many storms the haven is finally coming into viewdefinitive peace is at hand.

title: LATE JERSEY EDITION
description: General news, P. 37; sports, P. 76.

title: One Britain, One World
description: LONDON, Feb. 21  The British election is merely one dramatic symbol of the much deeper crisis now shaking the whole Western world. The economic problems are more serious here than in most other advanced industrial nations, but the debates here are bringing to the surface the staggering issues of inflation, prices, unemployment and scarce raw materials that are also dividing the United States, Western Europe and Japan.

title: Faulkner's Mississippi Revisited: Some Change but Much the Same
description: The past is never dead.

title: HUGE RALLY IN SEOUL ASSAILS KOREA REDS
description: SEOUL South Korea, Feb. 21 A huge crowd of South Kereans condemned North, Korea today at a mass rally here to protest the attack last week on South Korean fishing boats by North Korean gunboats, an incident that plunged NorthSouth relations to the lowest point in recent years.

title: Strong Profits Reports Issue in British Election
description: LONDON, Feb. 21A heavy flow of strong earnings reports from British banks and industrial companies in the last few days has raised a new campaign issue in the national elections because of the sharp contrast with the current state of the economy.

title: BONN AIDE STRESSES U.S.EUROPEAN LINKS
description: VIENNA, Feb. 21  Foreign Minister Walter Scheel of West Germany said today that Europeans must not be forced to choose between their own unity and cooperation with the United States.

title: Delaney Gains Net Semifinal
description: SALISBURY, Md., Feb. 21 (AP)Unseeded Jim Delaney of Potomac, Md., and Frew McMillan of South Africa, moved into the semifinal round of the United States national indoor open tennis championships tonight. Each defeated a player who had scored an upset earlier in the tournament.

title: Witness Traces Oil Trust Exemption
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 21 (UPI)Major oil companies escaped antitrust prosecution in the past because of personal' intervention of Presidents Truman and Eisenhower, witnesses testified at a Senate hearing today.

title: NEWS INDEX
description: News Summary and Index, Page 35

title: JOBS IN CITY DOWN BY 21,000 IN 1973
description: Total payroll jobs in New York City declined by 21,000 last year while employment in in the New Yorknortheastern New Jersey area rose by 42,000.

title: Crisis Said to Hurt Blacks the Most
description: A public meeting called by a number of black political leaders drew more than 300 people to a Harlem church yesterday seeking a program to alleviate the effects of the energy crisis on the black and poor communitiesgroups the leaders asserted were more severely hurt than the community at large.

title: Stage: Once I Saw a Boy Laughing...
description: A play called Once I Saw a Boy Laughing.... opened last night at the Westside Theater. I cannot imagine what he found so funny.

title: Brown, in Outburst, Assails Witness
description: Henry. S. Brown, on trial in the slaying of Police Officers Gregory P. Foster and Rocco W. Laurie on the Lower East. Side in 1972, lashed out at one of the prosecution's major witnesses yesterday.

title: Traitors Brings Peronism to Screen
description: As an example of film art The Traitors, a new Argentine film, is about as riveting as a segment of Marcus Welby, M.D. It tells the story of the 17year rise and fall of a crooked union leader who has a wife, a mistress, a taste for the high life and absolutely no scruples. It is straightforward, conventional and Competent. No nonsense here with Godard or Brecht.

title: Contract Awards
description: The American Steamship Company, a subsidiary of the General American Transportation Corporation, said yesterday it had agreed in principle with the Bay Shipbuilding Company for Bay to build three 1,000foot selfunloading Great Lakes vessels at a total price of $90million. There is also an option for a fourth vessel.

title: Islamic Mission to Dacca Seeks BengaliPakistani Reconciliation
description: LAHORE, Pakistan, Friday, Feb. 22  Foreign ministers from Moslem nations, on the eve of a major Islamic conference here, abruptly decided yesterday to send a sevenmember mission to Daca to seek a lastminute reconciliation between Bangladesh and Pakistan.

title: Indictments Are Called a Serious Blow to the G.O.P.
description: MINEOLA, L. I., Feb. 21The indictment by a Federal grand jury of six Nassau County Republicans, including a United States Representative and the Supervisor of Oyster Bay, was seen here today as perhaps the most severe blow ever suffered by the county G.O.P.

title: FOOD STAMP DECLINE IN VALUE FORESEEN
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 21 (UPI) Poor people who shop with food stamps may find their coupons buying less in the latter part of the year if prices keep going up as expected, Agriculture Department sources indicated today.

title: YUGOSLAVS ADOPT 4TH CONSTITUTION
description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia, Feb. 21Yugoslavia today adopted a new socialist Constitution regarded by many foreign economists and diplomats as little short of utopian.

title: Evaluating Counterforce Strategy
description: WASHINGTONSince his appointment as Secretary of Defense in July, 1973, James R. Schlesinger has attempted to lay to rest many of the misconceptions that have enveloped American nuclear strategy. In the process, misunderstandings, questions and controversies have arisen and are likely to remain.

title: Miss Proell Defeated
description: BREGENZ, Austria, Feb. 21 (AP)Annemarie Proell, who has wrapped up her fourth World Cup Alpine ski crown, fell short of victory in the downhill of the Austrian ski championships today.

title: Laxalt Bids for Senate
description: CARSON CITY, Nev., Feb. 21 Former Gov. Paul Laxalt said today that he would seek the Republican nomination for the United States Senate seat held by Alan Bibles, Democrat who is retiring.

title: NEW BRAZE CHIEF PRESENTS CABINET
description: RIO DE JANEIRO, Feb. 21Brazil's Presidentelect, Gen. Ernesto Geisel, announced today the members of his cabinet, which takes office on March 15, in what appeared to be a change more of style than of substance from the outgoing government of President Emilio G. Mdici.

title: Vietnam Defoliation Scars Expected to Last a Century
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 21The American use of chemical herbicides in the Vietnam war, long a subject of controversy, caused wounds to the ecology of South Vietnam that may take at least a century to heal, the National Academy of Sciences has concluded.

title: RCA and Kodak Gain
description: The RCA Corporation reported yesterday a rise of 19.7 per cent in profits as sales climbed to a record for the fourth quarter. Sales and earnings of the Eastman Kodak Company also set records for the latest quarter. Page 47.

title: PRICES RISE AGAIN FOR COMMODITIES
description: It was more of the same in most commodity markets here yesterday as trade and specula tive interests bid up almost all raw materials to record or nearrecord highs.

title: Off Off Broadway
description: It is advisable to telephone theaters for schedules and prices before going to a show. Most, if not all, theaters accept Theater Development Fund vouchers.

title: New U.S. Ambassador Arrives In Moscow, Filling Vacant Post
description: MOSCOW, Feb. 21Walter J. Stoessel Jr., the new American Ambassador to the Soviet Union, arrived here today to fill a post that was vacant for 13 months.

title: Boyle Plea Rejected
description: MEDIA, Pa., Feb. 21 (UPI) Delaware County Judge Domenic D. Jerome rejected today a defense motion to disqualify the state's special prosecutor, Richard A. Sprague, in the murder trial of W. A. Boyle, former president of the United Mine Workers. Mr. Boyle is accused in the deaths of Joseph A. Yablonski, a union insurgent, his wife and daughter.

title: Notes on People
description: The Treasurer of the United States, Romana Acosta Banuelos, handed in her resignation yesterday, and President Nixon accepted it with deep regret. Mrs. Banuelos, the White House said, gave personal and family reasons for her departure in her third year as Treasurer. However, sources in the Treasury Department said that she was unhappy over internal changes in the department.

title: Fire Kills Elderly Patient
description: One pattent was killed and two others were overcome by smoke today in a fire at the Skyview Terrace Nursing Home for the elderly. Killed was Mary Hartland, 61 years old.

title: DANIEL BAKER
description: STAMFORD, Conn., Feb. 21Daniel Baker, former lawyer with the National Labor Relations Board, died yesterday at Stamford Hospital. He was 66 years old and lived on West Hill Road.

title: CROSSWORD PUZZLE
description: ACROSS

title: Dan J. Harrison, 94, Oilman And ExTexas Regent, Dies
description: HOUSTON, Feb. 21 (UPI) Dan J. Harrison Sr., a millionaire oilman, rancher and former University of Texas regent, died here yesterday. He was 94 years old.

title: Mine Director Confirmed
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 21 (AP) The Senate confirmed today the nomination of Thomas V. Falkie of Pennsylvania to be director of the Bureau of Mines.

title: EMHART IN PACT TO BUY FELLOWS
description: The Emhart Corporation announced yesterday that it had agreed in principle to acquire the Fellows Corporation, a manufacturer of gearshaping equipment, and Domain Industries, Inc., a producer of packaging machinery, animal feeds and swimming pools and accessories. Emhart said that, under the agreements, it would acquire Domain, which has its headquarters in New Richmond, Wis. for not more than 550,000 shares of Emhart common stock and Fellows for approximately 173,000 shares of Emhart common stock in a taxfree transaction.

title: BIG OIL CONCERNS ARE CUTTING BACK IMPORTS OF CRUDE
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 21 Some of the nation's major oil companies are deliberately reducing their imports of crude oil because they are unhappy with the Government's allocation program for crude, according to Administration sources close to the energy situation.

title: A.P.I. Reports Rise for Imports Of Oil and Gasoline Production
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 21 (AP)  The American Petroleum Institute reported today slight increases in petroleum imports last week and increases in both production and stocks of gasoline.

title: ExGurney FundRaiser Gets Year in TaxBribery Case
description: JACKSONVILLE, Fla., Feb. 21 (AP)Larry Williams, a former fundraiser for Senator Edward J. Gurney, Republican of Florida was sentenced to a year in prison today after pleading guilty to charges of attempting to evade Federal income taxes and helping a contractor accept a bribe.

title: Liberals in Britain Are Winning Over Some Traditional Conservatives
description: BRENDON, England, Feb. 20When he retired after 30 years in the Royal Air Force, Wing Comdr. Frank Rock and his wife came to live among the round green hills and butterchurns of North Devon. With his great white mustache, his ramrod stance, his eyebrowtangled glare, Wing Commander Rock could be a caricature of the Englishman who has always voted Conservative and always will.

title: GRAFT ON L.I. LAID TO REP. RONCALLO 4 OTHERS IN G.O.P.
description: Representative Angelo D. Roncallo and four other Repub lican officials in Nassau County were accused yesterday in a Federal indictment of having participated in a scheme to extort money from a Long Island contractor for the benefit of the Republican party.

title: MILTON S. SAMUELS
description: Milton S. Samuels, a vice president of RKOStanley Warner Theaters, died yesterday in Mount Sinai Hospital. He was 52 years old and lived at 5761 Cloverdale Boulevard in Bayside, Queens.

title: Du Pont Discloses Hoax in a Movie On Water Gel Use Versus Dynamite
description: E. I. duPont de Nemours & Co., Inc. disclosed yesterday that it was sending out more than 6,000 letters to Federal, state and local regulatory agencies, customers and the news media notifying them that portions of a film portraying the safety advantages of water gels over dynamite were faked.

title: MITCHELL JUDGE CLEARS 15 JURORS
description: Slow but significant progress was made yesterday in the selection of a jury for two former Cabinet officers accused of obstructing a major investigation, with 15 persons receiving preliminary clearance by the judge.

title: Advertising: Analysis in Depth
description: An indepth analysis of American advertising, present and future, has just been published by a Manhattanbased market research company.

title: Care of ExMental Patients Defended
description: HAUPPAUGE, L. I., Feb. 21 Fifteen women who provide family care for mental outpatients at the state's expense charged today that the state's relaxed release policy had created a backlash of zoning penalties and community resentment.

title: Julie Eisenhower Better
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 21 (UPI) Mrs. David Eisenhower, re, covering from ovarian cyst surgery, is feeling a whole lot better, a White House spokesman said today. The President's daughter, the former Julie Nixon, had dinner with her family in the solarium of their White House quarters last night and has been able to catchup on some of her get well mail.

title: Surgery for Buoniconti
description: MIAMI, Fla., Feb. 21 (UPI) Nick Buoniconti, Miami Dolphins' linebacker, underwent surgery today for removal of bone chips in his right elbow. A team spokesman said Buoniconti would spend a day or two recovering in Mercy Hospital. Buoniconti played in the American Conference championship game against Oakland and the Super Bowl victory over Minnesota with the chips in his elbow.

title: Commodity Price Index Up 7.8 From WeekAgo Level
description: The commodity spot market price index of foodstuff and industrial materials rose sharply to 231.0 from 223.2 last week.

title: Julie Eisenhower Better
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 21 (UPI) Mrs. David Eisenhower, recovering from ovarian cyst surgery, is feeling a whole lot better, a White House spokesman said today. The President's daughter, the former Julie Nixon, had dinner with her family in the solarium of their White House quarters last night and has been able to catch up on some of her get well mail.

title: Church Council SitIn Ends in Compromise After a Day
description: Thirtyfive supporters of the Rev. Robert C. Chapman, former director of social justice of the National Council of Churches, yesterday ended their sitin at the council's offices in the Interchurch Center, Riverside Drive and 120th Street.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: OPERA The Eastern Opera Company is only in its second season, so you can't really say that it is flying in the face of tradition with its latest undertaking, a contemporary opera, Postcard From Morocco by Dominick Argento, which it will present at 8 tonight and tomorrow at Pace University's Schimmel Center for the Arts, on Spruce Street, just east of City Hall.

title: Seaver to Receive Record $170,000
U.S. OFFERS LATINS A NEW COMMUNITY
description: MEXICO CITY, Feb. 21Secretary of State Kissinger today began talks with 24 LatinAmerican and Caribbean foreign ministers with a call for the creation of a new Western Hemisphere commurrity of nations.

title: The Prospect for a Transit Bill
description: The masstransit agreement fashioned by a HouseSenate conference Wednesdaya bill promising a big, but perhaps not big enough, contribution to saving New York's 35cent ?? faces imposing obstacles and the continuing chance of Presidential veto. Nevertheless, officials see a good deal of room for compromise between Capitol Hill and the Nixon Administration. The Congressional conference bill could conceivably be combined with a modified version of the Administration's broader sixyear bill to expand and aid the nation's transportation facilities.

title: ROBERT REISNER, 53, JAZZ WRITER, DEAD
description: Robert George Reisner, writer, humorist and jazz buff, died Tuesday in St. Vincent's Hospital from complications brought on by a diabetic condition. He was 53 years old and lived at 135 West 16th Street.

title: Newly Says Labor Will Need 10% Pay Increase This Year
description: BAL HARBOUR, Fla., Feb. 12George, Meany, the chief spokesman for organized labor, said today that workers would requite wage increases Of at least 10 per cent this Year to catch up with the rise in prices.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: Court Keeps McIntire Off the Air

title: Wilson Gets Wide Power To Handle Energy Crisis
description: ALBANY, Feb. 21The Legislature voted overwhelmingly today to give Governor Wilson broad emergency powers to deal with the energy crisis. He requested such action more than six weeks ago in his State of the State message, but since then he repeatedly has said he would be reluctant to exercise these powers.

title: Barbed Wire to Ring Private Village Where Residents Complain of Crime
description: LAKEWOOD, N. J., Feb. 21 Leistrre Village, a retirement community here that has prided itself in offering its 4,000 residents an escape from the clamor and crime of the cities, is girding its perimeter fence with barbed wire to keep out intruders.

title: MACKELL RELATES VIEW OF CHARGES
description: Thomas J. Mackell, former District Attorney of Queens acknowledged yesterday at his trial that he had never asked those staff members he knew were Investors in a fast money scheme to sign complaints against the swindler because I didn't want to squeeze any body.

title: Profiles of Those Indicted
description: Angelo D. Roncallo

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: Feb. 22, 1974 GENERAL ASSEMBLY

title: Callas Sings in Toronto
description: TORONTO, Feb. 21 (Canadian Press)Maria Callas and the tenor Giuseppe Di Stefano were greeted at their recital here tonight by a standing ovation and showers of roses from the balconies. But about 400 seats in the 2,800seat Massey Hall were empty when the concert began. There had been some speculation the 50yearold prima donna might not appear. She had abruptly cancelled her Carnegie Hall comeback concert in New York last Sunday night because of a respiratory infection.

title: Excerpts From Kissinger's Talk at Mexico City Conference
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 21Following are excerpts from the prepared text, supplied by the State Department, of the address by Secretary of State Kissinger at the Western Hemisphere conference in Mexico City.

title: Adgate Wins U.S. Slalom Title
description: HENNIKER, N. H., Feb. 21  Tenyearold Mathew Lyon of the nearby Munsonvidile School tugged on Cary Adgate's wrist this morning after the international skier from Boyne City, Mich., had completed his first run in the national slalom championships at Pat's Peak.

title: Admiral Denies Telling Yeoman To Take Highly Classified Data
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 21 Rear Adm. Robert O. Welander denied today that he ever ordered or directed a Navy yeoman to pilfer highly classified documents while the two men worked together in the White House in 1971.

title: Watergate Grand Jury Charges a Nixon Democrat With Perjury
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 21The first indictment stemming from Leon Jaworski's investigation into political campaign pledges by milk producers was handed up today in Federal District Court here.

title: Maryland Official Demands Resignation of Energy Chief
description: BALTIMORE, Feb. 21 (UPI)Calling Maryland's gasoline shortage its greatest crisis since the Civil War, Norman E. Polovoy, the Deputy State Attorney General, demanded today that William E. Simon resign ast he Federal energy chief.

title: Overseas Borrowers Study Markets in U.S.
description: Debt markets in the United States are being studied by several overseas borrowers, several of them contemplating public or private placements of bonds.

title: Modest Rise in '74 Net Is Predicted at Gall Oil
description: B. R. Dorsey, chairman of the Gulf Oil Corporation, told New York securities analysts yesterday that the company expected a modest increase in 1974 profits from the $800million reported for 1973.

title: A Listing of Recently Published Books
description: GENERAL

title: Intercity Truck Tonnage Up in Week and for Year
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 21  The American Trucking Associations, Inc., reported intercity truck tonnage last week was 4.6 per cent over the corresponding period last year. Tonnage last week was 5.5 per cent over the immediately preceding week.

title: 8 Market Countries Said to Ask For a Delay on Oil Policy Talks
description: BRUSSELS, Feb. 21Diplomatic sources said today that all Common Market countries except France had decided to ask the United States to put off the meeting of senior officials on oil policy it had suggested for next Monday in Washington and to convene a preparatory session instead.

title: Last Israelis Quit Suez Bridgehead In Final Pullout From Western Bank
description: CAIRO, Feb. 21Israel's occupation of a bridgehead on the western bank of the Suez Canal ended today as the last Israeli soldiers left the Egyptian area seized in the Middle East war of last October.

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: People and Business
description: As his days in Washington wane, Treasury Secretary George P. Shultz waxes increasingly philosophical. Explaining the country's malaise over inflation, the energy crisis, environmental problems and other current traumas, the Secretary said yesterday that on many deep issues we have let go of the old moorings and we have not yet found the new moorings, new commonly held beliefs that we can use to sustain ourselves.

title: Rangers 53 Victors Over Kings
description: INGLEWOOD, Calif., Feb. 21The New York Rangers got back to National Hockey League business tonight against the Los Angeles Kings, with Emile Francis cracking the whip as coach again. The Rangersin pursuit of the East Division runnerup spothoped to restore their old domination over the Kings.

title: Freer Market for Sugar Urged by Industrial Users
description: (AP)A spokesman for industrial users of sugar urged Congress today to repeal the sug ar excise tax, revamp the subsidy payment program and move toward a freer mar1 ket.

title: Byrne Hopes to Close Trenton Prison. As Major Step in Penal Reform Plan
description: TRENTON, Feb. 21  Governor Byrne said today that he hoped to close Trenton State Prison during his administration.

title: About New York Selling the Coat Off Her Back
description: A Mrs. Dullea, who lives in Westchester, but works and shops in New York, went to Bloomingdale's on Washington's Birthday for the sales. She was wearing her one winter coat, which was purple fake velvet, and which, even before she had spilled beer down its front and stained it, she had always thought of as being undistinguished.

title: Smith and Newcombe Victors
Conscience Primer
description: The essential first step in ending the corruption of government administrationeverything that came to fall under the label Watergatewas education of the public. It is one matter for guilt and innocence to be apportioned; that occurs In the process of legal adjudication. It was no less important for the American people to comprehend what responsible officials of their Government had been doing, the enormity of the offenses that were committed against the public trust.

title: Jet Crashes in Indiana
description: WALTON, Ind., Feb. 21 (UPI) An Air Force Reserve jet training plane crashed into a corn field and burned near here today, killing the pilot. The victim was not identified, ending notification of relatives.

title: Meskin Plans to Fight U.S. Ban
description: HARTFORD, Feb. 21  In hopes of averting a statewide shutdown of gasoline stations, Governor Meskill said today that Connecticut would seek to block the order by Federal Energy Administrator William E. Simon prohibiting dealers from treating their regular customers better than rest of the public.

title: Private Is Charged In Theft of Copter Set Down in Capital
description: FORT MEADE, Md., Feb. 21 (AP)The Army has charged Pfc. Robert K Preston, who brought a stolen Army helicopter down on the White House south lawn, with theft, breach of pdace, damaging Government property and three counts of assault with intent to commit murder.

title: Bill Keys Residence Here To Getting a Job With City
description: ALBANY, Feb. 21  a bill to require all future municipal employes in New York City, including teachers and members of all uniformed services, to live within the city limits was introduced today in both houses of the Legislature.

title: BACHE & CO. PROFIT FELL FOR QUARTER
description: Bache & Co., Inc. said yesterday that net income in quarter ended Jan. 31 totaled $1.97million, or 28 cents a share, on revenues of $47.93million. This compared with $2.04million, or 28 cents a share, on revenues of $47.22million in the comparable quarter of 1973.
